loans.name: Mrs. Yeing Thea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeing T., age 32, is a villager in Saing Sarinn village in Takeo province. She is the village bank president of this group loan and was selected by its ten members. The members of this village loan will use heir individual portions of the loan to support their individual business purposes.
 
Mrs. Yeing T. and her husband, Mr. Khorn Chroeng, are pig breeders who are able to earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Yeing T. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more piglets to support her pig breeding efforts. In addition to farming, Mrs. Yeing T. is a grocer and owns a small grocery store. They have five children: two are very young and the others are students at the local school. 

Mr. Sopheap Men is a group guarantor, so he is in the photo, too.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her pig breeding business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof on his house for his family

loans.name: Min Maiya

texts.en:
"This is 21 year old Min Maiya L..  She is married and has no children. In 2010, she established her grocery business. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to purchase grocery goods. In the future, Min Maiya plans to expand her shop. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr:
Daba T. est une femme de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 19 novembre 2004. Elle a 11 fois de suite reçu de crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICROFINANCE.

Elle fait de l"embouche ovine et bovine. Elle mène cette activité depuit plus de 5 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter 15 moutons à raison de 20.000 francs CFA l'unité et une paire de bœufs à 150.000 francs CFA. Elle va également acheter de l'aliment de bétail et du foin. Elle va engraisser les animaux pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. 

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Daba T. is 56 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the WALIDANE Banc Villageois since November 19, 2004. She has had 11 consecutive loans from CAURIE-MICROFINANCE. She has been raising sheep and cattle for more than 5 years. With her new loan, she is going to buy 15 sheep at the rate of 20,000 francs CFA each and a pair of cattle for 150,000 francs CFA. She is also going to buy livestock feed and hay. She is going to fatten the animals for 5 months before selling them in the weekly markets in her locality. Her goal is to contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions, while also increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and cattle

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo tiene como principal actividad económica la compra - venta de ladrillos, vive en la zona San Miguel de Alpacoma, esta zona se caracteriza por albergar a más de cincuenta fábricas artesanales de ladrillos,  lamentablemente hace seis años el tuvo que emigrar a la Argentina gracias a Dios el pudo ahorrar dinero con el que se compró un terreno y pudo iniciar su propio negocio de compra - venta de ladrillos en su propio país. Gracias a su esfuerzo el posee un terreno y una casa propios, ahora el trabaja para poder terminar de construir su casa, su esposa lo ayuda con otra actividad que es la venta de pescado crudo en ferias provinciales. El deseo de don Eduardo es sacar a su familia adelante trabajando día y noche sin importar el cansancio solo por el bienestar de su familia. El crédito le sirvió para incrmentar su capital de trabajo comprando una cantidad grande de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a brick merchant. He lives in the San Miguel de Alpacoma zone, an area that is known for having more than fifty artisanal brick factories. Unfortunately he had to emigrate to Argentina six years ago but, thanks to God, he was able to save money with which he bought a piece of property which enabled him to start his own brick business back in his own country. Thanks to his efforts he owns a piece of property and his own home. Now he works in order to be able to finish building his house. His wife helps out with her own business selling fish in provincial markets. Eduardo’s wish is to work day and night regardless of fatigue to have his family succeed, everything for his family’s wellbeing. The loan was to increase his working capital buying a large amount of bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy B. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Mercy is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mercy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mercy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Alicia is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a store selling rice and corn grits, canned goods, noodles, dried fish and bagoong in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be Alicia's sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business by purchasing addtitional products

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
el sr. Agapito S. O. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica a la fabricacion de mosaicos, mantiene clientes fijos que le realizan pedidos todos los meses, debido a que siempre tiene bastantes pedidos tiene la ayuda de dos empleados.
El credito lo utilizara para la compra de Cemento y arena.
en estos momentos tiene un pedido un poco grande y necesita comprar los materiales para tener mas produccion, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Agapito S. O. is 59 years old and lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood.  He works manufacturing tiles.  He has regular customers who place orders every month, and because he has enough orders, he has the help of two employees.  

He will use the loan for the purchase of cement and sand.  He currently has a large order and he needs to buy materials to increase production.  

His earnings are necessary to cover household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of cement and sand

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 39 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Poste Blanco del distrito D. Paiján, el lugar pertenece a L. provincia D. Ascope y se encuentra ubicado en L. región L. Libertad, a más D. dos horas y media D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a L. comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, elL. ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario brindándoles un trato amable, por lo que siempre cuenta con una clienteL. estable. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. L. economía D. su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más mercadería D. modo que pueda satisfacer L. demanda D. sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para ayudar a su familia a mejorar su calidad D. vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable y servicial.
texts.en:
María is a 39 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Poste Blanco neighborhood of Paiján district in the province of Ascope, in the region of L. Libertad, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

María sells groceries in a store located in her own home.  She offers her customers a range of basic products with a friendly service which means that she always has a stable customer base.  The business has allowed her to help her husband contribute to the family's finances.

María would like to expand her business with the purchase of more goods so that she can satisfy her customers' demands.  For this reason she has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

María's biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to help her family to improve their standard of living.  The people who know her consider her to be a friendly and helpful woman.

loans.use: Purchase of basic products and groceries to expand her small grocery store

loans.name: Eliar Jose

texts.es: Eliar José  de 34 años,  tiene una pulpería en donde vende, enlatados, canes, sopas y carnes. Inicio cuando tenía ciertos ahorros, propios fue así que inicio este medio de vida  ya que necesitaba este ingreso necesario para su hogar. El tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo y con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado ampliar su negocio. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días vendiendo golosinas, bebidas, granos, pan y gaseosas Una de las dificultades en estos meses para trabajar en su tienda ha sido la enfermedad de su esposa ya que él se debe encargar de sus hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, granos básicos, pan entre otros. Pues se acerca una buena temporada y quiere ofrecer de todo.
texts.en: Eliar José is 34 years old.  He has a small grocery store in which he sells canned goods, soups and meat.  He started his business when he had a certain amount of savings.  He started the business as he needed the income for his family.  He has two dependent children in his care and, over time, he has managed to expand his business.  He works from 6 in the morning until 9 at night every day selling candies, soft drinks, grains, bread and soda.  One of the recent difficulties he has had in working in his store has been his wife's illness since this means that he also has to take care of his children.  He will use his loan to buy drinks, basic grains and bread, amongst other products since a good season is approaching and he wants to be able to offer everything to his customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive en su propia casa con su familia, él tiene 61 años de edad.
Él se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura desde que era niño, actualmente el cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para hacer el trabajo y además paga mozos para que también ayuden,  Don José está solicitando un préstamo para comprar terneros de repasto, con esta ayuda el estará atendiendo a más ganado e ira progresando con su negocio.
Su proyección es seguir trabajando los terrenos, aumentar poco a poco el número de ganado, cultivar maíz y recibir buenas cosechas para continuar ayudando a sus hijos a tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José Carlos farms and raises cattle.  He lives in the El Transito department of San Miguel, and lives in his own house with his family.  He is 61 years old.

He has been raising cattle and farming since he was a child.  Now his children help him with the work.  He also pays young men to help him.  Don José is asking for a loan to buy feeder calves.  With the help of this loan, he will have more cattle and will make progress with his business.  

His goal is to continue working the land, gradually increasing the number of cattle, growing corn and having good harvests in order to continue helping his children earn more.

loans.use: Purchase of feeder calves

loans.name: Masikilizano Group

texts.fr: F. K. est entrepreneur, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 11 enfants.  Seulement 6 enfants  étudient  et les 5 autres n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers. Son époux est chauffeur d’un privé.  Elle vend l’huile de palme.  Elle  commença son business  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son époux ayant une valeur de 30$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché sectoriel du quartier Ndosho. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  3 bidons d’huile de palme. En plus, elle ambitionne réaliser un fonds pour scolariser ses enfants. La cliente F. K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Masikilizano est constitué de 34 membres.
texts.en: F. K. is an entrepreneur who is 34 years old and the mother of 11 children. Only 6 of her children are in school, the others do not attend school for the lack of financial resources. Her husband is a private chauffeur. She sells palm oil. She started out her business with her own money, funds that were given to her by her husband totalling $30. Later she received her first loan from IMF Hekima in the amount of $50. She has her business in the market located in the Ndosho quarter. Her new loan will be used to purchase 3 barrels of palm oil. She hopes to raise enough money to send her kids to school. F. K. is grateful to the Hekima organization for their efforts to cater to the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The group named Masikilizano is made up of 34 members.

loans.use: acheter 3 bidons d’huile de palme

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo E. is from the village of San Andres. He is 52 years old. Danilo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo plants and harvests rice for sale. Danilo has been engaged in his business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marcia Pastora

texts.es: Marcia Pastora de 45 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED desde hace 25 años en la Escuela San Nicolas del Municipio de San Esteban. Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de poner las verjas al porchecito de su casa, ya que solo tiene levantado la pared hasta la mitad y desea ponerle verjas al resto y contar con mayor seguridad. Expresa que gracias a los creditos obtenidos en AFODENIC ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su casita y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de esta para continuar mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia Pastora, 45, is single.  She’s been employed by the Ministry of Education for 25 years at the town of San Esteban’s San Nicolás School.  She is asking for her 8th loan to install iron grilles on her house’s porch because the walls are only built up half way and she wants to install grilles on the rest in order to have better security.

She expresses her thanks for the loans gotten at AFODENIC.  She has been able to gradually improve her little house and hopes to continue to be able to count on this support in order to continue to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To install iron grilles on the porch.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel S. is thirty years old and married. He is from the village of Bantuanon, a part of the municipality of Lantapan, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Rocel runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which he sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks, biscuits, detergents and toothpaste to the local community. Rocel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rocel joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services.  He successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Rocel is requesting a new loan,  of 15,000 PHP his fourth loan from HSPFI that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snacks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
40-year-old Joseph M. is married with six children who all attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years in a town called Kitale in western Kenya. His farm produces maize, milk and beans which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand his poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children. His major challenges have been poultry diseases and fluctuation in the market prices of his products. He plans to venture into keeping exotic birds in the future.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Li

texts.en: Li M., age 38, sells meatballs and grilled beef in front of her sister’s house in Phnom Penh City. Lim M. has been running this business since 2006, and makes an income of approximately $3.5 per day to help meet the needs of her family. Her husband is a motor taxi driver as well as a photographer. Her husband takes her to her selling place each day before he starts providing his taxi service. Unfortunately, his motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Li M. has decided to seek a loan of $800 from Kiva to replace his broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace broken motorbike

loans.name: Henri Joseph

texts.fr:
Homme de 36ans  marié et père de trois enfants dont l’âge varie de 9mois à 9ans. Il a un moulin à farine de manioc depuis 1997. Il à des ventes journalière 15000 à 30000 francs.
avec ce prêt il veux renforcer son activité en achetant un deuxième moulin à farine de manioc ainsi que deux sacs de farine de manioc pour la vente.
  Sa stratégie est d’épargner car il aimerait créer une entreprise agro- industrielle.
Son souhait est de voir ses enfants évoluer dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This 36-year-old man is married with three children ranging in age from 9 months to 9 years old. He has had a cassava flour mill since 1997. His daily sales reach 15,000 to 30,000 francs.

With this loan, he plans to strengthen his business by buying a second cassava flour mill and two sacks of cassava flour for resale.

His strategy is to save in order to start an agro-based industry. He wishes to see his children pursue extensive studies.

loans.use: to buy a cassava flour mill and sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one child who attends school. Her husband is a driver and he supports his family financially. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business  in a shop where neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. 

With the 80,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase a motorcycle and bundles of clothes for resale. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of competition from those who sell similar products. She dreams of building her own house in the future. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the society.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Kullacas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS” iniciará su ciclo veinte y siete en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por once  integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Janneth.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: fabricación de cotillones, cerrajería, venta de trabas, venta de lentes, venta de coca, ropa para niños.
 
La señora Janneth, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es su segundo ciclo que trabaja con  Pro Mujer y que ingreso por la invitación.

En la actualidad la señora Janneth tiene un negocio de venta de coca, con el que trabaja hace siete años; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, porque ella le ayudaba hace años. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de mercadería (coca), la que compra generalmente de Villa Fátima (en la ciudad de La Paz). Comenta que esta coca la vende todos los días de forma ambulante, porque ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud.

Las persona que no aprarese en la fotografia la señora Elsa, quien posó pero estuvo un poco distraida.
texts.en:
The “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS” community bank is about to start its 27th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eleven members and its president is Janneth.  The businesses that the group members are engaged in are varied and include: making party supplies, providing locksmith services, selling hair clips, selling lenses, selling coca leaf and selling children's clothes.

Janneth is the president of the community bank.  She informs us that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer and that she was invited to join.

Janneth has a business selling coca leaf.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She tells us that she learned the business from her mom because she used to help her years ago.  Janneth will use her loan to buy merchandise (coca) which she generally buys in Villa Fátima (in the city of La Paz).  She says that she sells coca every day as an itinerant street vendor because she doesn't have a fixed sales location.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

The person who does not appear in the photo is Elsa. She posed but was a little distracted.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (coca leaf)

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 42 years old and married with six children. Four of her children go to school. Lucia is in the fish-selling business and is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, Lucia hopes to increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  She and her husband are both farmers who practice both animals and plants farming. This had been their business for a period of 10 years with an income of 13,000 KES every month. 

This will be Magdaline's first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. She wants to use her loan to buy farm inputs such as chicken feeds and fertilizers for the farm and especially, since the planting season has started. 

She hopes to own a greenhouse, see her children receive quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as chicks feeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: La Sra. Juana María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de dos hijos la que se ha dedicado con esmero a educarlos de la mejor manera, se desempeña como maestra de primaria con muchos años de experiencia. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en gastos universitarios de uno de sus hijos el cual está estudiando en el extranjero por tal razón decidió solicitar su segundo crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad y por ende ayudarle en la preparación profesional a su hijo ya que como madre abnegada es la herencia que les puede dejar.
texts.en: Juana Maria is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. She is the single mother of two children and she has dedicated herself diligently to give them a better education. She works as a primary school teacher and she has many years' experience. One of the needs she faces is to acquire a loan to invest in the university studies of one of her children. He is studying outside the country. For this reason she has requested a second loan from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). Her objective is to meet her need and therefore to help her son achieve his professional training. As a selfless mother, it is the inheritance that she can give them.

loans.use: to cover her son's university expenses.

loans.name: Mutava

texts.en:
Mutava is married and has five children. He operates a cafeteria to earn a living for his family. It has been eleven years since he started the business.  

Mutava has employed two people to assist him in his business. He is a hardworking man who hopes to improve his business and become financially stable in five years. He has requested for his first loan from Faulu Kenya. With 20,000 KES, he will buy maize flour, charcoal, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, charcoal, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 38 years old. She has five children who are between 2-13 years old. They are all in school except for the youngest. Her husband does some construction work. Clementine sells vegetables including tomatoes, etc, other foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum together with other items such as biscuits, matches, and candles.  She has been doing this business for the past three years and her business is going well. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and get herself out of poverty. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs so that her business is expanded and she makes more profits. She plans to expand her business with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mithak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Mithak has had a barber shop since 2007 where he offers shaving and massage services.
He is very experienced and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,200 loan to pave and paint his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pave and paint his shop.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau, 39, is single. She lives with her parents in a small house located in Ho Chi Minh City. Chau supports her family through the income that she earns running a general store in front of her house. Chau sells a small range of products in her store.

Chau would like to receive a loan to expand her business by buying additional stock such as pens, notebooks, toilet paper, confectionery and snack foods to sell. She hopes that an expanded range of products will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract new customers.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and provide additional support to her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as stationery, confectionery and snack foods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elena Graciela

texts.es:
Elena Graciela tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera vive con sus hijos de 21, 15 y 7 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Elena  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es ampliar su producción  y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Elena Graciela is 45 years old, single, and lives with her children (ages 21, 15, and 7) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Elena is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys her supplies at Briones Agrochemicals and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn. She will buy composts and supplies for her crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in her farming activities. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). Her dream is to expand production so that her children can get ahead.

Elena enjoys completing her household chores.

loans.use: to purchase compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 26-year-old hardworking man living in a family house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build rental houses since they are on high demand. He sells used shoes that he takes to all surrounding markets, and has been in this business for six years. He has challenges of high transportation costs, and he desires to buy his own transportation means. Francis needs this loan facility to buy used shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy used shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Sofala, tem 39 anos de idade, é casado pai de 3 filhos todos vão a Escola. Fez o ensino médio Proficional. Vive na casa propria com sua familia  e responsabiliza se pela sua irmã que vive com ele na mesma casa. Consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria  pos conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também é Docente.

Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha após cocluir seu curso de Professorado e fixa sua residência, trabalha ha mais de 23 anos no periodo das 7h as 12h, mas devido ao cargo de Direstor da Escola tem prolongado ate as 17h auferindo mensalmente 5.655.00mt e com um subcidio técnico de 1.590.00 que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra de construcao da sua casa convencional.

Ja trabalhou com o BIM conhece a hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas. Este é seu  terceiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa( blocos. Cimento e areia) para conclusão da sua obra. Os anteriores de 10.000.00 e 30.000.00mt foram para a mesma finalidade. Esta prestes a pagar antes do tempo e solicitar outro para concluir os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Bonifacio was born in Sofala Province. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children who all go to school. Bonifacio has taken teacher training. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his sister, who lives with him. He is able to save 1,000 meticais in his bank account because he has help from his wife, who is also a teacher.

Bonifacio moved to Namaacha District after finishing his teaching courses and made his home here. For more than 23 years he has worked from 7:00 am until 12:00 pm, but because he is the school Principal he stays until 5:00 pm. He earns 5,655 meticais per month and has a subsidy of 1,590 meticais, which he uses for household expenses. He also uses the money for construction on his house.

He has worked before with BIM (Millennium bim Bank). He learned about Hluvuku from his coworkers. This is Bonifacio's third Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 16,000 meticais to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, cement and sand) so he can finish building. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais and 30,000 meticais, and both were for the same purpose.

Bonifacio is ready to pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, cement and sand).

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbours and to passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her biggest dream is to expand and purchase another machine in the future.

With the KES 20,000 Floriana wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, tiene la edad de 34  años, está casada y vive con sus hijos y esposo. Ella con el crédito va comprar más pollos para su posterior venta. Ella cuenta con una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde y quiere aumentar la cantidad de pollos a su poder. Ella con el crédito quiere ayudarle a su esposo con las responsabilidades y ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica. Al igual piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y quieren poder seguir brindarles sus estudios para que sean profesionales en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cristina is 34 years old. She is married and lives with her children and her husband. With the loan, she is going to buy more chickens for later sale. She has a little chicken farm where she fattens them, and she wants to increase the number of chickens in her possession. With the loan, she wants to help her husband with their responsibilities and offer their children greater economic stability. In the same way, she thinks of the future of their children, and they want to be able to continue offering them an education so that they can have careers in the future. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui tient dans une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires dans sa ville .Il est recemment marié et n'a pas encore d'enfants.Il soutient toutefois, avec son activité, sa famille notamment, ses deux parents et ses frères et soeurs.Il sollicite auprés de l'UIMCEC un pret de 200000f pour acheter du sucre, du riz, de l'huile, du savon , du lait et d'autres produits de consommation courante.Il ambitionne d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente en gros au centre ville.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who has a grocery store in his city. He recently got married and has no children yet. Still, he supports his family, especially his two parents and his brothers and sisters, through his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to buy some sugar, rice, oil, soap, milk, and other typical consumer items. His ambition is to open a large wholesale store in the downtown area.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, soap, milk, and other typical consumer goods

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah has successfuly finished paying her previous Kiva loan, and she and her family are doing fine. She want to take out another loan to start a boutique and beauty salon. She is requesting 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a blow-dryer and cosmetics, and also to rent a new shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a blow-dryer and cosmetics, and also to rent a new shop for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and widowed. She has five children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 50 years of age. She is very active and sews clothes to support her family financially. She works for clients in her community and earns good profits every month due to the quality of her work.

Her husband operates a barber shop in the market. He is an expert in cutting hair. He also offers beauty treatments to his customers from his barber shop.

Nasreen has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son also operates a barber shop while her daughter stays at home and helps Nasreen with her household tasks.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband's business. He wants to buy scissors, shaving gel and beauty products to improve his services. Nasreen’s husband is experienced in his business and Nasreen is confident that this loan will be beneficial for him.

loans.use: to buy scissors, shaving gel and beauty products for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Santa C. cuenta 59 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija  a cargo la cual se llama Anahi  se encuentra cursando 6º grado de primaria, su esposo se llama Ponciano él se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende carne y comida lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para la comida y la carne como son: jitomate, chile, cebolla, aceite, condimentos, pollos, etc. ella espera que su negocio le funcione muy bien ya que las ganancias le ayudan para la escuela de su hija doña santa C. le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco.

Santa C. pertenece al grupo la amistad el cual se llama así porque está integrado por puros amigos el grupo tiene 10 miembros 1 hombre y 9 mujeres a continuación serán mencionados: SantaC., Francisca, María, Víctor Manuel, Magali, Rubisela, Lucila, Ivett, Adalberta, todos realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de ropa, bebidas, productos de abarrotes, comida, etc.
texts.en:
SantaC., 59, is married and has a daughter in her care called Anahí who is in 6th grade; her husband is called Ponciano and is a farmer.

She is a merchant; she sells meat and food and will use the loan to buy the ingredients she uses for the food and the meat like: tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, oil, condiment, chicken, etc.  She hopes that her business will function well because profits will help for her daughter’s school.  SantaC. would like her business to grow a little.

SantaC. belongs to the “La Amistad” group named like that because it’s composed of only friends.  It has 10 members, one man and 9 women who will be listed next: SantaC., Francisca, María, Víctor Manuel, Magali, Rubisela, Lucila, Ivett, Adalberta, Santacurz.  They all carry out commercial activities such as: clothing sales, beverages, groceries, food, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she uses.

loans.name: Isata J

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Isata.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 5, 7 and 14. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her.  

In 2001, Isata established her business selling  clothes. She began her business after graduating from a technical school in Freetown. She sells mainly to young ladies and old men. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1, 200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Isata requires the loan in order to  increase stock for the boutique. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Isata plans to move the shop to the middle of the town and support her children’s education. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for dresses for her business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay is a 39-year-old married woman who is in the business of cultivating rice crops in the Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. In addition, she is a plastic kindling maker at home. She typically earns an average of $5.00 per day to cover the household needs through the two businesses. Presently, she has 3 single children who depend on her income and are attending school so she has to try hard to pay for their allowances and education. 

With the loan of $1,000, she’ll buy some spare parts to replace the broken ones in her plowing machine. With the remaining funds, she will purchase a trailer that can be used to connect to the back of the plowing machine in order to transport heavy things from place to place. This loan will make it possible for her to sustain her farming business. She is very grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts to replace the broken ones in her plowing machine.

loans.name: Lucho

texts.es: El señor Lucho es artesano zapatero y se dedica a la confección  y reparación de zapatos. Lucho tiene contratos para entregar cuatro docenas de zapatos en forma semanal. El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su vivienda, pues necesita cementar el patio y su casa necesita ser pintada. Lucho es casado y tiene cuatro  hijos. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en: Sr. Lucho is a seasoned shoemaker.  He produces and repairs shoes.  Lucho has contracts in which he must deliver four dozen shoes on a weekly basis.  The loan he is requesting will be used for home improvements.  He needs to apply cement on his patio and his house needs to be painted.  Lucho is married and has four children.  He lives in his own home in the District of Río Seco in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing his patio and painting his house.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with 4 children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elsa is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase sacks of feed and medicine.

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elsa hopes to be successful in her business for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed and medicine

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Sa Ang district, Mao is 43 years old and has three children. She has been growing vegetables and sugarcane with her husband as the family's main source of income to support their living.

Mao has been with VisionFund for five years. The previous loans have helped her to make a better living. She completely paid back her last loan with VisionFund, and she is now requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation and also to make pickled vegetables to sell. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her vegetables successfully, and she also hopes to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mejumaa has operated a business selling mats for the past 12 years. In addition, she sells lesos (kanga). Her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of products due to inflation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase sisal fibers for weaving her mats and some pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sisal fibers and lesos (kanga)

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
Alik lives in bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Alik heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras  está empezando su 1er ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas están con una gran predisposición de viajar y mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. La encuesta mostró que 12 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza con ingresos muy bajos.
Francisca es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de todo tipo, en su copetín, como ser galletitas, gaseosas, golosinas y comestibles. Cuenta que por medio de su esfuerzo y su sacrificio está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, y comestibles, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras is starting its first cycle in the committee program. All its members are eager to travel and improve their lives. They are completing the poverty elimination survey in order to determine each of their situations. The survey showed that twelve of them live below the poverty line on very low income.

Francisca belongs to this group. She works selling all kinds of products from her small food counter, like cookies, sodas, sweets, and food items. She says that her effort and sacrifice have allowed her to provide her family with everything they need so that they don't have to suffer any kind of hardship.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in purchasing soda, sweets, and food items. This will allow her to keep working and improving her and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy soda, candy, and food items.

loans.name: Sainte Antoine Group

texts.fr: SAINTE ANTOINE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Roberte Cica Tchedeme (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Roberte Cica Tchedeme est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Olivier. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Roberte Cica Tchedeme et son mari. Pour cette raison, Roberte Cica Tchedeme vend de la nourriture( pâte accompagnée de sauce) depuis une trentaine d'année, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Roberte Cica Tchedeme s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Roberte Cica Tchedeme sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SAINTE ANTOINE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres.

loans.name: Nellys Maria

texts.en:
My name is Nellys J., I sell clothing such as blouses, T-shirts, shoes, hairpins, and brushes. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in the city of Danli. Due to the death of my father, I have had to look for other means to support my home and family. My goal is to increase my inventory and to improve sales and with the profits, I can remodel the house, make sure my family is fed and to finance the studies of my younger brothers.

Loan Use: Purchase clothing, shoes, combs, hairpins, brushes, blouses, T-shirts.

Mi nombre es Nellys J., me dedico a la venta de ropa como ser camisas, camisetas, zapatos, ganchos de pelo, cepillos para pelo, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años y esta ubicado en la ciudad de Danli, debido a la muerte de mi padre he tenido que buscar como sustentar mi casa y mi familia, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario y asi poder tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias poder remodelar mi casa, atender las necesidades alimenticias de mi familia y el estudio de mis hermanitos.

loans.use: Compra de ropa, zapatos, tenedores, ganchos de pelo, cepillos, camisas, camisetas

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela has been in this line of business for the past four years. She has great talent and understands the market for all kinds of handicrafts. The business specializes in fine mats, Samoan war weapons, and other handicrafts. Samoa is host to many tourists throughout the year so the handicrafts she creates never just lie around. There are also many Samoan occasions that create the need for these handicrafts so she is never left with too many at one time.

loans.use: To buy paint, flax and chicken feathers to improve the standard and design of created handicrafts

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som C. works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh earning $6/day.  She is 33 years old and has 1 young child with her husband (pictured here) who earns $1/day working as a soldier.  She will use this loan to build her family's first proper house.  In the future, she would like to buy a stall at the market to sell vegetables.

loans.use: To build home

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 56 years old and her husband is 54.  They have 4 children.  2 daughters are still at home - age 22 and 21 years.  They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  While her husband trades tobacco, she raises chickens, fish and cows, and works on the ricefields.  She is requesting a loan to buy 30 chickens and 10 dogs.  In Vietnam, dog meat is a traditional delicacy and most people eat it during winter because the meat warms you up.  It's quite expensive, so she hopes to make a good profit with this investment.  At the moment her profit is $ 31.25 per month.

loans.use: She wants to buy 30 chickens and 10 dogs

loans.name: Gulam Abas

texts.en: Gulam Abas lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two sons. He is happy. His business has been the only source of income for his family. His sons are in school. He is supporting them. He is a tailor, and he has a small shop. He wants to take a group loan to get a larger shop and expand his business to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is married with two children. To improve her family's quality of life, she decided to start her own business selling food items. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 375 to improve the quality of service rendered to her customers. Joy trusts she will be able to repay the loan in 8 months. She thanks you.

loans.use: To more foodstuffs for resale in her little shop

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio is 56 years old and married to Ceferina Brizuela. They have four children together and all of them are currently residing in Spain.

Amancio used to work as a bus driver in the city center and later became a school bus driver, which he still does.

He is a very hard-working and honest person, starting his day very early in the morning, and that sacrifice has borne fruit. With earnings from his job, he's been able to start a convenience store that his wife runs.

Amancio is requesting a loan so he can repair his bus and purchase parts to keep it running.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Amancio Ramírez tiene 56 años, esta casado con la señora Ceferina Brizuela, ellos tienen 4 hijos y todos se encuentran actualmente residiendo en España.

Don Amancio en principio trabajaba como transportista alternativo en el centro de la ciudad, después consiguió la habilitación y permiso para ser transportista escolar y actualmente se dedica a ese rubro.

El señor Ramírez es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta, inicia sus actividades desde muy tempranas horas de mañana, y dicho sacrificio ya le ha dado sus frutos; con las ganancias ha logrado montar una despensa la cual es atendida por su esposa.

Amancio necesita reparar su vehículo y comprar nuevos repuestos para mantener en condiciones su vehículo.

loans.use: Repair vehicle

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is a dedicated mother. Since her husband left her she has become both father and mother to her two small children. Ever since she was a little girl she was interested in artisan work, knitting sweaters and jackets, then becoming independent and having her family. With much effort she was able to buy a knitting machine, a tool with which she makes a great variety of clothing items that she then sends outside the country to sell. This enterprising mother also offers cooking (catering) services at different events in her neighborhood, delighting everyone with her delicious meals and recipes at many gatherings. This hard-working and exemplary mother tries at all times to teach her children the dignity and value of work, and she now hope to prosper by being able to export large quantities of her merchandise. To make her plans reality she need to obtain a loan. With your help you will strengthen and support Candelaria’s work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Candelaria es una dedicada madre. Desde que su esposo la dejó se convirtió en padre y madre de sus dos pequeños hijos. Desde pequeña sintió un especial interés por la artesanía, tejido de chompas y chalecos, luego de independizarse y formar su familia, con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar su máquina de tejer; herramienta con el que elabora gran variedad de prendas de vestir para luego enviarlas al extranjero para su debida comercialización. De manera adicional esta emprendedora madre se dedica a brindar sus servicios de cocina en los diferentes compromisos que existe en su localidad, deleitando así con sus deliciosos platillos y recetas a la gran cantidad de concurrentes. Esta laboriosa y ejemplar madre trata en todo momento de inculcar en cada uno de sus hijos sus conocimientos y sobre todo el valor dignificativo del trabajo, con el que ahora desea prosperar hasta lograr exportar en grandes cantidades su mercadería. Para concretar sus planes requiere obtener un préstamo. Con tu ayuda permitirás el fortalecimiento de la labor de Candelaria.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials in order to keep making her beautiful clothing items

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca and Benjamina have both been members of the community bank “Universo” for two years. In that time they have learned how to run their businesses more efficiently, and to be punctual. They have also learned how to care for their health and avoid sickness. They say that they enjoy the community bank and look forward to meetings every week.

Francisca is 25 and has two young children. Four years ago Francisca moved to Ayacucho from Lima and opened a juice stand. Since then her business has continued to grow.

Benjamina is 47 and has two adult children. She has bees selling emolliente, a traditional beverage maD. from herbs and served warm, for 27 years.

Francisca and Benjamina each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying fruit, sugar, and herbs.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Francisca and Benjamina are saving to buy a piece of land in Lima and to invest more in their business. Their dreams are to own a house in Lima and that their children will have a better life and steady jobs.

loans.use: Francisca and Benjamina each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying fruit, sugar, and herbs.

loans.name: Sevdalin

texts.en: Sevdalin C. lives in the town of Smolian, Bulgaria. He is married with one child. His wife has her own flower-selling business. Sevdalin used to work as a brigade leader in a big factory but four years ago he founded his own workshop and started a carpentry business. He produces wooden frameworks and is recognized as one of the best producers in the region.  Sevdalin needs $1,000 (1,300 BNG) to buy a new grind machine for his business.

loans.use: To buy a new grind machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. sells rice and mineral water. Her husband is a Lotto agent and they have three children. She wishes to expand her business to generate more income and help support the family.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 2 years old. Fatuma sells charcoal and firewood. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a hard-working mother who, after observing her family’s pressing needs as they developed, took the initiative to offer stockings and other similar items as a peddler in the fairs in her community. She wishes to increase her working capital, and for this reason she makes this important request since it will also enable to offer better variety.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina, es una trabajadora madre de familia, que observando las necesidades de apremiantes de su familia conforme estos se iban desarrollando, tomó la iniciativa de ofertar medias y demás artículos interiores de manera ambulante en las ferias de su comunidad.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y a esta razón atiende su importante petición ya que con el incremento también habrá mayor oferta.

loans.use: Purchase capital to offer a greater variety of garments.

loans.name: Gf Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
To fight against hunger and poverty, five women from the Mbour suburb neighborhood united into a group called Dioubo. With a first loan of 2,500,000 CFA, they started a small business of selling fruits and vegetables in their neighborhood. Today, each woman manages her own business activities and the income from the business helps them take care of themselves and their families.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Pour lutter contre la pauvrete fiminime cinq femmes d'un quartier de la banlieu de mbour se sont réunies au sein d' un groupe dénommé dioubo entante en wolof .Avec un premier pret de 2500000f cfa,elles ont démarré une activité de vente de fruits et légumes dans leur quartier.Ajourd'hui chacune d'elle gere ses propres activités de commerce.Les revenus tirés de l'activité leur perttent de se prendre en charge .

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Ms. Hilaria G. is single and lives in her own house with one of her daughters. Both of her daughters are now adults, and one of them emigrated to Spain in search of work and better opportunities, and she sends money to her mother from there to help with the responsibilities of the house.

Hilaria has a business located in one of the most visited markets called Market Number 5. This is located in the exact center of the city, and every day a large number of people come to this place to buy their basic needs as well as for lunch, hence the variety of business found there is plenty.

Hilaria dedicates herself to the sale of fruits and homemade sweets in her stand. Hilary starts her day early; at 4 .m. she’s already going to buy her merchandise to later go to her stand. In addition to the fruits and sweets she also sells refreshments that the people drink with their mates or terere, which are typical Paraguayan drinks.

One of her goals is to grow her business soon, including the equipment and mobility of the business. Today she is asking for a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of seasonal fruits like apples, pears, grapefruits, oranges, plums, and bananas, among others, as well as guaya, milk and mani sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hilaria G., es soltera, vive en su propia casa con una de sus dos hijas. Ambas hijas ya son mayores de edad, una de ella emigro a España en busca de trabajo y mejores oportunidades, ella envía dinero a su madre desde allá para ayudarla con los ingresos de la casa.

Hilaria posee un negocio lo tiene en la entrada misma de uno de los mercados municipales mas concurridos por la población llamado Mercado Nº 5. El mismo está situado en el centro mismo de la ciudad y todos los días una gran cantidad de personas acuden hasta el lugar para surtirse de sus necesidades básicas, al igual que para almorzar pues la variedad de negocios que se encuentran ahí son bastantes.

La señora Hilaria se dedica a la venta de frutas y dulces caseros en su puesto. Hilaria empieza su día a tempranas horas de la madrugada, a las 04:00 am. ella ya va a comprar sus mercaderías para luego ir hasta su local de ventas. Además de las frutas y los dulces, también vende remedios refrescantes que la gente toma con sus mates o tereré que son bebidas típicas en nuestro país.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en cuanto al equipamiento y mobiliario del negocio. Ella hoy solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas de estación como manzanas, peras, pomelos, naranjas, ciruelas, bananas, entre otros al igual que dulces de guayaba, de leche y de maní.

loans.use: Buying seasonal fruits and sweets

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio started his business because his current financial situation is very difficult; he wanted to have enough income to pay for family expenses, especially right now that he has a son. The income he earns from his additional job at a pottery workshop is not enough. He started approximately 5 years ago, by helping a family member. This is how he learned the craft. He had been saving enough money from his job, and once he had enough, he started making his own piñatas in order to sell them on his own.

He needs a loan of US $500 to remodel his shop and make his business more presentable. He wants to increase the space to be able to store piñatas so they will not get damaged and so that they can be displayed appealingly. He plans to repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Antonio inició el negocio porque la situación económica actual es muy difícil, para tener un ingreso extra para completar con los gastos familiares, mas ahora que ya tiene un hijo, ya que con los ingresos que obtiene es su trabajo adicional en un taller de tornos no le alcanza. Comenzó hace 5 años aproximadamente, ayudándole a un familiar, en donde aprendió el oficio, estuvo juntando dinero de su trabajo y cuando tuvo un pequeño capital empezó a elaborar sus propias piñatas para venderlas por su cuenta.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y darle una mejor presentación a su negocio, y tener mayor espacio para el acomodo de las piñatas para que no se maltraten y luzcan bien.

loans.use: Remodel his shop

loans.name: Salohat

texts.ru:
Женщина с большим опытом предпринимательской деятельности Салохат  родилась 1960 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Салохат 8 лет занимается продажей свадебных нарядов. У нее необыкновенно красивые шарфы и накидки с различными  стразами и камнями, разнообразные ткани для национальных платьев (наших мусульманских обрядов) свадебных мероприятий. Местом ее деятельности является оптовый рынок "Корвон". Закупает она товар в Ташкенте и Самарканде.
Салохат для закупа тканей хочет получить займ 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Salohat was born in 1960 an she is a woman with extensive experience in entrepreneurship. She is married and has four children. Salohat has been selling wedding gowns for eight years. She sells incredibly beautiful scarves and headpieces with gemstones and rhinestones, different kinds of fabrics for Tajik national dresses for weddings (particularly for Muslim ceremonies). Her business is located on the wholesale market Kovron. She buys the merchandise in Tashkent and Samarkand. Salohat wants to get a loan for 2,000 somoni ($600USD) to buy fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia, soltera, de 31años de edad, trabaja en el Súper San Antonio, como jefa de personal, con un horario de 12 horas, tiene 2 hijos, una mujer de 12 años y un varón de 6 años ambos estudian la primaria, recibe ayuda del padre de los niños. Sus créditos los ha utilizado para mejorar la vivienda de su mamá ya que ella y sus hijos habitan ahí, con el crédito anterior construyó su dormitorio con buenas condiciones, con piso de ceramica, este crédito lo utilizará para terminar un pequeño muro que está construyendo al frente de la casa, para concluir con el mejoramiento de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia is 31 years of age and single. She works at the San Antonio Supermarket as the personnel manager on a 12-hour shift. She has 2 children, a 12-year-old girl and a 6-year-old boy, who are both in elementary school. She receives help from her children’s father. She has used her previous loans to repair her mother’s house because she and her children live there. She was able to build her bedroom and install tile flooring with her previous loan. She will use this loan in order to finish building a small wall in front of her house so that she can conclude her home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building front wall

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. sells a local meal made out of corn that is popularly known as "kenkey." It is one of the most commonly eaten meals in the country and is normally eaten with fried fish in Kakumdo (near Cape Coast).

Comfort has received no formal education. She is married and has five dependents. She is responsible for paying for house keeping expenses and other utility bills.

Comfort has been selling kenkey for eight years. Her loan will be used to purchase more maize, which she uses to prepare the kenkey, fresh fish, and other ingredients. This will enable her increase her production of the food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into his business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rugs to resell

loans.name: Avei

texts.en: Avei S., 41, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people 3 days a week. Avei is a new member and has not taken previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala (~15USD). SPBD loans are Avei’s only access to capital because she did not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Avei will use the loan to buy farm equipment for her taro business while her husband does the farming.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to maintain her taro farm

loans.name: Cucerova

texts.en: Ms. I. lives in the town of Vulcanesti.  She used to live with her siblings in a village of Vulvanesti town, where she always had to help her parents in the household chores. When she moved to her current residence, she works by herself. She buys fruits and vegetables in Chisinau and sells them  in the wholesale market in Vulvanesti. Her two-year old business is profitable because of steady demand for food products.  She is asking for a loan from MicroInvest, for the first time, to increase the stock of her goods.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods for her fruit and vegetable selling business

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en: Harriet K. is the leader of her group in Jinja. She is a devoted married lady working closely with her husband in their family wholesale shop. They have had the shop for 11 years. Harriet has so far taken 16 loans from her group, each payable in four months. She is so grateful that using the loans has helped her so much in stocking their shop with the desired products in large quantities. They get their products from Kenya, Kampala and some of them in Jinja where prices are low and this has helped to fetch them profits. Recently they were able to transform to selling to some retailers and so far they have not regretted their move. Harriet needs a loan to be able to buy more stock like sugar, soap, cooking oil and Vaseline for her shop.

loans.use: Restocking her family wholesale shop.

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr: Mensah G. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il est propriétaire d’une boutique dans laquelle il a installé divers articles. Il espère avec ce crédit approvisionner sa boutique afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et de gagner plus d’argent pour supporter sa famille.
texts.en:
Mensah G., age 35, is married and the father of 3 children. He owns a shop where he sells various items. With this loan, he hopes to resupply his shop in order to better meet customer demand, and to earn more money to support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various items

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Haydee vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Haydee es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Haydee tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, frutas. Además Haydee vende comida actividad que realiza todos los días.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, harina, azúcar y aceite.
Haydee sueña con aumentar su negocio, educar a sus hijos y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.
texts.en:
Haydee belongs to the "La Paz" community bank. Haydee lives in the community of Yanama which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Haydee is married common-law. She is 33 years old and has four children. Haydee has a store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables, meat and fruit. Haydee also sells prepared food daily. Haydee needs a loan of 1,500 soles to buy rice, flour, sugar and oil. Haydee dreams of increasing her business, educating her children and saving enough for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Bisola

texts.en:
Bisola is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and kerosene.

She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo vive en la calle J. vadani de la zona  Villa Dolores de la ciudad de el Alto

Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos los cuales son mayores de Edad y son independientes.
 

El trabaja como comerciante minorista de manera ambulante en la Ceja de El Alto zona céntrica de la ciudad.


Es el séptimo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo Via Kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Cirilo lives on Calle J. Vadani in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their children, who have grown up and are independent. He works as a walking salesman in La Ceja de El Alto, the central area of the city. This is his seventh loan from Impro and his second from Kiva. He qualified for this loan after undergoing an evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Joyce sells cookies like spring rolls, chips and doughnuts in Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a teacher whose income is too small to support the family. Joyce uses all her income to help her husband in paying the children's school fees. Joyce will use the loan to purchase more flour, oil and other baking ingredients for baking and frying her food. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save and buy a plot of land for building.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Ángela De Jesús

texts.es: Ángela D. Jesús G. D. Z. D. 33 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a sus hijos y su esposo Edén quien aporta  100$ mensuales para los gastos familiares. Ángela se dedica a la venta D. ropa y productos D. belleza como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, cosméticos entre otros y también los días sábado y domingo hace pupusas para vender, Ángela solicita un crédito para surtir su inventario en mercadería D. ropa y cosméticos al igual desea comprar más materia prima para la elaboración D. pupusas, así lograra producir mayor cantidad D. pupusas y aumentara sus ganancias semanales.
texts.en:
Ángela D. Jesús G. D. Z. is 33 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad together with her children and her husband, Edén, who contributes with $100 monthly for the family expenses. Ángela sells clothes and beauty products such as perfumes, body lotion, cosmetics, among others, and on Saturdays and Sundays she makes and sells stuffed tortillas, "pupusas". Ángela requests a loan to supply her inventory of clothes and cosmetics as well as to buy ingredients for the preparation of the stuffed tortillas in order to make more "pupusas" and thus increase her weekly earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply inventory and purchase ingredients for stuffed tortillas

loans.name: Mujeres Con Cristo Group

texts.en:
