Maricela M. leads the group Mujeres Con Cristo which translates to Women With Christ. She is asK. for her fourth loan from Esperanza for her business selling women’s clothes and shoes. She was chosen as the leader for her group because of her vast experience with Esperanza. She formed a new group because she moved to the Samana region, and had to leave her old group behind. Within days of moving to Samana, she easily organized a group of five women to approach Esperanza for a loan. She has the ability to quickly convince these women of how Esperanza can change their lives because it allows them to borrow money to invest in their own businesses.

As I said earlier, Maricela is on her fourth loan from Esperanza, and has an excellent reputation for repayment and for growth in her business. Her group is lucky to have her as a role model for conducting themselves in a successful business manner. She has used her previous three loans to go from selling on a very small scale from inside her home to a business where she is able to go through several neighborhoods each week to sell her products.

Her goals are to keep receiving loans from Esperanza in order to grow her business and to also recruit others in her neighborhood, so they can enjoy the benefits of investing in one’s own business.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothing including shoes, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe y su esposa son propietarios de cuatro vacas lecheras, son productores de leche, la cual venden a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres  hijos;  vive en la comunidad Caluyo Batallas Provincia Los Andes  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Felipe
texts.en:
Felipe and his wife are owners of four dairy cows. They are producers of milk, which they sell to the PIL (Industrial Milk Plant). This is their main source of income with which they cover the maintenance of their three children. They live in the Caluyo Batallas community, Los Andes Province, of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that provides for greater portion of his milk production. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies him for the approval of the loan requested by Felipe.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Marcializa

texts.en:
Marcializa E. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Marcializa is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Marcializa owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Marcializa has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marcializa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcializa is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marcializa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay W. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban Camiguin. He is 35 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jay owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jay is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jay from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers. Its leader, Mrs. In S., 54, has been fisH. with her husband for years. This couple can make their daily income of $4 a day to contribute their family's living expenses. In S. has given birth to four children; two of them are married, while other two are single and also help their parent's fisH.. In S. requests a loan to buy more fisH. tool which she uses to increase her productivity. The other three borrower are:
H., a fish seller, who is asking for a loan to accrue her business capital.
S. is applying for a loan to buy additional tool for fisH..
S. will be using a Kiva loan for capital in order to buy tool for fisH. activity. Note: S. was not available for photograpH., so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tool

loans.name: Eria Francisco

texts.pt:
Eria Francisco C. é natural de Maputo cidade, capital de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, casada e sem filhos. Vive na casa própria com 3 enteados e 1 sobrinho com idades entre 10 a 22 anos e todos vão a escola. Para alem de sua família ela sustenta seu irmão mais velho e sua sogra, enviando alguns produtos alimentares. Iniciou a estudar a 5 anos atrás porque antes não teve condições, neste momento frequenta 5ª classe e pretende continuar ate nível superior. 

Nunca sai de Maputo, é dona do próprio negocio a 7 anos e o seu marido é carpinteiro. Aprendeu a fazer comércio através de seu marido quando trabalhava numa pessoa que fazia negocio e tem esta experiência a mais de 12 anos.
Através do seu negócio consegue ter um rendimento aprox. 5.000.00mt por mês com qual ajuda no sustento da casa e poupa algum com as amigas no sistema tradicional (Xitique).     

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu marido e nunca solicitou empréstimos em outros bancos. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo nesta instituição no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar areia e cimento e outros (para fazer murro de vedação). Os valores anteriores foram de 5.200.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

Os desafios que enfrenta é o elevado custo de material de construção, mesmo assim não desiste de seu objectivo de ver sua casa vedada. No futuro pretende pedir mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Eria Francisco C. is natural from Maputo city, Mozambique's capital. She is 34 years old, married, and has no children. She lives in her own house with three stepsons and one nephew, who are between 10 and 22 years old and go all to school. Besides her family, she supports her older brother and her mother-in-law by sending them some food.

She has started to study 5 years ago because before that she didn’t have conditions to do so. At this moment, she is enrolled at the 5th grade and she intends to continue her studies up to higher education.

She never leaves Maputo. She has been owner of her business for 7 years. Her husband is carpenter. She learned how to do business from her husband when he worked with a businessman and she has more than 12 years of experience. Through her business, she is able to earn approximately 5,000.00 MZN per month, with which she helps with the household expenses and saves some money together with her friends by the traditional system (called Xitique).

She learned about Hluvuku through her husband and has never requested a loan at other banks. This is her 5th loan with this institution, of 15,000 MZN. The previous loans were 5,200 MZN, 7,000 MZN, 10,000 MZN and 12,000 MZN, and all of them were applied in the same activity.

The challenge she faces is the high cost of the construction materials. Even so, she does not give up on her goal to see her house finished. In the future, she intends to request more loans in order to conclude her house construction.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (cement, sand and others)

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity has operated her spare-parts shop in Naivasha town for the last nine years. She is widowed, and all her three children have cleared school and are working. Purity was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid the first loan well which she used to buy more spare parts to sell. She plans to use this loan, also, to restock her business. Purity’s future dream is to expand her business and also to sell the spare parts on a wholesale level. She one day hopes to invest in the transport business by buying her own lorry (truck) which will be used to ferry goods (especially food products) to and from the market. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to stock in her shop

loans.name: 02.1.5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Huệ N. Thị (23) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Huệ is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.5 Nam Ngạn (02.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Huệ is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Huệ owns & operates a specialized retail store selling flowers in the local community.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Lan (24) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


2.  Ngô Thị Ngọc (25) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  N. Thị H. Nhung (26) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


4.  C. Thị M. Hoàn (27) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  H. Thị Dung (28) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


6.  Ngô Thị Đức  (29) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ N. Thị (23) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.1.5 Nam Ngạn (02.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hoa trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Huệ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Lan (24) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Ngô Thị Ngọc (25) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  N. Thị H. Nhung (26) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  C. Thị M. Hoàn (27) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  H. Thị Dung (28) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


6.  Ngô Thị Đức  (29) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Starting Point Group

texts.en:
Particious F. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Starting Point. She is a high school graduate and a single mother of a year-old child.
She lives in the Bassa community, Gbarnga city, Bong county, Liberia.
Her business is the sales of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of Bassa community, Gbarnga city, Bong county, Liberia.
Particious has been running this business for seven years and hopes to move her business to a store in the future.
She sells quality goods and entertains her customers in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.
Transporting her goods from the wholesale depot to the business area is the only difficulty Particious faces.
She needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business. 
Particious dreams of giving her and her child a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school.

To support her household, Janet has been selling cereals like beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts) to her loyal customers in the community market. She says the selling of these products is very lucrative. She has been in business for the last ten years now with lots of business experience.

Janet takes delivery of stock from the farming communities in the northern part of Ghana at farm prices. She requests the loan to increase her stock as we approach the Christmas festivities. This, she believes, would enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially with their education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals to sell

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada hace varios años, su cónyuge es constructor de obras, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Dionisia es propietaria de un taller de costura desde hace 27 años, realiza el servicio tercerizado para otro taller en donde ella cobra por los servicios prestados por cada prenda, tiene 4 máquinas y da fuentes de trabajo a sus vecinas.
Se inició como ayudante de costura y luego fue comprando sus máquinas propias y así fue montando su propio taller.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de otra máquina tipo overlock de 5 hilos.
texts.en:
Miss Dionisia is 54 years old and has been married for several years. Her husband works in private construction and they have 4 children who are all grown up and independent. Miss Dionisia has been the owner of a sewing shop for 27 years. Her services are outsourced for another shop where she charges for the services requested for each garmet. She has four machines and gives work opportunities to her neighbors. She started as a sewing assistant and later bought her own machines and from there she began setting up her own shop. She is asking for a loan to buy another machine – a 5-thread overlock.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a 5-thread overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia, de 44 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada, y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Todos los días, Basilia sale junto a su inseparable triciclo a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, ella se ubica en las afueras del estadio principal de su ciudad, donde tiene muchos clientes. Es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprar más de lo que tenían que comprar.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todos los días. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para implementar una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda atender a sus clientes con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Basilia con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo; a su vez, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto.
texts.en:
Basilia, 44 years old, is a very hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in a rented house, and what she wants the most is to get ahead in life. Everyday Basilia goes out along with her inseparable tricycle to sell her delicious candy. She situates herself outside the main stadium in her city, where she has many clients. She is a very persuasive seller and she always sweet talks her clients into buying more than they were meaning to. What she likes best in her job is chatting with her neighbour saleswomen. She has been working at this activity for 8 years and she considers that the hardest part is having to stand under the ruthless sun every day. For the future she hopes to put some money together and start a general store where she can better serve her clients. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows she has to meet the repayment terms in time. She is a very cheerful and supportive member of her Communal Bank. With the 500 PEN she requested she will purchase more candy to stock up her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (candy)

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie C. is from the city of Bitoon Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Josie is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport "habal-habal" services. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60000 PHP from GDMPC. Josie is requesting a new loan of 42000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Gwenotwom C Aryemo Nathaline Group

texts.en:
Nathaline A. is forty years old. She is single and she has four children in school and two dependents. She owns a grocery store where she sells food, such as cassava, beans, ground nuts, and simsim (sesame seeds). She has been in her business for over four years. 

She is using her loan to purchase groceries to sell. She is an active and courageous woman. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing produce.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulker H. is 41 years old and has sold foodstuffs in her grocery for ten years. She began her business as a street vendor near the local school of her community. Over time, she has expanded her business and now she has a stall in the central bazaar.

Every week Ulker travels to the neighboring town to purchase new goods. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase foodstuffs to expand her business. She needs this to provide a bright future for her three beloved children.

Ulker sincerely thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with her loan repayments.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Esperanza Del Este Group

texts.es:
Este comenzó mediante algunas integrantes quienes se reunieron e invitaron a sus amigas y lograron conformar el comité que hasta ahora trabaja con mucho compromiso y empeño en salir adelante mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus familias con el trabajo solidario. 
Ellas se ayudan mutuamente y ademas reciben asesoramiento constante sobre el manejo de varios temas relacionados a la planificación familiar especialmente, y de como manejar el negocio para obtener mejores resultados con buenas ganancias.
Una despensa donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de uso domestico es la posee la señora Mirta A.. Su negocio es atendida por ella y en ocaciones por sus hijos o por el marido quien constantemente le apoyan en cada actividad que realiza.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de mercaderías faltantes en su negocio como lactes, panificados, pastas, embutidos y otros.
texts.en:
This group started when a few members got together, invited their friends, and were able to form a committee. They now work with great commitment and determination to succeed and improve their families’ living conditions through their mutual efforts. The members help one another and receive ongoing advice on various issues, particularly those related to family planning and managing their businesses to achieve good results and better earnings.

Sra. Mirta A. is a member who has a general store where she offers all types of household products. She manages her business, and occasionally has the help of her children or her husband, who have been a constant source of support for each of her activities. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise she is lacking such as dairy products, baked goods, pasta, cured meats, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products, baked goods, pasta, cured meats, and other items

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham B. is 35 years old, single, and has one son who is 15 years old. In addition to his son, he also supports his father and sister.
For five years, Abraham has been selling phone charge cards on Center Street, which is located in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He says that the location of his business is convenient, and that his customers keep returning because he communicates well with them.
Abraham plans to use his 71,000 LRD loan to buy more phone charge cards. His dream is to open a shop one day and, most importantly for his family, “to live happily.”

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join the Team LEAP – Liberia lending team on Kiva today at http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase additional phone charge cards

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 32 years old and since 1979 has made a living by farming a small plot of land that she owns. She grows various kinds of produce, and is able to raise two crops a year. She is also the devoted mother of two school-aged children, who live with her. Her husband, Mr. Orm Yam, 39, earns a living by building houses. Mrs. K. has applied for this loan to buy a used motorbike which she needs to transport her family. The motorbike mean lower expenses because the family will be able to get round without paying for taxis.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a carpenter and he has been in this business for a long time. He makes lovely chairs, tables and kitchen cabinets for his customers. He is 31 years old and married with a child. His wife also works to support their home. 

John needs the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more materials like woods, foams and nails to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to boost his carpentry business

loans.name: Marisela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marisela está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzada y decididas una de ellas es Karla Yessenia E. R. quien desde hace cinco años vende ropa ambulante y helados y chocobananos en su casa. Ella con el crédito comprara pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas…etc.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Santos Yadira Gutiérrez Flores quien vende cosméticos y  ropa y Maricela E.  la cual vende verduras desde hace 8 años. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios para salir a delante.
texts.en:
The Marisela group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated and tenacious women. One of them is Karla Yessenia E. R. who has been and itinerant clothing merchant for the last five years; she also sells frozen treats and chocolate covered bananas from home. She will use the funds to buy pants, shirts, skirts, bluses, etc. Her fellow group members are Santos Yadira Gutiérrez Flores who sells clothes and cosmetics and Maricela E. who has been a vegetable merchant for 8 years. They will invest the funds in their various businesses in order to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 57 years old, is married, and has one adult child.

Edgardo owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He also owns a farm that he tills for planting rice crops. He has been engaged in his business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Edgardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and also farm inputs. This loan will be his ninth from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and also farm inputs

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora H. is from Iligan City. She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Melchora owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Melchora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melchora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Melchora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melchora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to sell

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Six people located in Lekh Pir village, Kandal province, make up this village loan. Mrs. Simon H., a married woman age 31, is the village bank president having been selected by its members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their particular business.

Mrs. Simon H. and her husband, Mr. Vann Soem, are vegetable sellers in Phnom Penh market. With this business they are able to earn a small income to support their family living.

For their vegetable selling they do not have a trailer to transport their vegetables to sell in Phnom Penh. Thus, Mrs. Simon H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a Khmer trailer to transport their vegetables.

This couple has five children: one is seamstress in a garment factory, one is a vegetable seller, two are attending the local school, while a youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy a Khmer trailer to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es:
Luisa de 52 años, ella elabora productos para limpieza, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella comenzó con la producción de cloro y detergente para poder ayuda con los gastos familiares, su esposo trabaja con ella, los productos que venden tienen como marca “súper limpiecito”, trabajan desde muy temprano hasta las 17h00pm. Venden por galón y por litros. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo químicos para hacer cloros y detergente, en el futuro quiere arreglar y readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa, 52 years old, makes cleaning products. She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban zone where most of the people work as street vendors. She started manufacturing chlorine and detergent to help with the family's expenses. Her husband works with her and their products bear the "Super Limpiecito" ("squeaky clean") brand. They work from very early in the morning until 5pm and sell by the gallon and by the liter. She wants to purchase chemicals to manufacture the chlorine and detergent with the loan. In the future, she wants to fix and improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chlorine, desinfectant

loans.name: Alejandra Herminia

texts.es: Alejandra Herminia tiene 49 años. La señora tiene en su casa de habitación una pulpería, la cual está muy surtida. Ella  tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, este negocio dio inicio con pocas cosas, como golosinas, frutas, etc. Con el tiempo fue invirtiéndole y este ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a tener la pulpería muy surtida. Ella solicita este crédito con el propósito de realizar una inversión considerable a su negocio. Su sueño es seguir incrementando y haciendo crecer su negocio, y si es posible llegar a tener una distribuidora en el mercado.
texts.en:
Alejandra Herminia is 49 years old. This lady has a well-stocked general store in her home. She has had this business for three years. The business began with just a few items like snacks, fruits, etc. With time she began investing in the store, and it has been growing little by little until it has become a well-stocked general store. She is asking for the loan for the purpose of making a considerable investment in her business. Her dream is to keep expanding her business and making it grow, and if it is possible, even to become a distributor in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lermalina

texts.en:
Lermalina G. is from the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 48 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells dressed chicken in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lermalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Lermalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rupa Kumari

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Rupa Kumari K.. She is married and has 3 children, aged 13,12 and 8. In 2005, she established her fruits shop business. Working 7 days a week, 11 hours a day, she supports her family. She wants this loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Rupa Kumari plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page 

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To increase inventory of store.

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.en:
Esmilda is thirty-nine years old.  She lives in her own home along with her children and husband.  They live in the town of Nanchoc in the district of Oyotun.  Oyotun is a rural area which consists of a long valley stretching through the foothills out into the northern Peruvian coastal plain.  It is fed by a river which provides for a rich agricultural history and good productivity.

Esmilda has managed a small beverage shop for the last ten years.  Her best selling product is beer.  She is well known in the area as a responsible seller.  She plans to use the loan proceeds to expand her inventory and take advantage of bulk price discounts.

She has worked with our institution in the past.  She is thankful for the opportunity to receive credit at a lower cost due to the funding through Kiva.

loans.use: Expand her inventory and take advantage of bulk price discounts

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a tailor and sells beverages, earning an income of 9 USD per day. S. has to spend 70 USD on food and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase more beverages and groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy stock such as beverages and groceries

loans.name: Carmen Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 66 años de edad, soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como son azúcar, arroz, leche  y a la vez tiene otro negocio de lavado de carros , el cual lo administra por las mañanas.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y su otro negocio de lavado de carros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Amauta” Community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the Cusco province in the district of Cusco.
This member is Mrs. Carmen. She is 66 years old, single and has two children. This member splits her daily activities between two businesses. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic food products such as sugar, rice and milk. She also has another business washing cars. She does this business in the mornings.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her grocery store and for her car washing business.
She is thankful for the people that have been part of this dream. She promises to pay back the loan according to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: She is asking for this loan in order to run her grocery store and her car washing business.

loans.name: Jovita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jovita de 62 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Inicio su negocio comprando pocos productos para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo invertir más dinero en frutas y enlatados para tener más variedad en sus ventas. En la actualidad trabaja sola desde muy temprano hasta las 06h30am hasta las 19h00pm. Vende enlatados, verduras, vegetales granos etc. Aunque no tiene a su cónyuge ella quiere seguir trabajando para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, comprando con el préstamo enlatados, arroz, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket para así que sus hijos tengan una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Jovita, 62, has a small store.  She lives on the outskirts of the city in an area that has basic services.  Her store is located on the ring road of Guayaquil in an area surrounded by a marsh.

She started her business buying a few products to support her children, since she is a single mother.  Gradually, with effort and dedication she was able to invest more money in fruits and canned goods so that she could have more variety in the goods she sells.  Now she works alone from the early morning (6:30am) until 7pm.  She sells canned goods, vegetables, grains, etc.  Although she does not have a husband, she wants to continue working to provide a better life for her children.  With this loan she will buy canned goods, rice and drinks for her store.

In the future she would like to have a mini-market, so that in this way her children could have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy rice and drinks

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.
For the last six years, Juliet has run a business selling clothes. To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Juliet hopes to own a shop of her own.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Pidson

texts.en:
Pidson is a thirty-year-old married man with four children renting a house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family dream of building a house for his family to reside in. He is into welding and has been in metal fabrication for eleven years; the business is still in its boom stage and his mission is to own a popular workshop servicing the whole region.

Pidson intends to use the loan to buy raw materials such as metals.

loans.use: purchasing metals to use as raw materials

loans.name: Liz Yocelin

texts.es:
Yocelin, tiene 19 años, es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora y vive en el distrito de Poroy de la ciudad del Cusco. El distrito de Poroy se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). 

Yocelin estudia la carreta técnica de informática en el instituto superior de KHIPU de la ciudad del Cusco. Yocelin espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para abrir una cabina de internet en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Yocelin pertenece al banco comunal “Mama Simona” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el quinto año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Yocelin is 19 years old.  She is an enterprising and hard-working young woman who lives in Poroy district, in the city of Cusco.  Poroy district is located 25 minutes from the main square of the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).

Yocelin is studying computing in the KHIPU Institute of Higher Education, in the city of Cusco.

Yocelin hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles and will use this money to open an Internet booth in the city of Cusco.

Yocelin belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Mama Simona" community bank.  The community bank has been going for five years and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To open an Internet booth

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy L. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Cristy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cristy owns & operates a business making and selling coconut wines or tuba in the local community. Cristy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like coconut sap needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like coconut sap

loans.name: El Hadj Moussa

texts.fr: El Hadj Moussa Sané est un yoffois de 36 ans. Il est topographe de métier depuis 2006. Auparavant Il exerçait l’activité de commerce. Il a choisi son métier de topographe par passion. L’activité de commerce aussi l’intéresse beaucoup. Le but  recherché est la réalisation de bénéfices qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2009. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 70 000 frs destiné à l’achat de parfums, lait, crème  et autres produits de beauté divers pour femmes. Son objectif est de développer son commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
El Hadj Moussa Sané, age 36, lives in Yuff. He's been a professional topographer since 2006. Before that, he was a merchant. He chose to be become a topographer out of passion. He is also very interested in running a business. His goal is to turn a profit in order to provide for his own needs.

He's been a member of the Yuff credit union since August 2009. He already repaid a previous loan, and he is now seeking a loan of XOF 70'000, to be used to buy perfumes, lotions, and other kinds of women's cosmetics. His goal is to bolster his business, increase his profits, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Mes

texts.en:
Mes S. is 51 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than ten years. She sells fish that she gets from her daughter who buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. Mes S. is a widow; her husband died of illness years ago. Currently, she lives with her six children, four of whom are single while the other two are married and are starting to live in their own houses. She has three children who work as seamstresses in the garment industry. 

Mes S. uses her bicycle to pick up her fish every day. She says that it is hard for her to use her bicycle because it is so slow and it can’t transport her over long distances. To deal with this situation, she is applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike as a vehicle for picking up fish located far away. With the rest of the funds, she will buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike as a vehicle for picking up her fish in long way.

loans.name: Neixer Ramon

texts.es:
Neixer Ramon P. H. tiene 26 años, es soltero vive  con la madre en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Neixer se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo.

Le gusta hacer deporte, salir a las fiestas en especial del carnaval.
texts.en:
Neixer Ramon P. H., 26, is single living with his mother in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He doesn’t have any children.

The JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS (Agricultural Workers Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which is part of Chillanes canton.  It has nine members who are cocoa bean, coffee and orange farmers.

Neixer grows cocoa beans, coffee and oranges.  He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for his cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to buy a vehicle.

He enjoys playing sports and going out to festivals, especially Carnival.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María, reside en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán, tiene 26 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es madre soltera de una niña de año y medio de edad, vive en compañía de sus padres.

El negocio de María lo administra hace 3 años, lo ha instalado en un local en el centro de San Francisco Gotera, por el cual paga alquiler mensual, su horario de venta es de 8:00am a 5:00pm, aprendió ha administrar el negocio por su propia cuenta. Ella necesita actualmente un préstamo para invertirlo en prendas de vestir: pantalones, blusas y ropa para niños.

Este préstamo representa una gran ayuda para su negocio, ya que realizara las compras al por mayor, siendo beneficiada con mejores precios, para obtener una mejor ganancia en sus ventas. Su sueño es ayudar a su pequeña hija y tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera, department of Morazán. She is 26 years old, sells clothing, is the single mother of a 1.5 year-old girl, and lives together with her parents.

María has been running her business for three years. She set it up in a spot in the center of San Francisco Gotera, which she pays to rent monthly. Her sales hours are from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She learned how to run her business on her own. She currently needs a loan to invest in items of clothing like pants, blouses, and clothing for children.

This loan will be a great help for her business, since it will allow her to make her purchases wholesale. This will be beneficial because the prices are better, so she can earn a better profit on her sales. Her dream is to help her tiny daughter and to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy items of clothing like pants, blouses, and children's clothing

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.en:
Selestine R. is in his mid-thirties and is married with one son who goes to school. He has been running a grocery store for seven years. He works from 9.00am to 11.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Selestine's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his previous loans to increase on his grocery stock. He also bought more tables and chairs, paid rent and bought some land. He has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock of groceries.  His dream is to one day own his place and have a big grocery.

Selestine will share this loan with his loan group "Jipe Moyo", which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Selestine is a fat man in the middle at the back in a dark shirt.

loans.use: to increase his stock of groceries.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.ar: نبيل عمره 24 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في صالون تزيين رجالي له في عمله 11 سنة يحب عمله ويستطيع ان يطوره وان يزيد من زبائن بفضل ذكائه وعمله المبتكر يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجوعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتغيير ديكور المحل حتى يتمكن من زيادة عدد الزبائن له مهارة كبيرة  وخبرة في عمله لكن ما يعيق تقدم العمل عنده هو النقص في رأس المال يطمح بأن يفتتح مصلحة جديدة له وهي تأجير السيارات له زبائن من جيرانه واقاربه وهو يلقى دعم كبير من عائلته التي تشجعه على التطور والتقدم في العمل وفي خطة تحسين المستقبل
texts.en: Nabil is 24 years old and married with a son. He works in a barber shop and has been doing this for 11 years. He loves his work and can develop it and increase the number of clients due to his intelligence and his innovative work. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and change the décor of his shop so that he can attract more customers. He has experience and skill in his work but is impeded by lack of financiA. capitA.. He also aspires to open a new car hire business. He has customers from his neighbours and relatives and has the full support of his family who encourage him to develop and progress for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and improve the décor of his barber shop.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Naneth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Naneth owns & operates a mini-restaurant where she serves a variety of different meals to customers.  She makes meals like afritada, halang-halang & pancit bihon. Naneth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Naneth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naneth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Naneth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Naneth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 42 years old and is married with three children between the ages 11 and 21 years old. Vincent sells cooking oil, body lotion, soap and sugar. He has four years of experience and employs one person to help him.

Vincent has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more salt, soap, sugar, cooking oil and body lotion. With these profits, Vincent will pay school fees for his children and save for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, soap, sugar, cooking oil and body lotion.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 26 años, es soltera vive con los padres no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol.  Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos y los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta ser una persona emprendedora escuchar muisica y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 26, single, doesn't have children and lives with her parents in the Agua Clara region of Chillanes canton.

The lending club Virgen del Huayco is made up of 14 members and is found in the region of Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The members of this group work in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans; others are in sales of flour or animals.

Rosa plants corn and beans. She makes purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and sells them in the Sunday markets in Chillanes. 

The loan will help her to buy inputs for the crops. The loan has helped her increase her crop production. She has faced challenges like pests and crop diseases. Her dream is to have her own home.

She likes to be a go-getter, and listen to music and dance at parties.

loans.use: to buy inputs for the crops.

loans.name: Hikhmat

texts.ru:
Hikhmat ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Yemu 25 let. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Yego mama bolna i on uxajivayet za ney i rabotayet chtobi oplatit yeyo lecheniye. Hikhmat uje 3 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy i pomog yemu kupit  etu mashinu chtobi on mog zarabativat dlya lecheniya materi. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Hikhmat is not married and has no children.  He is 25 years old.  He lives in Baku with his mother.  His mother is ill, and he takes care of her and works to pay for her medical care.  Hikhmat has been working as a taxi driver for three years.  He started this business with his uncle who, in order to help pay for Hikhmat's mother's care, helped him buy the taxi.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his car and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy parts for his car.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité bokk jom est crée le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont du même village.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

La responsable Bousso est âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce , elle a une bonne expérience de plus 4 ans dans ce domaine. elle est debout sur la photo à droite emmitouflée d'un châle blanc.

Elle achète ses légumes dans la ville et vient revendre au village.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce.

ses bénéfices lui permettent de réaliser une épargne consistante et de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of twelve women from the same village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Bousso, who is the group's official, is 63 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a small business and has over four years of good experience in this domain. She is the one standing at the right in the photo and wrapped snug in a white shawl. She purchases her vegetables in the city and resells them in the village. Her loan will enable her to bolster her business. Her profits will allow her to save a substantial amount of money and to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to be sold

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María Aracely tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como los cambios climáticos inesperados que afectan a sus cultivos. Su sueño es ampliar su producción y trabajar con capital propio. 

Le gusta en sus tiempos libres vender productos de Yanbal.
texts.en:
María Aracely is 32 years old. She is single and lives with her children in the  Ventanas canton in the Los Rios Province. 

The members of the JESUS NOS AMA [Jesus Loves Us] community bank are located in the community of Los Amarillos, which belongs to the  Ventanas canton. This bank works with short cycle agriculture crops such as corn, rice, and gandul beans. 

María works planting corn, rice and gandul beans. She buys her materials at Agroquímicos El Copa and sells them in the wholesale market of Ventanas.
 
She is asking for the loan to plant corn and to buy fertilizer and materials for her crops. The loan will be used to support her financial needs and to improve her farming activities and face challenges such as unexpected weather changes that can affect her crops. Her dream is to grow production and work with her own capital. 

She likes to sell Yanbal products in her free time.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy fertilizer and materials for her crops.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline, 26, is married with three children who go to school. For three years, she has been selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. She also makes tablecloths to generate more income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances. This has helped her to invest in her business.

Roseline hopes to open other business premises in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with eight children; six attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over 13 years, she has been selling charcoal at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 100,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Wendbingda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline est la représentante du groupe WENDBINGDA. Elle est marie et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 15ans. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle fait le jardinage et vend des légumes depuis 15ans. Son approvisionnement dans une boutique au secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter, 01 sac d’engrais, 02 sachets de semence en salade, 01sachet en choux et 01 sachet en menthe.

Mme économise  pour  de la famille et de la scolarité. Elle ambitionne assurer l’éducation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline is the representative of the group WENDBINGDA. She is married and the mother of two dependent children. The oldest is 19 years old and younger one is 15. Both children attend school. 

Mrs. Pauline started keeping a garden and selling vegetables 15 years ago. She buys her supplies in a shop located in Sector 10. Her customers are women.

She wants to buy one sack of fertilizer, two small bags of lettuce seed, one small bag of cabbage seed and one small bag of mint seed.

Ms. Pauline saves to help provide for her family and her children’s tuition. She plans to support their education

loans.use: to buy one sack of fertilizer, two small bags of lettuce seed, one small bag of cabbage seed and one small bag of mint seed.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 21, 18, 3 años de edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura  y también tiene junto a sus esposo un taxi el cual lo hace trabajar prestando el servicio de taxi, la socia lleva a vender al mercado los días sábados los que ´produce su terreno que es generalmente papa y verduras, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y tractor para su terreno. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar en su terreno y para comprar abono. 
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en: Clotilde belongs to the "Virgen Del Carmen De Yuncaypata" Community Bank located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in a village called Yuncaypata. This typical village maintains its pure Andean heritage, and the entire community supports each other during the planting and harvest seasons, caring for children and animals. This is a very beautiful place where Quechua is spoken, and it's in the department of Cusco, Peru. Clotilde is 44 years old, married and has four children, ages 23, 21, 18 and 3. She works in agriculture and also has a taxi along with husband, who works as a driver. She takes the products her land produces, generally potatoes and vegetables, to market on Saturdays. Clotilde is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and a tractor for her land. She feels grateful and values the loan through this medium, and she promises to be as disciplined with her payments as she has been with her past loans.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: María Clemencia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 65 años, divorciada quien reside en el barrio "Balcón del Valle" al sur de la ciudad de Quito capital del Ecuador. Un barrio pintoresco y muy populoso en la parroquia Alfaro.

Ella trabaja vendiendo jugos naturales en la mañana y el resto del día vende ropa y cosméticos para poder vivir. Los jugos son de aloe vera y yerbas las cuales mezcladas son agradables al paladar y muy apetecidas por sus clientes; dicen que estas bebidas tienen poderes curativos, sobre todo en problemas gástricos y también son usadas como bebidas energizantes naturales. María ha decidido invertir en sus negocios para aumentar sus ingresos. Por este motivo fue  Fundación Alternativa en busca de recursos económicos para lograr su objetivo. Su sueño es tener su kiosco propio ya que actualmente trabaja de manera ambulante. Ella nos cuenta que la necesidad poco a poco fue haciendo que ella incurra en estos negocios con lo cual hoy ella se mantiene.
texts.en:
María is a 65 year old woman who lives in the Balcón del Valle neighborhood to the south of the city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  It is a picturesque neighborhood, and the Alfaro parish is very heavily populated.

She works selling natural juices in the morning, and the rest of the day she sells clothes and cosmetics in order to be able to survive.  The juices are made of aloe vera and herbs that are mixed to have a pleasing taste that her customers really like.  They say that these drinks have curative powers, especially for gastric problems.  They are also used as natural energizers.

María has decided to invest in her business in order to increase her income.  That is why she went to Fundación Alternative looking for financial resources to reach her objective.

Her dream is to have her own kiosk because she currently works in an itinerant manner.  She tells us that little by little necessity made her get into these businesses, which she now maintains.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: C5668 Twimarubukene Group

texts.en:
Elie is 48 years old and married. Elie is the leader of a group called "Twimarubukene." This group is commonly known for selling rice, sugar, milk, etc. Elie and his team have been in this business for about four years. The business hours are from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. Elie is in the middle, with the paper in his hand.

Elie and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing rice, sugar and milk to sell. If successful, Elie and his team will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they will be able to continue improving their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
This is Fhevie, 45, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Willie, a driver, and is the mother of two children, both in elementary school. She enjoys attending to both her children and her business. The business allows her to help her husband cover their daily expenses. 

Fhevie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Fhevie’s for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fhevie dreams of being able to give her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* meetings that allow her to devote a few minutes of her time to studying and sharing God’s word. She values what is being shared and discussed in their weekly fellowship meetings. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials she needs in her business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a 46-year-old widow with two school-age children. Estela lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Estela owns and operates a "habal-habal" motorcycle transport service business to earn a living. Estela has been engaged in this business for about two years. This is the principal source of income for Ms. Estela and she earns about PHP 5,000 a month.

Early this year Estela joined GDMPC. Estela requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair a motorcycle transport vehicle. In the future, Estela plans to purchase another motorcycle for transport to gain supplementary income.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Duvin

texts.es: Duvin, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su siembra de maíz. El actualmente siembra en un terreno que no pertenece a el, es alquilado, y actualmente lo tiene sembrado de maíz por lo cual necesita asistirlo. El quiere con la asistencia generar la mayor ayuda necesaria a la plantación para obtener el máximo de rendimiento de cosecha. El con la cosecha generada la venderá al comercio de la localidad y así generar buenas divisas económicas para salir adelante con su bienestar económico y familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Duvin is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is his highest priority.  He intends to use this loan to buy supplies for maintaining his crop of corn.  Duvin currently has a plot of land that does not belong to him.  He rents the space and is now growing corn, but he needs to maintain this crop.  Duvin wants more help with his crop so that he can generate the maximum yield at harvest time.  By having a bountiful harvest, he will be able to sell his crops in town and earn a good income necessary to move forward and provide for his family’s welfare.  

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Duvin has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for maintaining his corn crop.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emie is 42-years-old and has 1 child who is in school.

Emie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Emie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Emie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of two children. They represent her whole life.

Fadia lives a hard life; her husband travelled away a long time ago and left her responsible for two little children. She has to provide them with a suitable education and healthy living.

Fadia is a hairdresser and makeup artist, known for her excellent customer service. She works hard to develop her business; she intends to do so by buying a new cosmetics collection and that’s why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Fadia has been an Al Majmoua borrower for five consecutive loan cycles, which reflected positively on her social and financial situation. She also started to rent wedding dresses as an extra business, which leads to extra income.

Fadia is an excellent borrower with a very good paying-back history. She is a woman with a good reputation. Fadia is a social, lovely and patient woman, always looking towards achieving more success in her business future.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics supply and wedding dresses

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 40-year-old business lady who deals in the sale of toys and belts in Mombasa. She is married and has been running this business for the past 11 years. 

Ruth was introduced to KADET by other clients and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more stock of assorted belts and toys for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to build capital for the business.
 
She hopes to realize more profits and be able to expand the business even further.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted belts and toys.
