loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Hoeurn, 41, is a local farmer who has been living in the Reussey Keo commune. He and his wife are always busy with rice farming, both in rainy and dry seasons. Hoeurn is the father of 4 children, 3 of whom live with him at home, while one is already married and living independently. 

Due to lack of funds, Hoeurn is having some difficulty carrying out his farm work. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from HKL to purchase rice seeds and mineral fertilizers to start growing his dry-season rice crops. In the future, he plans to expand his farmland and increase his output to better his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Grace provides motorela or public motorcycle with sidecar services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 12 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras San Pedr Group

texts.en:
Antigua, Guatemala is a UNESCO World Heritage Site with its well-preserved Spanish Baroque influenced architecture and many colonial churches. It is a large international town with visitors and residents from all over the world making tourism the base of the economy. Just outside the town is a neighborhood called Aldea San Pedro Las Huertas that is well-known for the cultivation of potatoes, carrots and other vegetables. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras San Pedr” or “The Enterprising Women” is located here. The seven ladies in the group are involved in various commercial ventures including shoe sales, textile businesses (clothing for both men and women), tamale sales and a convenience store.

Aura is a young, single 20 year old woman who is determined to be successful with her clothing business. She sells modern clothing for women, men and children. With the income from her businesses, she is able to cover her educational costs. She is studying to be a dental hygienist. Actually, she is about to finish high school. Aura is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase additional inventory for her store. It is especially important at this time of year with year-end parties, graduations and holidays. 

All the women in the Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings when they make payments on their much-needed loans and then participate in educational trainings. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. A different subject is covered at each meeting and the women are very anxious to improve their personal and business lives. 

Aura and her 6 friends in the Trust Bank appreciate the kindness of KIVA investors as they strive to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. They also want to take this opportunity to wish all investors blessings and prosperity in the New Year!

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothing store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is IDP from Jabrail region that is under control of Armenians. He now lives in Beylagan town and has a shop where he is doing his business, selling food stuffs. When he started the business he had no funds, therefore he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $300 at first. Later he borrowed $500, $600 and last $800. He established his business thanks to these loans. Now he cooperates with Normicro and wants new loan from KIVA to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for ice cream storage

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana M. M. is a merchant selling groceries on Avenida Final Buenos Aires in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as an assistant bricklayer (constructing houses), and they have two children, ages 6 and 10. They all live in her parents' house, located in the Llojeta neigborhood on the west side of the city. The incomes received by Juana and her husband permit them to support the family.

The destination of this loan is to invest in merchandise, which will permit Juana to satisfy the demand which exists for her products. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and create some small savings, which she hopes to use to buy a plot of land and build a home of her own.

This is Juana's third loan, and her good record with our organization allows her to request another credit in order to strengthen her commercial activity and in this way to increase her economic income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a small shop in Kirkuk to sell flowers. He applied to get $1000 to add more space for this shop. He has a big family, and he is responsible for them. He is very active and works hard to increase his income and enhance his standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Development

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is originally from Guadalupe in Nuevo Leon, Mexico. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a trash collection company and earns very low wages. When Maria Teresa would bring lunch to her husband at work, his co-workers started asking to buy food from her as well. Because her food is very good, she soon had many paying customers. This is how she started her business four years ago.

Maria Teresa wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $925 which she will use to buy a larger comal - a cast iron grill used to make tortillas and char chiles - to increase her food production, and also tables and chairs to offer better service to her customers. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Your help will go a long way toward helping this family. Maria Teresa and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Teresa es originaria de la localidad de Guadalupe en el estado de Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de recolección de basura y su salario es muy bajo, cuando Maria le llevaba de comer a su esposo en la empresa, los compañeros de trabajo comenzaron a hacerle pedidos y gracias al buen sabor de sus comidas pronto sus clientes se incrementaron, así fue como inició su negocio hace cuatro años.

Ahora Maria quiere continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de un comal más grande que le permita incrementar su producción, así como en la compra de mesas y sillas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio, Maria y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase a table, chairs and a cast iron grill

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 33 years old, married mother of 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She has 10 years' experience in the production of polythene bags and has been with LAPO for 3 years. She runs this business with her husband. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy chemicals for production.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals for her plastic bag manufacturing

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He and his family live in Zaporozhye. Alexander works in the Osipenkovskyi market selling perfumes. He has been in this trade for 10 years and has gained rich experience as a private entrepreneur. Presently, Alexander has about $2400 in inventory. His turnover capital is about $1600, and his monthly net profit amounts to $1200.

Alexander is a very hard-working, hard-charging, and responsible businessman. He has great managerial skills which he applies to the familiar challenges of entrepreneurship and which have become the key to his business success. We believe that Alexander’s ability to build on his strengths and his commitment to his venture will help his business grow and allow him to continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia loves children and for this reason, she decided to study primary education. Currently she works as a teacher at the “Enrique Guzman y Valle” learning center in the city of Juliaca, where she patiently shares her knowledge. During her leisure time and with the support from her eldest daughter, she manages a little store located within the learning center. Lidia, mother of two children, hopes to increase the amount and variety of her merchandise. In order to reach this objective, she requests a loan from your generous heart. She will use this investment to improve her family’s economic situation and above all to save enough to allow her to offer her dear children a higher education. “Let’s help this loving mother and teacher to move forward.”

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia, es una persona que ama a los niños, es por esa razón que decidió estudiar la carrera de educación primaria. Actualmente se desempeña como profesora en el centro educativo “ Enrique Guzmán y Valle” de la ciudad de Juliaca y en sus horas libres con apoyo de su hija mayor atiende su tiendita escolar ubicada en el interior de esta misma casa de estudios en el que implanta muy pacientemente sus conocimientos.El deseo de Lidia madre de dos niños es aumentar el stock y variedad de su mercadería y para alcanzar este propósito recurre a tu generoso corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo que luego de su inversión le permitirá obtener resultados favorables, permitiéndole así mejorar su situación económica familiar y sobre todo ahorrar lo suficiente para en el futuro ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus apreciados hijos. “Apoyemos a esta maestra con inmenso amor de madre a salir adelante”

loans.use: Buying a greater and more diverse amount of items for the children at her beloved little school

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro started his used auto parts shop when a family member that owns a mechanic shop suggested that there was good money to be made in this line of business. Ramiro travels to Reynosa Tamaulipas (3 hours away from Linares), to purchase used auto parts to sell at home. Slowly he has been increasing his client base and is making enough money to support his family.

He is low on stock and needs a micro loan of US $200 to be paid back in 4 months. With more used parts, Ramiro will be able to grow his business and make more money to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase used auto parts

loans.name: Therese

texts.fr:
Born in Brazzavile in the Republic of the Congo on April 6, 1964, Mrs. Thérèse H. is divorced and has one child to raise. Her business is selling carbonated and brewed beverages and she runs a bar. Since she is faced with frequently running short of drinks, she risks losing her clientele. She is asking for a small loan so that she can purchase a bigger stock of drinks and also add sales of canned goods, pasta and such to meet her customer demand. This will allow her to augment her income so that she can become financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Brazzaville dans la République Congolaise le 06 Avril 1964, Madame H. Thérèse est divorcée avec un (1) enfant à charge. Son activité est basé sur la vente de boissons gazeuses et sucreries brassées (BB) et est détentrice d’un Bar. Souvent confronté à de fréquente rupture de stock, ce qui lui fait perdre sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un appui financier pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en grande quantité de boissons, et associer la vente des produits alimentaires (boîtes de conserve, pattes alimentaires et divers) sur la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter davantage ses revenus en vue d’avoir un autonomie financière.

loans.use:
Stocking drinks and food products for re-sale

Approvisionnement en boissons et en produits alimentaires

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor U. is married with 3 children. He is 42 years old and hails from Imo State, Nigeria. He is a commercial motorcyclist and has been in the business since 2002. He needs the loan amount of $625 to buy a new bike. He said this will help him serve his customers better. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en:
This is Habibullah, son of L. M.. He is a man whose business is  a spare parts shop in Kabul city.
He lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He presently has a lot of economic problems and he couldn’t solve these problems with his own money, so he wants to buy some more spare parts for his shop. He believes this will allow him to progress in his business.
 Therefore he has requested a small loan in the amount of US$ 625 from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Yacin

texts.es:
Yacin is a native of Chucos and he comes from a farming and cattle-raising home. His parents' instruction has granted him the opportunity to support his family and also develop personally. He owns a large cattle farm and now his urgent wish is to increase the nutritional value of his cow's food to that they may produce more milk.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Yacin, es natural de Chucos y proviene de una cuna netamente agricultora y ganadera, las enseñanzas de sus padres le han otorgado la posibilidad de mantener satisfactoriamente a su familia y de desarrollarse también personalmente.Posee una gran ganadería y ahora su urgente deseo es incrementar el valor nutricional del alimento de sus vaquitas para que estas puedan producir mayor cantidad de leche.

loans.use: Purchase balanced nutrition for his beloved cows.

loans.name: Doka

texts.fr:
A bachelor with no children, Mr. Lawoété Doka was born on May 28, 1982 in Agoé. He is a cook and has been in business since 2005, opening a mini-restaurant in the Agoé district.

He serves spaghetti, rice and salad. He has quite a number of customers because he is a really good cook.

After a first loan that was very helpful for his business, he is now requesting a second loan to purchase 15 cases of spaghetti, 4 cases of milk, 3 sacks of rice, and 2 cases of mayonnaise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Célibataire sans enfant, monsieur DOKA Lawoété est né le 28 mai 1982 à Agoé .Il est cuisinier et exerce son activité depuis 2005.

Il a crée un mini restaurant dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il fait la restauration de spaghetti du café, du riz et de la salade. Il accueille beaucoup de client car il applique sa connaissance dans le domaine de la gastronomie.

Après un premier crédit qui lui a été très bénéfique, il souhaiterait un deuxième crédit pour acheter 15 cartons de spaghetti, 04 cartons de lait, 03 sacs de riz et 2 cartons de mayonnaise.

loans.use:
Purchase of spaghetti, milk, and rice for restaurant

Achat de spaghetti, de lait, de riz pour la restauration

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
These military personnel are requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00. Their leader is Mohamed T.. He is 27. Born in Makeni. He is married with 2 children. Mohamed T.`s wife is a business woman who sells assorted items. Mohamed will like to give his loan to his wife to invest in her current business.

The other two are Assanatu K. and Bai S.. The former will use her  loan to start doing business and the latter will give his loan to his wife to invest in her current business.

loans.use: Buy more local produces to add to existing business

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto P. is 43 years old. He is married to Nelida Jara and they have four children. One is in high school and three are in grade school in the city. The family lives in their own home.

Sixto has been working alongside his wife making “chipa” for more than 14 years. Thanks to their work they were able to purchase a small truck which they use to transport their products to soccer games in the area. On weekends, the entire family works together and gives their best to the work. “Chipa” is traditional Paraguayan food. It is similar to bread and is made with starch, eggs, milk, cheese and corn.

Sixto is requesting this loan to purchase prime materials at wholesale prices. This will allow him to generate greater income and thus be able to provide all of his children a better education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Sixto P. tiene 43 años de edad, está casado con la señora Nélida Jara, tienen 4 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la secundaria y tres en la primaria de la ciudad. Viven en casa propia.

Sixto trabaja con su esposa en la elaboración de chipas hace más de 14 años, gracias a éste trabajo, pudieron adquirir una pequeña camioneta con la cual transportan su producción a los encuentros de fútbol de la zona, donde los fines de semana toda la familia trabaja dando lo mejor de si. La chipa es una comida típica del Paraguay muy consumida, la misma es parecida a un pan y está hecha a base de almidón, huevos, leche, queso y maíz.

Precisa del crédito para la compra de materia prima al por mayor, para que así pueda generar mayores ingresos y brindarle a todos sus hijos una mejor educación y un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, cheese, eggs and start in large quantities.

loans.name: Adalid

texts.en:
Don Adalid is 63 years old and lives with his wife in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The couple lives alone, since all of their children are now adults and no longer live at home. Don Adalid raises and sells pigs, and his wife works in a small hospital. The couple also generates income from ownership of a motorcycle taxi, which they rent out to the driver.

Don Adalid has more than 25 years of experience raising pigs. He will use this credit of 7,090 bolivianos (about US $1,010) to buy more piglets to raise and sell. He has always been an excellent client of AgroCapital.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Ladislao De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Ladsislado es originario del municipio de Condega y con gran sacrificio se ha dedicado a su actividad agropecuaria dando asistencia a sus cultivos y a la vez en la crianza y desarrollo de animales para subsistir.

Es importante destacar que é les padre de un pequeño hijo el cual está en la obligación de mantener y suplir todas las necesidades que este tenga. Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar novillos y continuar invirtiendo en sus cultivos. Su sueño es mejorar en su actividad económica y para eso busca el apoyo en Ceprodel confiando que obtendrá el apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ladsislado is from the Condega municipality. With great sacrifice he has worked in farming, tending his crops and at the same time raising and developing animals to survive.

It is important to emphasize that he is the father of a small son, and is obligated to take care of him and provide all that he needs. These days, he is looking for the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan, with which he will buy young bulls and continue investing in his crops. His dream is to improve his economic activity and for this he looks to the support of Ceprodel, trusting that he will receive the support.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young bulls to raise

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Claudina tiene unos juegos de carrusel y futbolines, se traslada a todas las ferias  de las zonas de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Trabaja con sus dos hijas, y esta separada de su esposo por lo cual es la única que genera ingresos en su familia para poder solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la reparación y mantenimiento de los carruseles ya que estan en mal estado, este crédito será de gran ayuda ya que por el traslado de sus juegos a diferentes zonas se deterioran rápidamente
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Claudina has carousels and football tables (foosball). She travels to all the district markets in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. She works with her two daughters. She is separated from her husband, which means that she is the only one in her family who earns income to pay for the family expenses. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the repair and maintenance of her carousels, which are in bad condition. This loan will be of great help to her because transporting her equipment throughout the different districts has caused it to quickly deteriorate. This is the fourth time she requests a loan from Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a responsible client who makes her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor V. tiene a su esposa e hijo, actualmente viven en casa de sus papas, está muy agradecido con sus padres por brindarle un techo donde cobijarse, sin embargo quiere tener su propia casa, y ya dio el primer paso para lograrlo; adquirió un terreno en el que ya tiene contemplado construir dos cuartos para mudarse, la ventaja que él tiene es su conocimiento en el ramo de la construcción pues solo invertirá en el material.
Pide el apoyo para hacer realidad su sueño y el de su familia. Agradece infinitamente la ayuda que le puedan dar.
texts.en:
Mr. V. is married and has one son. Currently they live in his parents' house. He is very grateful to his parents for providing them with a roof over their heads but he still hopes to have his own house and has already made the first steps to getting it. He bought a plot of land and has already planned to build two rooms that they can move into. He has the advantage that he has construction experience so he will only have to pay for the materials.

He is asking for support so that he can achieve his and his family's dreams. He is infinitely grateful for the support that you can give him.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Malia Lulia

texts.en: Malia T., 77, is widowed with 12 children. She has 3 years of experience in the taro, taamu, yam, and banana selling business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She is a new member of SPBD, and has taken just one loan previously with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 60 Samoan Tala (20 USD).  SPBD loans are Malia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase Gromozone, sacks of fertilizers and a fence to expand her plantation.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has two children. One of her children is in the senior high school and the other in the primary school.

Diana operates a clothing shop in the community market in which she sells ladies blouses, trousers, and fabrics among other items. She buys used textiles in bales from wholesalers. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of ladies clothing in order to raise more income to support her children’s education to the university level. She says it has not been easy for her as a single parent to provide for the children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: David A.

texts.en: David A. B. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. David A. sells phone spare parts at Kotokraba, the heart of Cape Coast, which he has done since 2002. His wife is a trader. David A. uses his income to pay for the children's school fees and provide food, clothing and other basic needs of the family. David A. will use the loan as additional capital to enable him increase the sale of phone spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, David A. plans to invest in the children's education.

loans.use: Buy phone spare parts

loans.name: Cataag

texts.en: Mrs. M. Cata-ag is a 51-year-old widow who lives in Layawan, Oroquieta City. She has two children, and says that being a single parent is not easy. She works hard simply to survive and to meet the needs of her family. Her primary source of income is a general or "sari-sari" store. In order to expand her business and acquire more capital, she joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last June. She is grateful to Paglaum because her most pressing financial needs have been met. Now she is applying for a loan to buy canned goods and other basic commodities to sell. She believes she can look forward to a comfortable life in the future, if she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and other commodities to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kouami Demanya

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a commencé en 2004 le commerce d’articles scolaires et livres, il y a associé le commerce de biscuits. Le troisième trimestre étant proche pour la reprise des classes à lomé, il voudrait acheter de nouveaux livres et articles scolaires qui lui permettrait d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Étant marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouami Demanya began in 2004 to sell school supplies and books. He added on the sale of sweet biscuits (cookies). Back-to-school day for the third trimester is near in Lomé, so he would like to buy new books and school supplies so that he can make more sales. He is married and the father of 2 children, and it is this business that permits him to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of school supplies, books and such for re-sale

loans.name: Fansat

texts.en: Fansat is 31 years old and married with a child. Fansat sells shoes and bags in her shop. The demand for her shoes and bags is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
La señora Ana Laura y su esposo el señor Jaime son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
Ellos son comerciantes independientes, ella tiene su propia estética de nombre “Nenas” desde hace 2 años, el por su parte tiene un negocio de auto Eléctrico, se encarga de verificar las fallas de la computadora de los automóviles, negocio que tiene desde hace 3 años. Pero el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito es para la compra de un scanner verificador de fallas reciente modelo, y también en la inversión de la compra de mercancía tal como tintes, uñas de acrílico, tratamientos y otros productos que se requieran para el manejo de la estética de la señora Ana Laura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Laura and her husband, Mr. Jaime, are a very united and hard-working family. They are independent merchants. She has had her own beauty shop called "Nenas" for two years; he on the other hand has an auto electronics business. He verifies errors in the computer of automobiles, a business he's had for three yers. But the reason why they're requesting this loan is for the purchase of an more recent auto diagnostic scanner, and also to invest in the purchase of merchandise like dyes, acrylic nails, treatments, and other products that are required to run Mrs. Ana Laura's beauty shop.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in products for two businesses

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Mrs. Angélica S. de Ojeda is 47 years old and has been married to Mr. Valetín Ojeda for more than 26 years.  They own a house in __ in Carapeguá.  They have five children, three that are very young and two that are in school.  

           From a very young age Mrs. S. de Ojeda has been interested in moving forward in an independent way.  She married at the age of 20, and her first son was born a year alter.  As they did not have a steady source of income, her husband had to travel to Argentina to work as a building worker and with that income he could support his new family.  Mrs. S. de Ojeda helped by knitting traditional mattress covers and comforters and then selling them to street vendors from the area.  Today, with much sacrifice, the family has been able to build its own life and supply the basic necessities of a dignified life.  

          Mrs. S. de Ojeda is applying for this loan in order to purchase hammocks and comforters to sell.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angélica S. de Ojeda is 47 years old and has been married to Mr. Valetín Ojeda for more than 26 years. They own a house in Carapeguá. They have five children, three that are very young and two that are in school. From a very young age Mrs. S. de Ojeda has been interested in moving forward in an independent way. She married at the age of 20, and her first son was born a year after. As they did not have a steady source of income, her husband had to travel to Argentina to work as a building worker and with that income he could support his new family. Mrs. S. de Ojeda helped by knitting traditional mattress covers and comforters and then selling them to street vendors from the area. Today, with much sacrifice, the family has been able to build its own life and supply the basic necessities of a dignified life. Mrs. S. de Ojeda is applying for this loan in order to purchase hammocks and comforters to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of hammocks and comforters

loans.name: Ceneza

texts.en:
Ceneza A. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old. Ceneza is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ceneza owns & operates a a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ceneza is just starting this business.

In 2002, Ceneza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Ceneza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Ceneza is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This will not be the first loan taken out by Ceneza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: o purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Juan Gerardo

texts.es:
Juan Gerardo V. U. trabaja como bombero desde hace 4 años en esta ciudad al servicio de la comunidad, aunque es un trabajo muy importante y riesgoso no tienen tantos beneficios como casas de interés social que le mismo gobierno da la oportunidad de adquirir pagando poco.  Entonces el opto por conseguir una vivienda por medio de su hermano y esta pagando. Pero ahora el se ve a la necesidad de pedir un préstamo en esta institución ya que el Señor ha tenido varios intentos de robos y el teme que perder algo  de su casa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a comprado a lo largo de los años.
Para que su hija y su esposa estén protegidas ante la delincuencia el quiere comprar protecciones para poner en las ventanas de su casa.
texts.en:
Juan Gerardo V. U. has worked as a firefighter in his city for 4 years. Even though this is a very important and risky job, there are not many benefits apart from government housing, which the government offers at low cost. Juan chose instead to buy a house through his brother. He is currently asking for a loan because there have been several attempted burglaries at his home, and he is afraid to lose anything from his house, since he has put much effort and dedication into purchasing things over the years. Juan wants to purchase safety bars to install on the windows of his home so that he can protect his wife and daughter against crime.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Protecting his home

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina S. is from the city of Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Regina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2003, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio R. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de San Pedro, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Marcia Illanes y sus tres hijos.
El señor Julio atiende un negocio de comida en su domicilio junto a su esposa, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de MESAS Y SILLAS para la atención de mas personas en su negocio y así mejorar su nivel de ingresos para la familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio R. lives in his own house, in the area of San Pedro, Iadero, which is west of the city of La Paz, with Mrs. Marcia Illanes and their three children. Mr. Julio takes care of his food business in his home with his wife. The income from this allows him to take care of his family. The loan requested will be used to buy tables and chairs so that he can serve more people in his business. In this way, he will be able to improve the level of income for his family. This is his first that he has requested a loan. His socio-economic level qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and dishes so he can serve more clients

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en: Justine is 39 years old and the leader of her lending group in Namugongo. She is a single mother with four children, ages 24 to 14 years, and she takes care of five dependents, including orphans and parents. She is a business lady with a clinic in Bulooli trading centre that she has owned for 11 years, and she is able to make 45,000/= as profits a week. She is a friendly person and this has enabled her to better take care of her patients and the general public. She strives to develop her business more as well as educate and build her home and family well. She needs a loan to be able to buy more drugs so as to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Buying more drugs for her clinic

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam M. D. M. vive en Colón municipio del departamento D. La Libertad.  Tras casarse muy joven con su ahora esposo quien trabaja D. empleado en un taller, Ana ha tenido un camino difícil por la vida, lleno D. continuos desafíos y obstáculos.  A pesar D. sus dificultades matrimoniales Ana Miriam ha salido adelante, y maneja ahora exitosamente un negocio D. costura, para el cual solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y formalizar su visión.
texts.en:
Ana Miriam M. D. M. lives in the municipality of Colón in the department of La Libertad. Because she married her husband, who works as an employee in a workshop, at a very young age, Ana has had a difficult life, full of continuous challenges and obstacles. In spite of her marriage difficulties, Ana Miriam has gone forward and now successfully manages her dressmaking business, for which she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials and to formalize her vision.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clothes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Cecilia joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: God Creation Group

texts.en:
'God Creation' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Tonia T., 40 years old, married  with 2 children aged 18 and 21 years old; their educational levels are 8th and 11th grade. Tonia also cares for 2 siblings. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lots, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia .

Tonia's business is selling well-prepared food. She buys foodstuffs like rice, oil, Maggi cubes, vegetables, etc. to cook and sell by the plate to residents of Virginia, Liberia.She has been running this business for 2 years and is hoping to improve business in the future.


Tonia cooks delicious food that is affordable and talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan in order to purchase bags of rice and palm oil. Tonia dreams of improving the living condition of her family and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and palm oil

loans.name: Rakarya

texts.en:
Rakarya N. sells beer from her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more beer to sell. Rakarya is a 40-year-old woman who is widowed. She is the mother of 7children, all of whom go to school.With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees of her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Edna is married and has 3 adult children. Edna owns a specialized food supplement shop. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $171 US) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 pesos from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Déglo Tétédé Victoire

texts.fr: D. Déglo Tétédé Victoire est née en 1974 à Louho à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Victoire vit dans ce quartier depuis sa naissance. Mariée à ZOUNMENOU Emmanuel un ferrailleur, Victoire est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Mais seulement un enfant est à leur charge. Victoire vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Victoire n’a pas été à l’école ; elle a appris et exerce la coiffure depuis près de 10 ans. Victoire vend également des produits pour cheveux (défrisants, pommades et huile pour cheveux, mèches, etc.) et également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son atelier. C’est à Ouando à Porto-Novo que Victoire s’approvisionne. Victoire a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé et qui ont été bien remboursés. Victoire sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’accroître la taille de son activité pour mieux faire face aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
D. Déglo Tétédé Victoire was born in 1974 in Louho in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has been living in this district since birth. Married to ZOUNMENOU Emmanuel, a scrap metal merchant, she is the mother of three children. The children are all in school. But only one is in their care. Victoire works in aid of her husband to support the family. Victoire did not attend school. She learned hairstyling and has been working in this trade for almost ten years. She also sells hair products (straightener, ointments, oils, hair extensions, etc.), as well as mobile phone recharge cards, in her salon. She gets her supplies in Ouando in Porto-Novo. She has already benefited from two loans from ALIDé that were repaid. She's requesting a third loan from ALIDé, in order to augment her working capital and to expand her business, so as to cope better with the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boxes of hair extensions and hair products, and phone cards

loans.name: Kashangura Tukore Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Claire is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 50 years old and married with seven children aged from 28 to 12 years. She also takes care of three dependents.

Claire has been involved in the sale of produce at Kashangura Trading Centre for nine years. She says that she is successful because of her customer loyalty and she hopes to expand further in business. She would also like to have all her children educated so that they become self-reliant in future.

Claire needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale since running out of stock means losing out on some of her customers. She is such a determined and hardworking lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more agricultural produce for resale

loans.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr:
Madame Dieumbe  D. est parente  bénéficiaire, sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis mars 2003.Elle est âgée  de 36 ans  mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants. Elle  est connue dans le commerce depuis 15 ans. Elle est spécialisée  dans la vente de glace, jus et crème  glacée. Elle a fait ce choix car elle a toujours voulu gagner sa vie et elle trouve toujours du plaisir dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs .L’objet de son prêt est d’acquérir  un réfrigérateur en vue de continuer son activité car le sien est en panne. Les revenus de son activité  lui permettent de compléter  la dépense quotidienne pour soutenir son  mari.
Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Dieumbe Diagene is a parent and member of U-IMCEC since March 2003. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has been known as a vendor for 15 years. She specializes in selling ice, juices and ice-cream. She has made this choice because she always wanted to be able to support herself and because she always enjoys this activity. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs [about 225 USD]. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a refrigerator in place of her broken one, and to return to selling her goods. Her revenues go towards paying everyday expenses and helping her husband. Mrs. Diagene is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF)Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs. Madame Dieumbe D. est parente bénéficiaire, sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis mars 2003.Elle est âgée de 36 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est connue dans le commerce depuis 15 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de glace, jus et crème glacée. Elle a fait ce choix car elle a toujours voulu gagner sa vie et elle trouve toujours du plaisir dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs .L’objet de son prêt est d’acquérir un réfrigérateur en vue de continuer son activité car le sien est en panne. Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de compléter la dépense quotidienne pour soutenir son mari. Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies. Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires. Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment (equipment purchase)

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos; Juan de 15 y Sandra de 4 años y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
A más 5,400 m.s.n.m., en la mina La Rinconada se encuentra el negocio de Martha, ella se dedica a la venta de libros y CDs, los cuales lleva desde la ciudad de Juliaca. Su negocio marcha muy bien y tiene mucha demanda, ya que no tiene competencia y sus clientes ya la conocen y la prefieren.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y lo hace muy bien, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en esta zona minera. 
Para más adelante, espera implementar una tienda donde pueda vender con más comodidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Martha con MFP y está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito, por lo que espera poder pagarlo a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más libros para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Martha, 35, is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in a rented house with her two children; Juan is 15, and Sandra is 4. What she wants most of all is to succeed in life. At more than 5,400 meters above sea level, Martha’s business can be found in the La Rinconada mine. She sells books and CDs, which she brings from the city of Juliaca. Her business is going very well, and there is a lot of demand because she does not have competition. Her customers know her and prefer her. On the other hand, what she likes best about her work is selling, and she does it very well. She has been doing this for seven years. The most difficult part is putting up with the intense cold in this mining area. Later, she hopes to set up a store where she can sell more comfortably. This is Martha’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy for the opportunity of the loan, and she expects to be able to pay it on time. In her communal bank she is much loved for the responsibility that she demonstrates. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more books to better set up her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ranny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ranny U., (shown in the picture) is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Choeun Kong, is 40 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the children attends school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 18 km from Phnom Penh City.

Ranny has just stared growing mushrooms in her village. Her husband assists her in the business. Ranny hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of US$500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To use for growing mushrooms

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a single lady with two children who attend school.  She has a tree nursery where she has been selling seedlings for six years.  She also earns a living from dairy farming.  She was previously employed in Kenya Agricultural Research Institute (KARI).  She is a member of Faulu Kenya, which is a partner of Kiva. She feels her business has expanded from having 5,000 seedlings to 20,000 seedlings. She has requested a loan of Kes.40,000 to buy a cow and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to educate her children, buy a piece of land, and build her own house instead of paying house rent. She sees herself being a major supplier of milk and having more cows on her farm.

loans.use: To buy a cow and pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Bonanza (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Bonanza está ubicado en la  comunidad El  Carmen de Guzho en la ciudad de Cuenca, tierra privilegiada para el cultivo de maíz, donde su gente adulta mayor se dedica a la agricultura y los más jóvenes han migrado a las ciudades grandes del país o al extranjero. 

La señora Martha tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 4 hijos que se encuentran de 20, 17, 11, 8, su hija mayor  le ayuda en la venta de sus productos en el mercado, el de 17 trabaja como oficial de albañil y sus dos últimos  hijos estudian en la escuela Agustín C. Vintimilla de la comunidad,   su esposo trabaja como albañil y por ahora se encuentran construyendo su casa propia.

Nuestra socia  tiene un puesto en el mercado donde ofrece variedad de  granos tiernos y hortalizas, esta actividad  realiza desde sus siete  años ya que  ayudaba a su mamá y a los veinte y un años  empezó a  trabajar en su propio puesto donde labora desde las 4 a.m. para comprar los productos y se queda hasta las 6 p.m. los días lunes, miércoles, sábado y domingo, mientras que los días jueves y viernes trabaja en un salón de comidas en el que lleva cuatro años con un horario de  8 a.m. a  6 p.m.  a más de estos trabajos se da tiempo para la cría de pollos los cuales les vende en el mercado de Cuenca.

Este es su primer crédito con la fundación y se animó a formar parte del banco  comunal gracias a una compañera del mercado, con el dinero que reciba  va a comprar  zanahoria, tomate, cebolloa, acelga, col, lechuga  y crias de pollos, vitaminas y alimento para criarlos y también  techo ardex  para su casa.

Tiene como  meta  terminar de construir  su casa.


La señora  María Cruz Q. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con tres de los cinco hijos que concibió, los dos primeros son casados y viven independientes, su hijo de 23 años  trabaja como albañil y  le ayuda un poco económicamente con los gastos del hogar, su hija le ayuda en su puesto de  mercado y su último hijo estudia en el colegio técnico Turi, el casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad que la construyo sola con su esfuerzo,  su esposo viajo al exterior hace diez años en busca del sueño americano y estabilidad económica para toda su familia pero al llegar allá se olvidó de los suyos, nos comenta que cuenta con un nuevo compromiso con quien se encuentra rehaciendo su vida.

María Cruz se dedica a la venta de quesillo, queso y todo tipo de granos en el mercado, esta actividad la realiza hace 35 años, empezó en el mercado 12 de abril y ahora labora en el mercado de la  feria libre y ya son 21 años en este lugar, trabaja todos los días de la semana sin descansar uno solo, su horario es de 6 a.m. a  6 p.m. no tiene puesto propio por lo que trabaja recorriendo todo el mercado.

Este  es su primer crédito en la fundación y con ese dinero va a  comprar quesillo,  tomate, paiteña, zanahoria, acelga, col y otras legumbres para surtir su puesto en el cual invierte mucho dinero cada semana. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo estudie y llegue a ser un excelente profesional y cuente con un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The Bonanza Community Bank is located in the community of El Carmen de Guzho in the city of Cuenca. Maize grows really well there, and the local adults work in farming. The younger people have moved to the big cities or overseas. 42-year old Sra. Martha is married and has four children aged 20, 17, 11, and 8. Her eldest daughter helps her with the sales of the produce in the market. Her 17-year old son works as a bricklayer, and the younger two are students at the local school called Agustín C. Vintimilla. Her husband is a bricklayer, and they are in the process of building their own home. Martha has a stall in the market where she sells different sorts of fresh grains and vegetables. She’s been doing this job since she was seven years old helping her mother. At the age of twenty one, she started her own stall where she works from 4 am buying produce and stays until 6pm on Mondays, Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays. On Thursday and Fridays she works in a cafe--she’s been doing this for four years--from 8am to 6pm. She also raises chickens to sell in Cuenca market. This is her first loan with the foundation. She was encouraged to join the community bank by one of her friends in the market. With the money she is going to buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, chard, cabbage, lettuce, and baby chicks. She will also buy vitamins and food for the chicks. In addition, Martha will buy Ardex roofing for her house. Her goal is to complete the construction of the house. Señora María Cruz Q. lives in the big city of Cuenca with three of her five children. The oldest two are married and live independently. Her 23-year old son is a bricklayer and gives her some money towards the household expenses. Her daughter helps her with the market stall, and her youngest son is a student at the Turi technical college. The house she lives in is her own, and she put in a lot of effort to build it. Her husband travelled overseas twelve years ago in search of the American dream and economic stability for the whole family, but when he got there he forgot about his family. María says she has a new partner with whom she is rebuilding her life. María sells quesillo (soft cheese), cheese, and all kinds of grains in the market. She’s been doing this job for 35 years. She began in the 12 de Abril market and now works in the Feria Libre market where she’s been for 21 years. She works there every day without a day off from 6am to 6pm. She doesn’t have her own market stall but walks around the market. This is her first loan with the foundation, and with the money she plans to buy cheese, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chard, cabbage and other vegetables to increase her stock. She spends a lot of money buying the produce each week. María’s dream is for her son to study hard, become a professional, and get a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicks, and roofing

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Fatuma Issa P. from Coastal Region. She is married with two children between the ages of one and four.
Fatuma has been running a video library and video show since 2007. In this type of business, a television is put into a specific house and is used to show movies, football or comedy. A charge is made to people who want to watch.
Fatuma works at her business for seven hours per day, 16+ days per week, and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 TZS in order to buy more video tapes and CDs for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her video library. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more video tapes and CDs for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Y. is from the village of Hasaan Lopez Jaena. She is 65 years old. Maria is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different products such as toothpaste  in the local community. Maria has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for snack vending. This will be the third loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for snack vending

loans.name: Stephen Abuga

texts.en:
Stephen Abuga A. is 33 years old. He is married to Joyce Nyambura and the father of three children who are currently going to school. He is a carpenter and also runs a small kiosk business which he has been operating for the last ten years on a busy street in Narok Town.

He learned about KADET from the chairlady of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy more stocks of sodas and food for his kiosk and also buy some equipment for his workshop.

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to open a bigger workshop where he can focus on his carpentry work.

His future dream is that he will be able to build his own stand and his own house. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of sodas and food for the kiosk and buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Tamemsuba Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the “Tamemsuba” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve; they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Fatmata C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. She is 45 years of age, married to a teacher, and they have four children – one in primary school and three in secondary school.

Fatmata sells firewood and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy more firewood and palm-oil in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and palm-oil in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Maroune

texts.fr: Maroune K. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge et de 04 autres qui lui confiés par des parents et de amis. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 27 janvier 2006 et a 04 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est productrice de pâte d'arachide et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa production afin de se procurer de plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer à l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Maroune K. is a 29 year-old woman, married and the mother of 3 dependent children and 4 others who have been entrusted to her care by relatives and friends. She has been a member of the DIAOBE MANDING Banc Villageois since January 27, 2006 and has been granted 4 successive loans and never had a problem repaying. She is a producer of peanut paste and her new loan will allow her to increase her production so as to make a larger profit, enabling her to contribute to the success of her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her business

loans.name: Lorry

texts.en:
Lorry P. is from the village of Mamanga Gamay. He is 33 years-old and married with one school-aged children. To make a living, Lorry owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lorry has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lorry joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Lorry is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorry from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Si Nob, have been married since 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the children attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Samnang S. has been selling vegetables for more than three years. She buys them from Kean Svay district, where she lives, and transports by her motorbike to sell at Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh. Mr. Si Nob is a military policeman.

Samnang has asked for Kiva loan. Her motorbike is old and does not work well, which costs her a lot of money in repairs. Hence, she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

Samnang will be able to save some money by not spending a lot of money for repairing costs any more.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang P., age 50, is the leader of this group loan. She was selected by its five members, who all live in Preak Kat village in the Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Samnang P. stays at home and takes care her three children. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sok, is a house constructor who is able to earn a small profit to support his family. In order to support her husband's construction business, Mrs. Samnang P. will use the loan that she sought from AMK to buy construction supplies to build houses. 

This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is car repairer while another one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to build houses

loans.name: Fanta’S Group

texts.en:
Fanta Jarbate, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Fanta’s Group. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children who range from 11 to 26 years old. She cares for one sibling. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. 

For four years, she has been selling beans, peanuts and pepper at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of beans, peanuts and pepper. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans, peanuts and pepper to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty K. M. is a married lady with one child, aged six years old. Her husband works for Service Water Trust Fund. Her business is located at Muthurwa, an open-air market in Nairobi. She sells clothes such as trousers, sweaters, shirts and coats. She has been in this business for four years now and has managed to employ two people. 

Betty sells to passers-by and also has repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers and so customers are "spoilt of choice". However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

Betty is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to increase her stock of clothes to meet the high demand by her customers. She hopes to diversify her business to property management some day which she believes brings in more income. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and determined.

loans.use: additional clothing for resale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic I. is from the village of Maligaya Echague. She is 43 years old. Marivic is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for more than 22 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials such as wood to make additional furniture. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as wood to make additional furniture

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban is a 32-year-old married man with three children aged 10, 12, and 6 years. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in a semi-permanent house and is the breadwinner of the family .Shaban’s family dream is to educate his children to attain better qualifications. He has been in the butcher business for seven years. He started as a hired employee but now he has his own butcher shop. His challenge is the rainy season when customer numbers are low. He adds that he hopes to have a bigger butcher shop in the near future. Shaban needs this loan to buy more cows to sell as beef in his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cows to sells as beef in his butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem K., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day. Her husband sells soy milk, earning an income of USD 8.30 per day. K. has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport soy milk to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria vende y compra productos de casa comerciales, por lo que ha sido un gran avance para ella, pues no tiene un trabajo que le genere ganancias para su hogar. Por iniciativa propia fue que aprendió este medio de vida ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos cuando estaban más pequeños, tiene 30 años en este negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje, etc. En el futuro quiere tener una gran variedad de clientes estables.
texts.en:
Ana Maria buys and sells commercial household products. This was a big step for her because she did not have a job in which she could earn household income. Of her own initiative, she learned this trade so that she could support her children when they were much younger. Ana Maria has been in this business for 30 years.

With this loan she plans to buy perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, make-up and other products. In the future, she wants to have a wide variety of stable customers.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, make-up and other products

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es: Tereso, de 52 años, convive con Maritza, de 50 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Yeraldo, de 16 y Bryan, de 13 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). En sus 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, nuca se sintió cansado, por lo contrario agradece todos los éxitos obtenidos hasta hoy, pues según menciona; gracias a su buena cosecha pudo educar a sus hijos. Ahora sus principales productos son los cultivos de; café, plátanos y maíz, los que cuida y mantiene junto a su esposa Maritza y, cuando ya están listos para ser cosechados, los vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Pero según cuenta Tereso, en épocas de campaña agrícola, los mismos compradores vienen a sus terrenos, para comercializar su producción. Por ello más adelante desea ampliar sus cultivos, con la compra de más hectáreas de terreno. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y en este corto tiempo compartió momentos muy gratos y felices con los integrantes de su banco comunal, que se apoyan constantemente. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar la máquina que utiliza para fumigar sus sembríos, ya que hace algunos días se malogró, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en: Tereso, 52, lives with Maritza, 50.  They have 6 children, but only live with 2 of them: Yeraldo, 16, and Bryan, 13.  They live in their own house located in the Sanchirio community of Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  In their 20 years of agriculture, they have never felt tired, on the contrary they are thankful for the successes they have had so far, such as being able to educate their children thanks to their good harvests.  Now the main products they grow are coffee, bananas, and corn, which they take care of and maintain together.  Once the crops are ready to be harvested, they are sold in the city's central market.  But in each harvest season, the same buyers come to their lands to buy their products.  Therefore they want to increase their harvest with the purchase of more hectares of land.  This is their third loan with MFP, and in a short time they have shared pleasant and happy moments with the other members of their communal bank, who help each other constantly.  With the loan they are requesting they plan on buying a machine to spray their fields, which recently stopped producing, and they will also buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a machine to spray fields

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia N. lives in the makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4children and all her children go to school, She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother). Sophia has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sophia sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Sophia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food items such as bunches of bananas, beef, and charcoal, sweet and Irish potatoes. She also generates additional income through her retail shop. The main business challenge(s) for Sophia include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and also to run three more restaurants in Kikoni. Sophia lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and charcoal.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy Q. is from the city of Banadero Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Ludy runs a tricycle transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Ludy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Ludy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Maria Confesora

texts.es:
