María Confesora tiene 68 años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Nueva Arica, un distrito con geografía bastante accidentada debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país, su principal actividad es la agricultura, aunque cuentan con pocas áreas fértiles, se encuentra situado a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María se dedica desD. hace 30 años a vender productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, ella nos comenta que su negocio nació D. la necesidad D. agenciarse D. un ingreso con el cual sacar adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo pocos productos y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo, su negocio ha crecido y cuenta con una clientela fija que acuD. siempre a consumir sus productos.

Ella compra productos D. primera necesidad en la ciudad D. Chiclayo y trata siempre D. ofrecer productos frescos (verduras, frutas) a sus clientes, su negocio es uno D. los mas surtidos en la zona por lo que es D. mucha ayuda para la comunidad, el distrito D. Nueva Arica es una comunidad con pocos habitantes (14 habitantes por Km2).

María Confesora ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través D. Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ella solicitó el crédito para ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda con la que contaba. Gracias a esta ampliación la acogida por su bodega ha crecido bastante y actualmente su demanda ha aumentado considerablemente. Por ello ha creído conveniente realizar una nueva ampliación adquiriendo más productos. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

María se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que han colaborado con ella a través del fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
María Confesora is 68 years old and lives with her family in the Nueva Arica district, located about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. It is a very rugged area situated near the mountains of the northern part of Peru.  The district of Nueva Arica is sparsely populated (14 people per square kilometer). Her main source of income is derived from agriculture, although she has access to few fertile areas.
 
For 30 years, María has worked selling staple goods and groceries from a store attached to her home.  Her business was born from the need to earn an income in order do proviD. for her family. Initially, she sold only a few products but now, because of her hard work, her business has grown and she has established a solid customer base which regularly buys her products.
 
María buys staple goods in Chiclayo and always strives to offer her clients fresh products (fruits and vegetables). Her business is one of the most well-supplied in the area and is a great support for the community. 
 
Maria has previously received a loan funded by Kiva, through Edpyme Alternativa's "Seed Money" program. At that time she applied for a loan in order to expand her business and to keep up with the level of demand. Thanks to this growth her store has become better known and currently demand has reached new heights. Therefore, she has seen the need to expand again and offer more products. To achieve this goal María is requesting a loan of $375 from Edpyme Alternativa.
 
Maria is very grateful to the those who have helped her through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase goods to expand her store.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca A. is 63 years old.  She is from Kisumu county.  She is a widow who is taking care of her five children. Most of her children have grown up – the first-born is 40 years old and the last is 25 years old.

She is in the business of selling dry fish in Winam market. She is currently applying for her second loan to enable her buy more fish to add to her stock. Prisca is in an area where fish is a delicacy and this has helped her get many customers. Her monthly income is 40,000 KES.

Prisca's desire is to be able to buy a piece of land and build a home for orphans.

loans.use: To buy dry fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside a su esposo y su hijo en el caserío Chacupe bajo, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Rosa se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la artesanía, ella elabora sombreros desde hace más de diez años, sus ventas las realiza mensualmente en el mercado de Monsefu a los agricultores de diferentes zonas, adicionalmente ella se dedica a la crianza de animales cuando tienen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado los vende en los mercados de la zona.

Ella desea adquirir materia prima como la palma y otros que utiliza para la elaboración de sombreros. Esta acción la ayudará a tener mayores márgenes de ganancia ya que los comprara al contado y no al crédito. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, married and lives with her husband and her son in the Chacupe village, a rural area that is the center of agriculture in the district of La Victoria. It is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

Rosa works doing traditional craft work. She has been making hats for more than 10 years. Her monthly sales are achieved through selling in the Monsefu market to farmers from different areas. Additionally, she raises animals and when they are appropriately developed she sells them in the markets. 

She wants to purchase raw materials such as palm and others to make hats. This action will help her to have higher profit margins since she purchases them with cash and not credit. Because of this, she finds it necessary to request a loan of 400 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa is a pretty quiet and responsible person. Her greatest desire is to be able to grow her business and advance her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for his shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 38 años, es una mujer enérgica y jovial. Vive dichosamente en su casa cedida por su madre con su esposo Javier, de 39 años y sus 3 hijos aún menores y estudiantes, por quienes se esfuerza diariamente. Mientras que sus hijos eran muy pequeños trabajaba sólo su esposo, pero a medida que fueron creciendo sus hijos, el presupuesto familiar no le alcanzaba. En vista de ello, ella quiso trabajar, entonces su esposo le ayuda a comprar un stand para vender sándwich. Desde entonces, hace 3 años vende en la puerta de su casa salchipapas (salchichas, pollos y papas fritas), y le va bien, porque ahora sus hijos no carecen de muchas necesidades. De esta manera está emprendedora mujer trabaja desde las 5 de la tarde hasta terminar de vender todo lo preparado, siendo a las 12 ó 1 de la madrugada, de ese modo no pierde el capital invertido. Esta contenta con su negocio y la utilidades de le brinda, además porque lo realiza sola y eso le hace ser independiente, por ello planea inmediatamente incrementar su negocio con la venta de mates, gaseosas y cervezas. Para el futuro piensa instalar un salón de belleza en el interior de su casa, para que pueda trabajar durante el día. Es el 5to crédito que tiene con MFP, y está agradecida por toda la ayuda que recibió, y se compromete pagar como siempre de manera puntual, para seguir contando con más ayudas que le permitan progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará gaseosas, cervezas y un termo, para vender mates calientes que a veces le piden sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, age 38, is an energetic and jovial person.  She lives happily in the house that her mother gave her.  She lives with her husband, 38 year old Javier, and their three minor children who go to school.  It is for them that she works hard every day.  

When her children were very little only her husband worked.  But, as the children were growing the family budget did not suffice.  In light of that, she wanted to work.  Her husband helped her buy a stand to sell sandwiches.  For three years she has been selling “salchipapas” (sausages, chicken, and French fries) in the doorway to her house.  It is going well for her because now her children are not lacking for much. 

This enterprising woman works from five in the afternoon until she finishes selling everything she has prepared.  This is at 12 or 1 in the morning.  This way she does not lose the money she has invested.  She is happy with her business and the profits it provides.  She is also happy because she works alone, and that makes her independent.

Her immediate plan is to increase her business by selling infusions, soft drinks, and beer.  In the future she plans to set up a beauty salon in her house so that she will be able to work during the day.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for all of the help that she has received.  She pledges to always make her payments on time.  She will do this to continue counting on more help, which will allow her to progress.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy soft drinks, beer, and a thermos in order to sell hot drinks that her customers sometimes request.

loans.use: to stock up on soft drinks and beer and to buy a thermos in order to sell hot drinks to her customers

loans.name: Asiago

texts.en:
Asiago is married with two children, aged three and eight years. He has been running a mixed farming business for six years in his native home of Kisii in South Rift Kenya. He sells his produce of milk, tea and bananas to the local market. He also runs a retail shop business, which adds to his farming income. Asiago has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to enable him to acquire an additional dairy cow. He says the acquisition of the additional dairy cow will boost his dairy production and income hence the entire family's living standard.
Asiago says his main challenges as a farmer are insufficient funds to pay for farm inputs and fluctuating market prices which drive fear into farmers. He remains appreciative for Juhudi Kilimo's effort to support farmers in doing business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr:
Cliente de 43 ans, très entreprenante ,ayant deja bénéficié de deux cycle de prêts  , elle a rembourse avec succès  ses deux premières cycles de prêts , elle a eu a faire des épargnes considérables et aujourd'hui  elle vient de bénéficier de son troisième cycle prêt.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , elle compte acheter 40 cartons de poissons sales, tel que 10 cartons de morues, 10 cartons  de capitaines et 20 cartons de soles,l'une de ses stratégies c'est  faire la vente en gros, demi gros et détail du poisson sale.
Elle tient a atteindre son objectif,continuer a épargner et pour le futur être une  importatrice de poissons sales .
Fier d'elle , elle promet de travailler encore plus dur pour atteindre son but.
texts.en:
This client, 43 years old, has an entrepreneurial spirit. She has already had 2 loans, both of which were properly repaid. She has been able to save a considerable amount and now is requesting a 3rd loan. With this loan, she plans to buy 40 boxes of salted fish: 10 boxes of of cod,  10 boxes of threadfin and 20 boxes of sole. One of her strategies is to sell the salted fish at wholesale, partial wholesale and retail.

She is determined to reach her goal of continuing to save for the future and and to become an importer of salted fish. With great pride, she promises to continue to work even harder in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy 40 boxes of different types of salted fish, such as cod, sole and threadfin

loans.name: Chouk

texts.en: Chouk V., 47, is married and resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated area in the country. V. and her husband produce chess tables, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 150 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. Chouk is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase wood to produce more chess tables. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more wood to produce chess tables

loans.name: Joseph Kibe

texts.en:
Joseph Kibe is 60 years old.  He is married to Margaret Njeri, who contributes to the family income by farming. He has three children, aged 28, 26 and 23 years. He has been  running his lumber yard for a period of about three years and earns an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

Joseph is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy more timber to sell.  He hopes to expand his business and own a bigger yard and create employment for others.

loans.use: to buy more timber to resell

loans.name: Diya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diya est crée le 31 / 05 / 2007. Il est composé de 25 femmes du même quartier. 

Elles ont formé leur groupe en affinité et par voisinage.

leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame safi âgée de 31 ans est divorcée et mère d'une fille.

Son activité est l'achat et la vente de tissus teintés qu'elle exerce au marché central. 

Son objectif est la prise en charge de sa fille et ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The Diya group was created May 31, 2007. It comprises 25 women from the same neighborhood. They created their group based on sympathies and proximity. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Safi is 31 years old; she is divorced and mother to one daughter. Her activity is the purchase and sale of dyed fabrics, which she procures at the central market.

Her objective is to provide for her daughter and for herself.

loans.use: to purchase " thioub" dyed fabrics.

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est constitué de six femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fanseyni qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autre enfants confié par ses proches.

Elle s’active dans la vente de produits maraichères. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 19 October 2001. It comprises six women who live in the same area. Their main activity consists of small retail businesses.

Ms. Fanseyni, on the right with the raised hand in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She also takes care of three additional children entrusted to her by close relations.

She is active in selling market garden products. She has lots of experience in this field.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and further develop her business.

Her profits will allow her to improve her family's standard of living (in terms of health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy market garden products.

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
Maria  tiene 20 años de edad, ella vive en casa de sus padres que esta ubicada en el Caserío de Angostura en el distrito de Tambogrande. María tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Maria se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ovinos (ovejas), ganado caprino(cabras) y aves de corral, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años aproximadamente Ella es muy dedicada a su  trabajo que realiza desde sus domicilio, y cuando sus animales alcanzan el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. 

Maria desea poder realizar mejoras en sus corrales para comprar más animales así como también comprar  de alimento balanceado, y cabras pequeñas por ello está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder alcanzar su objetivos.

 Maria es una mujer empeñosa muy conocida y querida por sus vecinos  que desea salir adelante con su hijo, y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and lives in her parent's home, which is located in the rural Angostura settlement in Tambogrande district.  Maria has a two year-old son.

Maria raises and sells sheep, goats and poultry.  She has been doing this type of work for about 3 years.  Maria is very dedicated to her work, which she does at her house.  When her animals reach the ideal size and weight she sells them in the local market.

Maria wants to be able to make some improvements to her animal pens so that she can buy more animals, and she also wants to buy some little goats and some animal feed.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Peruvian soles.  

Maria is a tenacious woman who is well known and liked by her neighbors.  She wants to get ahead with her son and be able to provide him with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her animal pens, and to buy more animals and animal feed

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar and his wife started their cashmere-product manufacturing business in 2005. Besides their full-time jobs at different local companies, they manage to run their home-based business successfully.

They produce pure cashmere out of raw cashmere by themselves; hence the products are completely handmade and qualified. They make various products such as baby boots, slippers, hats, blouses and so on.

The business income is considerably high during the tourist season; therefore Erdenebaatar is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase raw materials in order to make more products before Naadam, the biggest Mongolian National Holiday, where large numbers of tourists come to see Mongolia.

He has a 1-year-old baby boy and a 4-year-old daughter. His family lives in a small apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple wishes to expand their business and establish their own company in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to produce more finished goods.

loans.name: Sope Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Dabakh du banc villageois de Ngadji est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui font de l'embouche ovine et du petit commerce. Elles sont amies et parentes.
La responsable Anta, âgée de 49 ans, est mariée et mère de 08 enfants et a 03 autres à sa charge. Sur la photo elle est à droite et est habillée en boubou rose.
Elle fait du commerce et de l'embouche ovine. Elle vend des légumes et des denrées de première nécessite dans le village.
Elle voudrai, avec son prêt, acheter des sujets pour son élevage  et des marchandises pour son commerce.
Elle aide son mari pour les charges de la maison.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Dabakh of the Banc Villageois of Ngadji was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 14 women who fatten sheep and who have small businesses. The women are friends or are related. Anta is the group's official. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. And she has three others to support. In the photo, she is the one at the right dressed in a pink boubou. She does commerce in the fattening of sheep. She sells vegetables and basic provisions in the village. Anta would like to use her loan to buy animals to raise and some merchandise for commerce. She helps out her husband in covering household expenses.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es:
Jaime, reside en San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 17, 20 y 23 años de edad, él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, es negocio familiar y lo ejerce desde hace muchos años, lo aprendió de su padre y hoy día es el que permite tener una fuente de ingreso.
El necesita comprar materiales para realizar unos trabajos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar hierro y pintura, esta inversión le ayudara a solventar la falta de materiales y poder realizar los trabajos de los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio grande, tener una mejor estabilidad y ayudar a sus hijos a superarse, además de terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in San Miguel with his family; he has three children who are 17, 20 and 23 years of age.  He has a metal shop.  It’s a family business and he’s been in it for many years.  He learned from his father and today it’s what allows him to have a source of income.

He needs to buy materials to do some jobs so is asking for a loan to buy iron and paint.  This investment will help him solve his lack of materials problem and be able to complete jobs for customers.

His wish is to have a large business, better stability and to help his children improve themselves as well as to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy iron and paint for the shop.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika nació en el distrito de Yanatile de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú), tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  Ella alquila su taxi a S/. 25.00 nuevos soles a persona que desean brindar servicio de movilidad en la ciudad. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Erika requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. Su sueño de Erika es abrir un restaurante turístico en el centro de la ciudad del Cusco porque hay mucho movimiento de turistas. 

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Erika was born in Yantile District, Calca Province (Cusco, Perú).  She is 25 years old and is single.  She currently lives in the city of Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.  She leases out her taxi for 25 new soles to people who want to provide transportation services in the city.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Erika needs the loan to service her car.  Erika’s dream is to open a tourist restaurant in downtown Cusco because there are a lot of tourists.

The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

loans.use: to service her car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking business man aged 34. He is married and blessed with three children. For the past three years, he has been in the motorbike transportation business to make a living. He also sells milk to generate more income. Previously, he was involved in farming. 

In the next five years, he wants to become financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to open a milk sales shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business through the loan he acquires.

loans.use: to open a milk sales shop.

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por doce integrantes indígenas  que se dedican a diferentes actividades  económicas.
Este grupo se llama santa  Catarina  sus integrantes  son mujeres con fuerzas para triunfar y salir adelante son persona honradas y trabajadoras con deseos D. superarse.
La representante D. este grupo es  la  señora  Raquel una persona  que desD. muy chica que empezó D. trabajar  ya que su  familia son D. bajos recursos.
Ella se dedica a  la venta D. calzado y D. ropa y también a la venta D. carne D. res, esta muy contenta por que  siempre  venD. muy bien ya  que le brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes.
 Pidió el préstamo para la compra D. calzado  ya que venD. muy bien y tiene  clientes mayoristas  y necesita atender sus pedidos  y en ocasiones se atrasa por falta D. ingresos.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Gerardo  con quien tiene tres hijos: una mujer y dos varones  quienes cursan la primaria, le gusta mucho apoyar a sus hijos y darle una mejor calidad D. vida ya  que son por quien trabaja día a día
Le da las gracias a su esposo por el apoyo que le hado ya que con su ayuda pudo obtener sus  negocios y entre los dos pueden mejorar su vida y la D. sus hijos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Cecilia- se dedica a la venta D. antojitos mexicanos.
Leticia- se dedica a la venta D. antojitos mexicanos.
Tomasa- se dedica a la venta D. antojitos  mexicanos.
Cristina- se dedica a la venta D. antojitos mexicanos.
Carina- se dedica a la venta D. tamales.
Rogelia- se dedica a la venta D. tamales.
Teresa- se dedica a la venta D. antojitos mexicanos.
Claudia- se dedica a la venta D. tortillas.
Elida- se dedica a la venta D. ropa.
Minerva – se dedica a la venta D. tamales.
 Le dan las gracias  a fundacion por el  apoyo que le ha dado para salir  adelante y triunfar en un futuro.
texts.en:
This group consists of 12 indigenous members who are involved in different economic activities. This group is called Santa Catarina and its members are women who have the strength to succeed and get ahead. They are honourable and hardworking people with a desire to excel.

The group representative is Senora Raquel who started work from a very early age as her family is poor.

She asked for the loan to buy shoes as they sell well. She has retail clients and needs to meet their orders. Sometimes she gets behind with these for a lack of funds. She is happily married to Senor Gerardo with whom she has 3 children: a girl and 2 boys who attend primary school. She likes supporting and giving her children a better quality of life as it is for them that she works every day. 

She thanks her husband for his support as with his help she was able to set up her busineses and between the two of them they can improve their own and their children's lives.

The other members of the group are:
Cecilia- she sells Mexican dishes.
Leticia- she sells Mexican dishes.
Tomasa- she sells Mexican dishes.
Cristina- she sells Mexican dishes.
Carina- she sells tamales.
Rogelia- she sells tamales.
Teresa- she sells Mexican dishes.
Claudia- she sells tortillas.
Elida- she sells clothes.
Minerva – she sells tortillas.

They thank the Fudacion for the support given them to get ahead and succeed in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Mónica, cliente que anteriormente saco un crédito con financiamiento Kiva, ahora solicita otro  crédito, no tubo ningún problema con el pago de sus cuotas, ella  se dedica al servicio de peluquería a domicilio por las noches y fines de semana, ya que en el día trabaja en un salón de peinados en la zona de Calacoto, especialmente hace manicure, pedicura y también tintes, peinados. La señora Mónica vive con su papá y hermanos, ella tiene un hijo pequeño en edad escolar, es una clienta muy trabajadora y responsable, el crédito que ahora solicita es para compra de material  y equipamiento  para el trabajo que realiza como tintes y otros productos de peluqueria.
texts.en:
Mónica took out a previous Kiva loan.  She’s now asking for another loan.  She had no problems repaying the previous one.  She provides in-home beauty salon services in the evening and on weekends because during the day she works in a hair salon in the Calacoto zone.  Her specialties are manicures, pedicures, hair coloring and hair styling.

Mónica lives with her father and siblings.  She has a small, school age son.  She is a very hardworking, responsible client.  She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and equipment for the work she does like hair dyes and other beauty salon products.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies

loans.name: C2199 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Victoire, a 29-year-old married mother of a one-year-old child, is the president of a group called "Tuzamurane". This is her fifth successful year in the business of selling soft drinks. She works every day from 7 am until 8 pm every day.

Victoire and her team have requested a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks (juice, water, beer and so on) to sell. By using this loan, Victoire and her team expect to earn more profits, which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as building a better future for their families.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель района Шахритус. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. У них четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Илхом при доме имеет земельный участок, где он выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, семян лука и селитры, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Ilhom is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 41 years old, married and has four children. His wife works in the collective farm. Ilhom has a plot of land by his house where he grows vegetables for sale. He is taking out the loan to buy fuel, onion seeds and nitrate to sow and collect a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fuel, onion seeds and nitrate.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where he has been producing  and selling maize for the local market. He is married with eight children,  five of whom are still schooling. He is works as an electrician for additional income.

Augustine has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for  a venture into the transport business. He says there is a current boom in the business and it will help him in improving his family's living standards. He says the transport business will supplement his farming income.


He says  the unreliability of the rains  and the high costs of farm inputs are the major challenges in farming .

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
Edis tiene 20 años de edad. A los 14 años inició su vida como madre y esposa. Actualmente cuida de sus 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años, al lado de su pareja. Ellos viven en una casa rústica pero propia en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shaoriato. A su corta edad, ha aprendido como mantener y cuidar su hogar, con distintas actividades. Una de ellas es la agricultura. En los terrenos que su comunidad le asignó siembra kión y café. “Estos productos son los que más ingresos me genera, aquí la tierra es buena y nos conviene”, manifiesta.
En dos hectáreas obtiene 20 cargas de kión, es decir traslada estos frutos a la ciudad de Pichanaki, en 20 viajes. Mientras que solo media hectárea destina al café, y le va muy bien. Así también, cuenta con un negocio instalado en su hogar, una bodega en la que expende productos de primera necesidad y bebidas frías que viene bien por el clima caluroso de la zona. Edis, piensa mejorar su labor de comerciante contactando compradores de distintas zonas, así como ampliar su negocio. De esa manera remodelará su hogar y construirá más cuartos para sus hijos. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, y es la primera vez que se asocia a un banco comunal. Se compromete a ser constante y puntual tanto con la entidad financiera y su grupo. Invertirá el dinero en la contrata de personal para la limpieza y cosecha de las parcelas de kiones. Además comprará abonos orgánicos para el café.
texts.en:
Edis is 20 years old.  At the age of 14 she started her life as wife and mother.  She currently cares for her two children who are 4 and 6 years old alongside her partner.  They live in a rustic house but located right in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shaoriato.  At her young age she’s learned how to keep and care for her home with various activities.  One of them is farming.  On land that her community assigned to her she grows ginger and coffee.  “These products are the ones that generate the most income for me; the soil is good here and it’s advantageous for us,” she states.

From the two hectares she gets 20 loads of ginger that are transported to the city of Pichanaki in 20 trips.  Although she only dedicates half a hectare to coffee she does very well.  She also has a home-based store where she sells basic staple items and cold beverages that are well suited to the hot climate in the area.

Edis plans to improve her work as a merchant contacting buyers in different zones as well as expanding the store.  This way she’ll remodel her home providing more rooms for her children.

This will be her first MFP loan and the first time she’s been associated with a communal bank.  She commits to be punctual and constant both with the financial institution and with her group.  She will use the money to hire personnel to weed and harvest the ginger fields and she’ll also buy organic manure for the coffee.

loans.use: to hire laborers and to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber Province, Mongolia. Her husband has a stable job. Their three children go to school and kindergarden. She started her business in 2010 selling cart food. Now she rents a counter in a market selling groceries. Now that her business is stable enough, she wants to expand her business by selling fruit. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a father of three children aged eighteen, ten and three. He has been in farming for over fifteen years, producing and selling tea and milk to the local market in his home area of Murang'a, Central Kenya.  He also runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Peter has requested a loan of KES 63,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says the dairy income will help him pay for his children's education.  He adds that he is optimistic with his farming business and sees his businesses grow with the loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

He is also concerned with the fluctuation in milk prices in the local market

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 49-year-old married man and the father of 3 children. For 32 years, he has worked in construction, specializing in cement work. His wide experience in the field has earned him the trust of contractors.

Adel is well-known in the region, and he has a very good reputation. Adel works hard to improve his business, and he often purchases new tools and machines to keep his business up-to-date. Adel is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools and machines for his business.

This is Adel's first loan with Al Majmoua, and he hopes this loan will be with an excellent experience for future investments. He hopes he can provide his family with the best living and education possible.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and machinery.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Lida has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Lida has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 37 year-old married man with no children. His wife Saumu is a tailor who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Juma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past 1 year; his potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of lack of adequate capital to expand his business. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline, 28, is a smallholder farmer based in Eldoret which is a growing rural agricultural town in Kenya that is home to a tribe that produces world famous long-distance runners. Last year, she started farming on her one acre piece of land where she grows vegetables and keeps dairy animals and poultry. So far, she has employed two people to help her run the small farm. 

Mercyline is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. An additional cow will produce additional milk for sale. The increase in income will come in handy since late last year she had her second child whom she spends most her time tending to. 

Returns from this investment will go towards her loan repayment, food, and medical expenses for the newborn. The money will also help her take care of household related expenses. Mercyline is banking on Kiva lenders to lend her a loan that would change her life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 58 ans. Léontine est veuve mère de trois enfants, dont deux à sa charge. Léontine  vit seule et assure toute seule ces diverses charges. Pour cette raison, Léontine vend de la nourriture depuis six ans environ. Léontine s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léontine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AFEPEB, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres.

loans.name: Dédé Chantale's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Dédé Chantale (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Dédé Chantale n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Dédé Chantale est mariée à un certain Marius. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Dédé Chantale et son mari. Pour cette raison, Dédé Chantale vend des tenues friperies depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Dédé Chantale s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dédé Chantale sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a married woman and has one son. Her husband is working as a hammock salesman and, as this is an unstable business, she must help with the family's expenses. Three years ago she made a decision to help her family's economy so she used an empty space at her home to raise chickens and sell them. Now her husband is a driver and Cayetana administrates two businesses. She is looking for a credit of US$200 dollars because in December she increases her sales. She needs to invest right now in order to allow her the time to raise all of the chickens and to make more money. She has very high expectations because people know her and always come to the business to buy her chickens and hammocks as well.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Cayetana es una mujer casada, su esposo se dedicaba a la venta de hamacas, siendo este un oficio un poco inestable, ella tiene la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos familiares pues tiene 1 hijo menor. Hace 3 años tomo la decisión de apoyar económicamente, contando con espacio en su domicilio particular, comenzó a criar pollos para su venta. Ahora su esposo se contrato como chofer cargador y es ahora Cayetana quien atiende los 2 negocios. Esta interesada en obtener un préstamo por la cantidad de US$200 dólares a 6 meses pues en Diciembre se incrementan las ventas. Necesita hacer la inversión ahora pues el pollo tiene un periodo de crecimiento para poder engordarlos y venderlos a buen precio. Sus expectativas son buenas, pues la gente ya los conoce y vienen a buscarlos de otros lugares para comprar tanto hamacas como pollos.

loans.use: chickens raise and sale

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is a 38 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Absheron region. He is married and has 3 children.
He cleans and feeds the sheep and cows and sells their meat in the bazaar. He does not have a butcher shop and it is obstacle for him to improve his business. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to build a butcher shop which will help to get a good income and meet the needs his family.

loans.use: To build a butcher shop

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en:
Griselda has been running her restaurant for more than 10 years in her hometown of García, Nuevo León. She has seen her business grow gradually and has had the opportunity to employ various people as business collaborators. Griselda has a daughter in college and wants to help her finish her professional career successfully. Her love for her family and her desire for improvement have motivated her to work harder every day.

At this time, Griselda needs a loan of $925 to stock the restaurant with necessary merchandise. Her efforts and hard work have kept her in business for a long time and she would like her restaurant to continue growing. You can help make this possible by making the decision to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Griselda tiene más de diez años con su restaurante, en la localidad de García, Nuevo León, de donde es originaria. Ella ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco y ha tenido la oportunidad de emplear a varias personas para que colaboren con ella en su negocio. Griselda tiene una hija que actualmente esta estudiando y quiere apoyarla a concluir con éxito su carrera profesional, el amor a su familia y los deseos de superación la han motivado a esforzarse casa día más.

En estos momentos Griselda necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que empleará para surtir las mercancías que necesita para el restaurante. Su esfuerzo y trabajo la ha mantenido por tanto tiempo en el negocio y quiere que su restaurante continúe creciendo, tú puedes ayudar a que esto sea posible, decídete a ayudarla.

loans.use: Acquire supplies

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria is a widow and has seven sons. Five of them are married and the last two are studying. She began her business nine years ago with the help of her husband, when they both sold their products in small markets of their city. They bought the clothes directly from the USA. In one of these trips to the markets, there was an accident and her husband passed away. She had to educate and provide for her sons. She added used clothes and bed sheets to her sales as her clients were requesting these new products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase bed sheets from the USA. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. She and her family very much appreciate your support that enables her to continue with her business and take care of her last two sons.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

María es una mujer viuda y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 5 ya están casados y 2 están estudiando. Ella inició con su negocio hace nueve años atrás, con ayuda de su esposo ambos se colocaban en mercados de las colonias de la localidad y vendían sus productos, ellos compraban la ropa directamente de EUA., y en uno de esos viajes fue que tuvieron un accidente y su esposo falleció. Ella tuvo que ver por la educación y manutención de todos sus hijos y agrego a la venta de ropa usada, edredones y sábanas que también le solicitaban sus clientes.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para invertir en pacas de edredones y sábanas comprados de EUA., ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y sacar adelante a sus dos últimos hijos.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is one of the young ladies that join SPBD last year. Her business is making handicrafts such as earrings for the ladies, bracelets, hair accessories and picture frames already designed with different styles. Foketi sells her products at the flea market at Fugalei, which is preferable because more income can be earned here than anywhere else. She started last year with a loan of $750 and now she is on her second loan of $1250. She sells her products throughout the week opening seven days from six o’clock in the morning to five o’clock in the evening earning $800 a day. After deducting all her expenses, she earns about four hundred to five hundred profit a day and about two thousand to two thousand and eighty tala a week. She is looking forward to supply more in the following week of the South Pacific Games.

loans.use: “Buy frames, paints, materials, x-saw and kofi for the carving”

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Mr. Kenneth O. is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has been selling VCDs and provisions since 2004. This is a business he learnt for 3 years. He is equally a LAPO member. In future he plans to increase the variety of his VCDs and sell wholesale. He will be grateful if a loan in the amount of US$ 400 is given to him to enable him buy more VCDs  and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more video discs & provisions

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
The opportunities have never been scarce for Maria, who has worked incessantly in diverse trades to support her family. Maria has formed her own businesses depending on the occasion and the demands of the community. With her earnings she has been able to proviD. food for her two children and send them to school. They are now grown and have become productive members of the community. She feels happy that she has completed her work as a mom, although this job truly never ends because she will always be concerned for their wellbeing.

Now she finds herself in her home alone with the company of her husband who is also working every day with the objective of improving their family’s economic situation. This constantly motivates Maria to work hard and she decided to start a small business in her house breeding and raising pigs. She happily watches as the number of pigs increase. Because she now sells some of the piglets, she has been able to create a substantial and stable source of income that she uses to support herself and her husband.

Maria now wants to improve the area where she raises her pigs and also improve the quality of feed that they receive. Her goal is to increase her profits and to breed and raise even more pigs.

Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

Translated from Spanish by Ally, Nikki and Tommy of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Las oportunidades nunca son escasas para Marina, ya que siempre ha trabajado en diversos oficios para sostener a su familia, durante mucho tiempo fue formando sus propios negocios D. acuerdo a la ocasión y a la demanda D. su querida comunidad y con éstas les pudo brindar educación y alimentación a sus dos hijos que ahora se han convertido en hombres D. bien. Ella se siente muy satisfecha D. haber cumplido con su labor D. madre, aunque este rol no culmine jamás y siempre este pendiente D. su bienestar.

Ahora se encuentra en su hogar únicamente en compañía D. su esposo y ambos trabajan día a día con el objetivo D. incrementar su nivel D. vida. Este hecho la anima constantemente y ha decidido emprender su pequeña empresa en casa criando cerditos y observa con gran alegría el incremento del número D. estos ya que los comercializa cuando aún están pequeñitos y D. esa manera logra sustanciales ingresos económicos para sostenerse.

Desea mejorar las instalaciones D. su criadero y elevar su nivel D. alimentación con el objetivo D. incrementar sus ganancias y el número D. los mismos.

Apoyemos a esta mujer esforzada y hábil a conseguir lo que se propone.

loans.use: Increase the nutrients in her daily animal feed and improve the space that she uses to raise her piglets.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca Rosa is an enterprising single woman with hopes of having her own business so she can support her elderly parents while having a stable life at the same time.

For four years, she has made a living by selling various products in her small grocery store. Her sales have increased considerably over the years, and she has expanded her business and improved its structure. Her initial capital was 1,800 córdobas from her own savings.

Blanca Rosa has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she feels very satisfied with the credits they have offered her in opportune moments. They have helped her provide the necessities to her business and satisfy her clients every day. She has a record of twenty-six credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Blanca Rosa es una mujer Soltera y emprendedora con deseos de tener un negocio propio para poder apoyar a sus padres los cuales estan ancianos y al mismo tiempo tener una vida estable.

Desde hace cuatro años Blanca Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos varios (pulpería), sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$1,800.00 (córdobas) los cuales eran de sus ahorros.

Blanca Rosa trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Cuatro años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de Veintiseis créditos.

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en: Abdulla lives with his family in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He was in the army for about 8 years. When he left he started a new retail shop. He has decided enlarge his business so he is requesting an individual loan to buy extra materials like baskets, boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, twin-picks and triple-picks to complete his stock and make a good income to help his family. He is happy that he can further this business.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en: I am Alice Y. M.. I am in my late forties, married and a mother of five: two boys and three girls. My husband is a retired army junior officer who earns income by transporting goods on his donkey cart. My group members are Khalida S. and Nazira B., who are both borrowing to help with their family’s sawdust businesses. Sawdust is used as fuel in small villages and towns here in Pakistan. All of us have known each other for a long time and often help each other in times of need.

loans.use: To buy an additional donkey cart for her son

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria’s years of dedication have helped her be a decisive woman and today have become the motor that drives her family’s progress. She is dedicated to the sale of wool and, at the same time, she teaches crafts to her customers who each day visit her stand, located in her town’s little market. In this way, Maria enjoys life and strives to improve. With this purpose, she has decided to improve her workshop and not to neglect her animals which she keeps in a small stable outsiD. of the city. She wants to continue and support her youngest child’s studies who will apply for entry into university. In order for those wishes to come true, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the wholesale purchase of wool and have more merchandise available for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Los años D. dedicación a Maria la han ayudado a ser una mujer decidida que hoy se ha convertido en el motor que impulsa el progreso D. su familia. Ella está dedicada a la venta D. lanas y a su vez enseña manualidades a sus clientes que cada día acuden a su pequeño stand ubicado en un mercadillo D. su localidad, así Maria se gana la vida y desea seguir mejorando, con este propósito está decidida a implementar mejor su taller y a no descuidar a sus animales en un pequeño establo que tiene fuera D. la ciudad, quiere continuar y apoyar los estudios del menor D. sus hijos que postulará para ingresar a la universidad. Para que estos anhelos se concreten solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra D. lana al por mayor a fin D. tener mayor mercadería disponible para sus ventas.

loans.use: Capital for offering a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Anora

texts.ru:
Anora T. lives in the town of Vahdat with her family. She has five children, married, she is 38 years old. She does not hold a job, but makes her living by agriculture. The whole family is helping her all together. Currently she has sowed wheat on her piece of land. She needs finances to buy fertilizer. The prices on fertilizer have been high in time for the sowing season and this is why Anora needs a loan to buy the fertilizer and use the rest of the money to pay for the rent of the land. She will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Табарова Анора проживает в городе Вахдат. Живет со своей семьей. У нее 5 детей и муж, а возраст 38 лет. Нигде не работает , но зарабатывает деньги путем земледелия. Вся семь вместе с ней дружно помогает ей .Сейчас на своем участке она засеила пшеницу. Но ей нужны средства , чтобы закупить удобрения. В связи с приходом посевного сезона , цены на удобрения поднялись и поэтому она хочет получить кредит , который поможет закупить удобрения, а оставшуюся часть денег отдать за аренду земли. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Priscar

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Priscar M., who is married and has no children. In 2003, Priscar established her pharmacy business. Assisted by her husband and one employee, working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $100 per month. Priscar now requires a loan in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $87. In the future, Priscar plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of medicines.

loans.name: Antonio Simião

texts.pt:
Antonio was born in Vilanculos, district of the province of Inhambane. He is 24 years old and a single father of a 1-year-old daughter. He went to school up until the 7th grade but he had to drop out so that he could work more hours, earn more money and get married to his wife. Besides his family he is also responsible for his brother that lives in his home. Antonio left Vilanculos with an uncle that lived in Namaacha, a village that borders Swaziland, to look for work. He worked for his uncle for 2 years earning only 150,00mt. This very reduced amount was not enough for much and, in 2002, Antonio decided to start his own business. Using money he had saved from his salary, he left his uncle home and rented a room where he still lives. Antonio has been in the retail business for 6 years, working between the hours of 7:00am and 9:50pm when students are dismissed from school. His best selling products are radios, cds and cell phone chargers. His monthly revenue is 2500,00mt and he is able to set aside 800,00mt from that. His business has grown because it satisfies his clients' needs. This is the second loan Antonio requests from Hluvuku and the first through Kiva. The first one was in the amount of 5000,00mt and it was used to purchase home appliances that were sold at his establishment. The loan was repaid without any problems. He is requesting 7000,00mt this time to expand his merchandise variety.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

António nasceu em Vilanculos um distrito da província de Inhambane é solteiro e pai de uma filha com 1 ano de idade, tem 24 anos de idade e estudou até 7ªclasse teve que parar porque precisava de juntar dinheiro para poder se casar com a sua esposa e o tempo de trabalho não era suficiente. Alem da sua família António responsabiliza-se pelo seu irmão mais novo que vive em sua casa. António sai de Vilanculos com o seu tio que vivia em Namaacha vila fronteriça com a Swazilandia a procura de emprego. Trabalhou para o seu tio durante 2 anos onde só ganhava mensalmente 150,00mt valor este que não chegava para nada. Em 2002 António resolve fazer o seu próprio negocio com o dinheiro que havia guardado do salário saiu em casa do tio e alugou uma dependência onde ele vive até hoje. António exerce actividade comercial a 6 anos onde tem um horário de trabalho das 7:00h as 21:50 hora em que os alunos da noite despegam. Os produtos que tem mais saída são ( Rádios, Discos e Recargas de telemóveis ). Tem lucros mensal de 2500,00mt e deste consegue poupar 800,00mt mensalmente. O negocio do António está melhorar porque consegue satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes. Este é o segundo empréstimo do António no Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro foi de 5000,00mt e uso o dinheiro para compra de electrodomésticos para revender em seu estabelecimento e conseguiu pagar sem nenhum problema e pede este de 7000,00mt para ampliar a sua mercadoria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand stock.

loans.name: Mujeres En Ritmo Group

texts.es:
The ladies consisting of this committee are dedicated to various activities, among which we can cite the sale of various merchandise like clothes, shoes, arts, charcoal, cleaning products, makeup, foods, fruits and vegetables, among others.

Because of their limited chances of receiving capital to start their small businesses, now that the financial institutions generally ask for a business reference to give credit, they have applied to the Paraguay Foundation, which not only helped them get capital, but also gave them classes that will help them be better administrators.

So that their children don’t face the same economic and academic limitations that they had when they were younger, these beautiful ladies fight day to day to be able to obtain the financial ability to improve the quality of life for their families.

With the credit they take, they will purchase various merchandise and supplies for their businesses and will raise their incomes. The merchandise to be acquired is: charcoal, fruit, meat, sugar, dairy, cleaning products, art, vegetables, medicinal muds, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades, entre las que podemos citar la venta de mercaderías varias como ropas, zapatos, artesanías, carbón, artículos de limpieza, maquillaje, comidas, frutas y verduras, entre otros.

Debido a que sus posibilidades de conseguir capital para empezar sus pequeños emprendimientos, ya que las entidades financieras por lo general solicitan una basta referencia comercial para otorgar créditos, ellas acudieron a la Fundación Paraguaya que no solo accedió a ayudarlas si no que a la vez reciben capacitaciones que les ayuda a ser mejores administradoras.

Para que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones tanto económicas como académicas que ellas tuvieron de jóvenes, estas bellas mujeres luchan día a día para lograr obtener el ingreso económico suficiente que permita mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Con el crédito que llevarán compraran mercaderías e insumos varios para sus negocios y así lograr aumentar sus ingresos. Las mercaderías a ser adquiridas son: carbón, frutas, carnes, azúcar, lácteos, productos de limpieza, artesanías, verduras, productos de limpieza, barros medicinales, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and products

loans.name: Isidora De Los Angel

texts.es:
Mrs. S. is 54 years of age, is unmarried and is responsible for two grandchildren. Mrs. S. sells general merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and other items. With the loans she has received she has managed to invest in grocery store products since one of her greatest dreams is to establish her own store. Currently, she goes out and sells her products and also takes care of an elderly woman, with the purpose of being able to acquire more income in order to move forward with her two grandchildren which were left to her care after the death of her daughter. One of her biggest challenges is to raise the children since they have nobody else to depend on.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sanches tiene 54 años de edad es soltera tiene a su cargo a dos nietos , la señora S. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general como es venta de ropa cosmetico y otros con los creditos adquiridos con fundacion ella ha logrado ir invirtiendo en productos de pulperia ya que uno de sus mayores sueños es poder establecerse , en la actualidad sale a vender y tambien sale a cuidar a una señora de la tercera edad , con el proposito de poder adquirir mas ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus dos nietos los cuales le quedaron al fallecer su hija y uno de sus grandes retos es poder lograr formarlos ya que los niños no cuentan con nadie mas.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama Nazareno estamos ubicados en la comunidad de el Jicaro, Alauca, nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Oscar F.: me dedico  hace 2 1/2 años a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas y tambien vendo queso, actividad que realizo de forma ambulante, este negocio es la fuente principal en la generacion de ingresos que me permiten cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.
Otilia F.: ella tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a la venta y produccion de rosquillas, actividad que ella realiza en su casa de habitacion y que distribuye en diferentes negocios de Danli y el Paraiso.
Francisca F.: ella tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta y produccion de rosquillas y pan de casa, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los ingresos que ella genera le ayuda en gran parte a su esposo para cubrir con todos los gastos de la casa.

necesitamos un credito para salir adelante con nuestros negocios para seguir mejorando nuestras condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Hello, our group is called Nazareno. We are located in the town of Jicaro, Alauca. We know each other very well and we have always worked together. Our group works in this way: Oscar F.: I have worked for two and a half years making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie specialty), and also I sell cheese, an activity that I do in open air markets. This business is the principal source of income generation that allow me to cover the expenses of my household. Otilia F.: She has worked for longer than 25 years selling and making rosquillas, an activity that she does in her home and that she distributes in different businesses of Danli and the Paraiso. Francisca F.: She has spent 20 years selling and making rosquillas and bread in her home. She is married and she has 2 children. With the income that she generates she helps her husband cover a large part of the household expenses. We need a loan in order to move forward with our businesses in order to improve our qualities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make rosquillas

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo Loneli de 1 año de edad.  Cuenta con su pequeña carpintería, donde produce y vende muebles desde hace 2 años, en los cuales, ha tratado de ganar lo suficiente para comprar material y seguir incrementando su negocio, lo que está pasando poco a poco.  Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que con él, tiene la opción de brindarle a su pequeño hijo un futuro mejor, pero el trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que tiene que estar constantemente vigilando su negocio. Todo el trabajo de Luz es por su hijo, su máxima alegría, a quien quiere ofrecerle  todas las comodidades y una buena educación.  Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor material para elaborar camas y demás muebles, para así, incrementar sus ganancias y en el futuro ser una gran carpintería.
texts.en:
Luz is 21-years old and is single. She lives at home with her parents and her 1-year old baby brother, Loneli. She has a small carpentry shop, where she has been building and selling furniture for the past 2-years. She earns enough to buy materials and improves her business little by little. She enjoys working very much and she has the option of offering a better future for her little brother, but she sacrifices much for the job as she has to constantly watch over the business. All the work that Luz does is for her brother. It gives her the most joy to be able to offer him all the comforts and the best education. With the funding of this loan she would like to buy better materials to build beds and other items of furniture. She makes this request to gain better profits in hopes to be the best carpenter in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the necessary material for the fabrication of furniture.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas ubicado en el Jr. Urubamba Nº. 228, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en el arreglo D. su local. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el alquiler D. su local. Se dedica a su hogar y a administrar su negocio, ahora se encuentra un poco delicada D. salud.   

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, arreglará su local para tener una buena infraestructura. 

Rosa se sienta feliz porque comparte experiencias buenas y positivas con mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Community Bank "Las Aguilas" (meaning, The Eagles) located in Jr. Urubamba No. 228 in the district of Calleria, in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 63 years old, she is a widow and a mother of 5 grown children. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for S/.300 and she decided to invest the funds in remodelling her store. She has been with the Community Bank for the past 2 years.

She currently depends on the store she leases. She spends her time at home and administering her business, especially now that she has failing health.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in 5 months, she remodel her store to improve the infrastructure.

Rosal is happy to have such good and positive experiences with strong and hardworking women.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her store.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan consisting of four borrowers. All of the members are people who live in Knasondaiy Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Mr. B. Ly , age 22, sells carving woods, ordering the wood from a wholesale supplier and transporting the wood to sell to markets nearby his commune. His wife, Mrs. Pouv Kimnan, 22, is a grocery seller and is the mother of one young child. Ly requests is requesting a loan to purchase a wheel to use to connect to his cart for his business transportation. Ly is a group leader that has three additional members as listed below:

Mr. Peou D., age 25, owns a car and provides customers taxi services. He requests a loan to buy a car wheel to replace a broken one.

Mrs. Chea P. is a 39 year old widow that sells thatch from her home. She would like additional income and therefore requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise.

Mrs. Po S. makes a living by selling Chinese Noodles. She applies for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a wheel

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka A., 71, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to her regular clients, family and friends 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~291 USD).

SPBD loans are Luka’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase an over-lock machine, cotton material, and sewing equipment such as scissors, thread, and needles to further improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase an over-lock machine, poplin and linen material, thread, needles and zippers

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu Adama is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been a food vendor for 5 years now, a business through which she makes income to support her family. She sells fante kenkey, which is one of the favorite foods enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it supplies carbohydrate components in diets. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled maize and is eaten with either stew or soup, and it can also be mashed for ice kenkey.

Zenabu takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supplies of maize. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy maize in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Zenabu belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She also hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her home.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Mrs. B. became a Paglaum Member on May 05, 2008. She is 49 years old, and lives in West Poblacion, Rizal, Zambo, Norte. She is a widow, and has four children: one is in college and the other three are in high school. 

Being a single parent of four children, she must always work hard for a living. She has faced many obstacles and challenges along their way. Her husband died young due to severe sickness.

Before she became a member of PDP-LP she already had a small business. She is now requesting her second loan, a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy assorted grocery items such as vegetables and spices. She also sells banana cues (bananas dipped in brown sugar and deep fried). Her usual customers are students, strangers passing by, teachers, municipal employees, and many others because her business is located along the National Highway near a school. Her business is growing and the number of customers is increasing.

She hopes that the business will grow bigger and more stable in the future, so that she can sustain their living. Like other parents, she is working hard for her children. She dreams that all of them can complete college and be able to support themselves. She is grateful for Paglaum’s presence in her community, for its programs and its services that help people realize the importance of savings, insurance, and social responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
"Life is becoming difficult due to the economic crisis," says Francisca G.. She also said that if we have the five elements of success such as discipline, unity, patience, industriousness and sacrifice, we can defeat poverty.

Francisca and her family are living in a mountainous area near the riverside located in the village of Kinacao, Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Oscar and they have six children. Four of them are already college graduates and two are high school students.

Francisca manages two kinds of businesses: a general store and a fish vending business while her husband is maintaining their piggery and poultry businesses. The couple is doing their best to improve their businesses, especially since they only have few competitors in their area. Francisca is hoping to borrow at least 5,000 pesos to buy rice that she will sell retail and also to start in the electronic load business. This will not only increase her income but also to meet the demands of their customers for their basic necessities.

loans.use: To purchase rice and electronic load business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is 27 years old. She is married and a mother of one kid. Currently, the kid is breastfeeding. She lives with her husband who is a businessman. Her family is doing very well, and she is so happy about that. Vida is in the service industry sewing dresses and clothing. She has been sewing for two years now, and is a specialist in women's clothes. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, Vida has one apprentice whom she is giving quality training for her future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with a quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for sewing such as linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Adekunle

texts.en: Adekunle A. is 39 years old and married with a child. Adekunle sells sarongs and laces. His customers are mostly women and young girls. He is requesting a loan for N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. He says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Koch

texts.en:
Koch S., 26, is a professional weaver and lives with her young child and her husband in the Takeo province. She typically makes US $3 per day, while her husband is a blacksmith and earns US $4 every day.

Koch would like to take out a loan to purchase silks so that she can weave many clothes to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase silks to weave clothes

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y sus 8 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años decidió vivir de la agricultura, y junto a su esposa consolidaron su hogar en base a esta actividad, la cual hasta ahora, les ha brindado lo suficiente para sus gastos familiares. Sabino y toda su familia, trabajan arduamente en el cultivo, abonado y cuidado de sus tierras hasta que llegue el tiempo para la cosecha, y en esa época se intensifica su labor, porque se debe recoger el producto, encostalarlo y transportarlo a la ciudad más cercana para su comercialización. Para el futuro, Sabino está planeando mejorar su producción sembrando otras variedades de papa. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ha escuchado que este trabajo es solidario, y su deseo es cumplir este principio en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de abono y semilla de papa, en una variedad mejor calidad a la que ha sembrado en la campaña anterior.
texts.en:
Sabino is 55 years of age and lives with his wife and eight children in their own house. More than 20 years ago he chose the agricultural life. Together with his wife they organized their household around this activity and up until now it has provided them what they need for their family's expenses. Sabino and his entire family work very hard at cultivating, fertilizing and caring for their fields until harvest time arrives. Then their labor intensifies because they have to harvest the crop, package it into sacks, and transport it to the nearest city to sell it. For the future, Sabino is planning to increase his production by planting other varieties of potatoes. This is the first time he has taken a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He has heard that this effort is based on solidarity and he hopes to fulfill this principle in his communal bank. The money he requests is for the purchases of fertilizer and seed potatoes of a better quality than he has sown in the past season.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Назокат Почоева  занимается продажей товаров, необходимых в производстве одежды. Это пуговицы, нитки, шерстянные нитки для вязания,резинки иглы и другие предметы галатереи. Назокат замужем, имеет 4 детей. Дочки Назокат уже замужем и живут в домах своих мужей. Сын Назокат Джума занимается изготовлением национальных лепешек, выпекает их в тандыре. Муж Назокат работает повором в столовой.
Назокат хочет получить кредит для расширения ассортимента своего товара. Она запрашивает сумму в размере 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Nazokat P. sells products necessary for manufacturing clothing. These include buttons, thread, wool yarn for knitting, elastic, needles and other sewing products. Nazokat is married and has 4 children. Nazokat’s daughters are already married and live in their husbands’ homes. Nazokat’s son, Djuma bakes traditional flat bread; he bakes it in a tandoor oven. Nazokat’s husband works as a cook in a canteen. Nazokat would like to take out a loan to expand her product assortment. She is asking for a sum of 3500 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
