Merly C. operates a hog raising business and food processing business at the same time. She is now requesting a loan of PHP10,000 that she can use to support her small businesses.  She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request so she can help her husband in providing a better life for their family.  
	
She used to manage a store for five years but then due to some problems, her business failed so she decided to venture into hog raising and food processing.  Merly is 39 years old and her husband, Fernando, is working as a welder abroad.  They have two children: one already stopped his studies and the other one is currently in high school.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Насиба, женщина 31 года замужем, имеет четверых детей.Она занимается производством козьей пряжи. 
У неё сейчас несколько десятков коз и баранов. Насиба хочет кредитоваться в "Аранде" для увеличения оборотного капитала бизнеса животноводства. Насиба очень любит занимается откормом скота.На снимке Насиба в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a 31-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She is involved in manufacturing goat yarn. She currently has several dozens of goats and rams. Nasiba wants to obtain a loan through Arvand in order to increase her animal husbandry business working capital. Nasiba loves the business of livestock feeding very much. The photograph shows Nasiba on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing business working capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Nancy se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos como chapla y wawa, los cuales los comercializa en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco. Además Nancy vende abarrotes en general en las ferias, actividad que realiza los días domingos.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y abarrotes.
Los sueños de Nancy son construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Kusikuy communal bank, which means "Cheer up" in quechua. Nancy is single. She is 49 years old and has two children. Nancy works making traditional breads (such as "chapla" and "wawa"), which she sells at her space in the F. Vivanco market. In addition, Nancy sells other groceries at the markets on Sundays. Nancy needs a loan of 1500 soles, which will be used to purchase flour and groceries. Nancy's dream is to add a second floor to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and groceries

loans.name: Confidence

texts.en: Confidence is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Warri with her family. Confidence sells second-hand clothes and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. With increased stock, she will be able to meet customer demand. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena P. D. A. resiD. en el municipio D. Armenia del departamento D. Sonsonate. A sus 60 años D. edad, vive con su esposo Sixto, quien le ayuda a administrar un  negocio D. una  tienda D. productos D. consumo, en el mercado D. Armenia. Juntos trabajan diariamente para cubrir sus gastos y subsistir. María Elena y Sixto solicita n un préstamo para surtir su tienda D. mercadería nueva, para darle un empujón a su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria Elena P. D. A. resides in the municipality of Armenia in the state of Sonsonate. At 60 years of age, she lives with her husband Sixto. He helps her to manage a business, which is a store selling consumer goods at the Armenia market. They work together daily in order to live and cover their expenses. Maria Elena and Sixto request a loan in order to stock their store with new merchandise, so as to give their business a boost and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma G. is from the village of Lao Proper. She is 47 years old. Norma is married and has an adult-aged child. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid her most recent loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory as well as serving as working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Mrs. Anecita M., 33 years of age, is an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC. She is a resident of P5 Garang, Tangub City. Anecita is married to Mr. Larry M. and they have been blessed with 7 children. Her husband is a fisherman with an average income of only P100.00 a day. With this situation, it is hard for them to support the family. She decided to engage in business in order to help her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. With an initial capital of P1,000.00, she started selling her fish from their home. She was able to sustained the business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than P1,000.00 a month in which it contributes to their  family income. She is a new member to the co-op, and has been approved for a loan in the amount of P5,000.00. The loan will be used to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing materials. She is much thankful to PAGLAUM for the trust and the help extended to small entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: Purchasing additional fishing nets and fishing materials

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
la señora Concepcion Y. Umanzor tiene 58 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, pero ahora desea comprar mercaderia nueva como cosmeticos y perfumes.
tiene su negocio desde hace 17 años y opera bajo el nombre de bodeguita conchita , y esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome, doña conchita como es conocida en su centro de trabajo y en su domicilio de la colonia rotaria es una persona muy querida y muy respetada 
por su deseo de superacion y amabilidad, Conchita esta solicitando el credito para comprar productos nuevos y poder aumentar su inventario ya que con sus ganancias mantiene su hogar.
texts.en:
Concepcion Y. Umanzor is 58 and has five children. They are all grown. She sells food products, but she now wants to buy new merchandise like cosmetics and perfumes. She has had her business for 17 years. It is called “Bodequita Conchita”, and it is located inside the municipal market in the city of Nacaoma. Conchita, as she is known in her work center and her home in the Rotaria neighborhood, is a much loved and much respected person for her desire to succeed and her kindness. Conchita is asking for a loan to buy new products to be able to increase her inventory. Her earnings support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Macaulay

texts.en: Macaulay sells frozen foods at retail and wholesale prices to his customers. He is a hard working man and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to make more profit. He is 44 years old, and married with five children. His wife sells sarongs to support the family. He hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more frozen foods to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 40 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a retail seller. His children are still dependent upon him and go to school. Samson is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

Samson mills palm fruits into cooking oil to sell. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. With this business, he supports his wife in meeting the basic needs of the home. He hopes to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase a larger supply of  palm fruit to mill into cooking oil to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit to mill and sell.

loans.name: Ayi Komlanvi

texts.fr: Cet homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits d'alimentation générale dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2002 et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et d'assurer l'éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Il vend des pâtes alimentaires, des tomates en boîte, du lait en poudre, de la mayonnaise et de l'eau minérale. En ce moment certains de ses produits sont en baisse, c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 bidons d'huile, 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires Spaghuetti et 10 cartons de tomates en boîtes. Il a la ferme assurance de pouvoir rembourser son crédit à temps.
texts.en:
This man’s source of income is selling groceries at the Hézdranawoé market in Lomé. This business, launched in 2002, allows him to support his wife and to send his two children to school. He sells pasta, canned tomatoes, powdered milk, mayonnaise and mineral water. At the moment, he is running out of stock on some of his goods, which is why he is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 25 canisters of oil, 10 boxes of spaghetti and 10 boxes of canned tomatoes. He is fully confident in being able to repay his loan on time. Cet homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits d'alimentation générale dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2002 et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et d'assurer l'éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Il vend des pâtes alimentaires, des tomates en boîte, du lait en poudre, de la mayonnaise et de l'eau minérale. En ce moment certains de ses produits sont en baisse, c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 bidons d'huile, 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires Spaghuetti et 10 cartons de tomates en boîtes. Il a la ferme assurance de pouvoir rembourser son crédit à temps.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing groceries

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa Pérez es esposa del señor Leopoldo Regalado y son clientes distinguidos de nuestra institución ya que han tenido dos créditos anteriormente para mejora de su hogar y son muy responsable para sus pagos, el labora para el gobierno y ella tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes. Y están tramitando por tercera ocasión para la mejora de su vivienda ya que desea impermeabilizar el techo ya que por la temporada de lluvia se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Pérez is the wife of Mr. Leopoldo Regalado. They are distinguished clients of our institution who have previously taken out two loan in order to improve their home, and they are very responsible with their payments. He works for the government, and she runs a small grocery store. They are applying for a third home improvement loan. They now wish to waterproof the roof because it has deteriorated due to the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun K. is 48 years old. She is married and has six children, four of whom help their parents farming. The others are attending a local public school. This family is living in Ping Pong village in Takeo province.  She and her husband, Mr. Yor Chen, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land on which to grow rice. For their farming business, they own a plowing machine. Sometimes they can earn a small income from other villagers by hiring out the plowing machine. They now face a problem because their rice field has infertile soil. They do have enough money to fix the soil. Thus, Mrs. Aun K. has decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support their rice field and to increase their rice yield this current year. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Yadira Alicia

texts.es:
El la comarca jícaro bonito del municipio de somotillo la señora Yadira Alicia H. Santeliz, se dedica las actividades agropecuarias como son: la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino, avícola y cultivos como maíz, frijol blanco, y ajonjolí los cuales proveen de los ingresos necesarios para sus necesidades básicas de sus familia la cual la integran tres hijas, ella trabaja de 6 a 3 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
El crédito solicitado será empleado para la compra de un panel solar puesto que en su comarca no existe el servicio eléctrico, de esta forma pretende mejorar las condiciones sociales de su familia.
texts.en:
In the beautiful Jícaro region in the town of Somotillo, Yadira Alicia H. Santeliz works in agriculture, raising cattle, pigs and poultry and cultivating corn, white beans and sesame. This work provides the income needed to provide the basic necessities for her family, which is comprised of 3 daughters. She works from 6am to 3pm each day of the week. The loan requested will be used to buy a solar panel, since in her region electrical services are not available. In this way she aims to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Maria Hermelinda

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín.
Maria es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo tienen un taller de carpintería en su casa, sus productos los comercializa a las tiendas de muebles por mayor.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Maria sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Dolphin Communal Bank.

Maria is married, is 39 years old and has 2 children. She with her husband have a carpenter’s shop in their home, their products are sold to wholesale furniture stores.

Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be used to buy lumber.

Maria dreams to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Juan Pablo II es  uno de los más grandes  y se encuentra en una zona céntrica del centro de la ciudad de El Alto, por esta razón muchas socias llegan con facilidad ya que existe transporte. En este centro focal se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Volver a Empezar la misma que está conformada por 10 integrantes.  Este grupo se ha conformado recientemente y están motivadas a hacer crecer sus negocios, al respecto, ellas tienen variadas actividades económicas como la venta de cosméticos, CDS, ropa, producción de calzados, vajillas, electrodomésticos y comida.
Verónica A.  de 41, es socia antigua ya que ha podido participar de diferentes grupos durante 15 años. Verónica  es madre de dos niñas y tiene el negocio de venta de vajillas hace 17 años, trae su mercadería de Oruro ya que los compra con menor precio  vende todos los días en la Avenida Tihuanaku de la ciudad de El Alto. Verónica también manifiesta  que le gusta compartir con sus amigas y que en Pro Mujer cuidad su salud.
texts.en:
The Juan Pablo II branch office is one of the largest and is located in the Céntrica zone of the city of El Alto, so many members are able to arrive with ease, now that there is transportation available. The “Asociación Comunal Volver a Empezar” (Begin Again Communal Association) is located here and made up of ten members. This group was recently formed and its members are motivated to grow their businesses. These businesses include cosmetic sales, CDs, clothing, shoes, kitchen utensils, small appliances, and food. Verónica is 41 years old and is an experienced member. She has been working with different groups for the past 15 years. She is the single mother of two girls and has had her kitchen utensils business for the past 17 years. She brings her merchandise in from Oruro, where she can buy items for lower prices, and sells them on the Tihuanaku Avenue in El Alto. She also tells us that she likes to spend time with her friends and likes the fact that Pro Mujer helps care for her health.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun V. is 26 years old and married. He and his wife have two lovely young children. Chhun V. owns a cultivating machine that he uses to deliver firewood from the forest to his house and for sale. This is the way Chhun V. earns his daily income, earning $4.30 each day. He is married to San Lang, 22 years old, a vegetable seller.

Unfortunately Chhun V. faces a problem: his cultivating machine has been broken when he uses it to deliver firewood. Because of this obstacle, his income has been affected. Therefore, Chhun V. decided to look a Kiva loan in the amount of $650 to be used to repair his broken machine. Any remaining cash from the loan, Chhun V. will use to increase his business capital. 

Note: Chhun V. was busy when the photo taken so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To repair his broken machine

loans.name: Batuli Salim

texts.en:
Batuli is a 65 year old widowed mother of seven grown up children. She sells charcoal in Kisumu Ndogo, an area within Malindi. Batuli also has built rental houses on her plot to boost her income. She has been in this business for three years and gets KES 6000 profit, monthly.

This loan will enable her to buy more stock of charcoal with KES 15,000 and to repair her rental houses with KES 5000. Batuli had borrowed before with another MFI that, unfortunately, disappeared with clients' savings. She was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She plans to improve the roofing of her house and that of the rental houses with the extra income that she expects to get from this loan. She hopes to build more rental houses and to improve them by providing water and electricity for her tenants.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and to repair rental homes.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 46 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Aquilina (42) y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Todos los días muy temprano, Víctor sale a trabajar sus campos, para él no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa y la alverja, los cuales vende al por mayor en su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene laborando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, ya  lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas. Para el futuro, desea comprar un auto  con el que pueda transportar sus productos.Este es el quinto préstamo de Víctor con MFP, y dice ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, porque es muy alegre.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de alverja, y también comprará abono e insecticidas, para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
46-year old Victor is a simple and hardworking family man. He lives in his own house with his wife Aguilina (42 years) and their four children. Victor wishes to improve their standard of living. Early in the morning every day, he goes to work in his fields. For him there are no rest days as he has to work all the time in order to get good crops. He grows mainly potatoes and peas which he sells wholesale in the town. The aspect of his job that Victor most likes is the freedom of working in his fields where he can enjoy the green countryside. He’s been doing this work for 30 years and thinks that the most difficult part is dealing with infestations of pests. In the future Victor would like to buy a car so he can transport the produce. This is his fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. He says he’s always been punctual with his repayments and expects to be the same this time. He is well-liked by the rest of his community bank friends because of his cheerfulness. With the 2000-sole loan he plans to buy more pea seeds and also fertilizer and insecticide to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pea seeds, fertilizer, insecticide

loans.name: Yehowa Nsa Da So Group

texts.en:
Moses is truly a hard worker. He is 62 years old, a mechanic who repairs electronic appliances such as radios. For the past 38 years, Moses has been repairing radios to make income to support his family. He also engages in farming as his secondary business. He plans to invest the loan to purchase radio parts and electronic accessories to improve his business. His future goals include selling radio sets in addition to the repair work.

Moses is married to a woman who is a farmer. They have seven children from age 9 – 36 years. He says that he dreams of being able to generate enough profit so that he will be able to educate his children to at least the tertiary school level.

Moses is also the group leader of “Yehowa Nsa Da So” (translated as 'Jehovah has a hand in it') borrower group made up of 4 members. The other members have businesses such as the sale of eggs, basket-weaving, and the sale of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase electronic parts in bulk

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 38 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 19 years now.

Elsie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Now Elsie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elsie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo B. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 53 years old and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelo raises rice for sale. Despite the difficulties he faces in his business, he still works hard to provide for his family and sustain them.

Marcelo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marcelo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's school fees and improve his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Keom Youn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Keom Youn R., age 64, is the president selected by the four members of this village bank loan who all live in Lech Buon village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use her portion of the loan to support her own business.

Mrs. Keom Youn R. and her husband, Mr. Sary Doeuk, are Khmer noodle sellers in the local village. With this business, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. To maintain the business, Mrs. Keom Youn R. will use this loan from AMK to build a food stand to sell Khmer noodles. This couple has five children: one is a police officer, two are seamstresses in a garment factory, one works in a company and one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To build a food stand for Khmer noodle selling

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria Elena C. L., tiene la edad de 34 años vive con su pareja de vida en el Barrio Waspan Norte, su esposo es comerciante de electrodomésticos, tienen 3 hijos adolecentes, que estudian la escuela primaria,  ella trabajaba en una zona franca, pero decidió renunciar para comenzar su propio negocio y fue con apoyo de su esposo y la liquidación de ella, que llevaron a cabo este sueño, en el cual se dedican a vender abarrotes, productos personales y de uso doméstico, el negocio les ha brindado buenos resultados y para ofrecer aun mejores productos y variedad, solicitan un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, que beneficie aun mÁs su economía para nuevas fuentes de ingreso,  futuros proyectos personal y/o familiares. Ellos son una familia muy unida que los problemas económicos del pais no los abate y cada dia se esmeran para mejorar continuamenete sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Elena C. López, 34, lives with her husband in the Wespan Norte neighborhood. Her husband is a home appliance merchant and they have three adolescent children who are in elementary school. She used to work in the free zone but decided to resign in order to open her own business. With her severance pay and help from her husband they made this dream come true. They sell groceries, personal use and household items. The store has had good results and, in order to offer a wider variety of stock items, they are asking for a loan to buy merchandise that will be of even greater benefit to their economy providing new sources of income for future personal and family projects. They are a very close-knit family that resists being defeated by the country’s economic problems and every day strive to continuously improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding his field and purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en: Dugersuren S. is 43 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter attends a Bayanzurh district high school while his wife is a handicapped and stays at home. Dugersuren began his printing service business in 2007 in the basement of his house. He is working hard to expand his company although he is still struggling to maintain his business. Dugersuren is a modest person who is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT ($3,000 )to purchase printing equipment in order to increase his work output.

loans.use: To purchase printing equipment

loans.name: Myanzi Mixed Group-Mityana

texts.en:
Twenty thousand shillings weekly profits is what 37-year-old Roset N.’s 15-year-old retail shop business in Myanzi-Mityana generates. Barring the many operational-cost challenges she has been facing, she says she probably would be making more. For a woman whose business pedigree can be traced to a hawking (selling door-to-door or on foot) business, it’s been hard work all this while, with a set objective of firmly establishing and consolidating her modest gains. 

She also operates a modest produce-selling business. This mother of three's business is thriving, though not at the level she likes it too. The root of her problems is that lack of financial muscle to expand or to buy more stock. It was with a friend’s encouragement that she began this business. 

With this loan, Roset is anticipating making bulk purchases of more retail stock. Items like sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, beans, etc., are high on her shopping list. She belongs to the Myanzi Mixed Group.

loans.use: The purchase of sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a twenty-five-year-old single man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He works at one of the local hospitals in Fort Portal, Uganda. Just like many people in Uganda who are in the work force, he is charged back home with taking care of the siblings in case the parents cannot afford to, and that’s where Fred finds himself with the responsibility of educating his younger sister. He however says it’s not easy to make the fees payments of a student at university thus need for a loan. He intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for his younger sister who is at university.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his sister at university

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
J. Shavkat is 33 years old, divorced and has one child. He runs a business raising and selling cattle, and has 17 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Shavkat has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now, Shavkat wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, which is why he applied for a loan of $1100. Shavkat thanks all the lenders for their support.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Avery

texts.en:
Avery T. found a pair of clippers in his father’s closet when he was 11 years old and decided to cut his friend’s hair for fun. To his surprise, it actually looked pretty good! He started doing haircuts for all his friends on a regular basis and when he went to college at Savannah ST. College, he cut hair on the side to make some money. 

When Avery had just a bit too much fun with his college fraternity, Avery’s father convinced him to go into the military. In the military, Avery was the “go-to” barber. He says, “After doing 60 haircuts in a day, I really learned how to cut hair.” When he finished his service in the military in 1988, it was difficult for Avery to find a job he was interested in. His friend convinced him to go to cosmetology school. Avery then obtained his cosmetology license, his barber’s license and, with a scholarship from the school, an instructor’s license. 

Avery and his sister then started a beauty salon that they managed together for 15 years. In 2004, Avery was ready to start his own salon, "The Masters by Avery". He had developed such a loyal clientele that some of his clients helped him start this new business financially. He bought two chairs, two mirrors, two lights, and picnic chairs to begin with. The last-minute medley of furniture  did not deter his clients from coming! Avery continued to add items month by month to have a  salon with more sophisticated amenities. He has over 125 clients, and three stylists rent work-stations in his salon. 

With this loan, Avery plans to replace two dryers, a basin (for washing hair), chairs, and buy a new television for the clients to enjoy. Avery says, “These upgrades will contribute to a more relaxing environment and help put the clients and the stylists more at ease, and even make the stylists more motivated to make the business thrive.”

Avery hopes to build his business’ name into that of a prestigious salon that provides quality service in the Baton Rouge community.

loans.use: Replace two dryers, a basin, chairs, and buy a new television

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucia; ella tiene 48 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de motos el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo ya hace un par de años atrás, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y de esta forma ella saca asu familia adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio con la compra de repuestos para motos,aceite entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is a member of the communal bank LLANKACHINAPAC.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district of Urubamba province, Cusco department.  She is 48 years old, married, with 3 children.  She splits her time between everyday activities and her motorcycle store located in her house, which she has had for 2 years.  She works together with her husband.  She is a hard-working woman, so is able to help support her family.

She is asking for the loan to help her business by purchasing spare parts, such as oil.

She thanks those who form part of her dream, and promises to make payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for motorcycles, such as oil.

loans.name: Joshua Musyoki

texts.en:
Joshua is 42 years old and married to Sarah; they have two children. Joshua has been a maize farmer for a period of two years with an income of about Kshs. 5,000 per month.  

This is his first loan with KADET which he wants to use to buy maize and beans seeds for his farm for the next planting season. He hopes to buy a piece of land and build his residential house in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans seeds for his farm

loans.name: Alfonce Waithome

texts.en:
Alfonce Waithome is 34 years old.  He is married to Mary Kanini and together they have two children, Mwikali and N., aged three and one year respectively.  

He distributes and sells sugar, cooking oil, detergent and other goods along Kangundo, Tala road. Alfonce has been running this business for a period of eight years and his monthly profit is Kshs 15,000. Alfonce was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

This loan of Kshs 30,000 is his third loan from KADET and he plans to use the loan to increase his stock of sugar, cooking oil and detergent. With the increased revenue, he will pay school fees for his children.

Alfonce dreams of having a wholesale shop one day. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stocks of sugar, cooking oil and detergent.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
Ten people are forming a village bank loan; they are located in Chek village in Kandal province. This village selected, Mrs. Keo L., 41 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village will use their portions to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Keo L. is a widow, and she doesn’t have aN. children. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She is a farmer who works very hard with this farming, but she still lacks some money to grow her rice. In order to support her farming crop, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seed for cultivating rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en: Consejo V. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Consejo is married and has two children, aged 15 and 13. To make a living, Consejo plants and harvests rice for sale. Consejo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consejo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Consejo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Consejo from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes is 26 years old and married with one child. She is dedicated to the buying, fattening and slaughtering of pigs, and is also engaged in the profession of nursing. Her husband helps her with her activities.

She wants to improve her quality of life, and so far has saved a little money with which she is building a house. Her requested loan is to replenish the capital in her business.

She said that she is fulfilling her dreams through her efforts and because of the financial support she receives.

loans.use: Buying pigs to raise

loans.name: Ravelin

texts.en:
Ravelin D. is from the village of Namnama, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 40 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Ravelin owns a business planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Ravelin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Ravelin from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. is a widow and has five children. Educated up to senior high school, Esi is the sole breadwinner for her family.
For the past six years, she has been selling plantain and cassava, popular essentials to the Ghanaian diet, in the Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast. 

She intends to expand her business with her loan, which will be used to purchase more cassava and plantain to boost her sales. Any additional profits she makes will be saved up for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and plantain.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K., age 36, deals in the repair and sales of electronic goods in the Kangemi area. This has been his business for the last seven years and he earns a monthly income of Kshs 150,000.
 
Paul is a new client at KADET Ltd and has requested his first loan of Kshs 80,000, which is the highest loan amount available to a new client. He will use it to buy a computer for business communication purposes and to add to his stock of electronic items. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business.

He hopes to expand his business and open a financial institution in future. 

Paul married to two wives, Maryann and Charity, and is the father of two children, ages four and 11.

loans.use: to buy a computer for business communication purposes and to add to his stock of electronic items

loans.name: 19 De Marzo Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "19 D. MARZO " es uno grupo  nuevo D. la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo,  el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco esta representadas por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora NayD. quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta D. lencería D. forma ambulante visitando oficinas y domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, tiene ya muchos clientes que compran su mercadería, con el dinero del crédito comprar mercadería por docenas ya que es mas barato y después venderla a un precio mas alto e incrementar su utilidad. Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Deysi quien es separada con 6 hijos que se encuentra estudiando  y tiene el como actividad un taller D. reparación D. motos que lo atienD. uno D. sus familiares que esta ubicado en la una  avenida muy concurrida, con el dinero del crédito hará algunas reparaciones al taller, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur bank "19 D. MARZO "is a new group, maD. up of responsible, hard working people, and is in its first cycle.  The bank is represented by the following members:

NayD. is the president and leads the group.  She has a linen sales business and sells on foot, visiting offices and homes and offering her services.  She has many steady customers.  She will use the money from this loan to buy items by the dozen because she can get them for better prices this way.  This way she can increase her profits.

Deysi is the treasurer.  She is separated and has six children who attend school.  She has a motorcycle repair shop, run by one of her relatives.  It's located on a busy street.  She will use the money from this loan to make some repairs to the shop.

All of the members are hard working, responsible ladies who are grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to increase inventory and make some repairs

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali G. is a 60-year-old farmer. She lives in the village of Siktarva in the Terjola district. Dali is married and has a daughter, Khatuni, who is 38 years old. Khatuni is unmarried. 

The income of Dali and Ruben’s (husband) family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows. They use the milk to produce traditional Georgian cheese and sell it on the local open market. In addition, they have a small pig-breeding farm with one pig and piglets. Piglets are sold to the wholesaler. Along with the above-mentioned activities, the family has a one-hectare vineyard.  Dali and Ruben produce wine and sell it to the wholesaler. 

Dali requested a loan to build a new cattle-shed where she can have much more than two cows. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cows on her farm and she will need a bigger cattle shed. Cheese produced by Dali is of high quality and is demanded on the local market. According to her estimations, when she has more cows she won’t have problems selling the increased amount of the cheese. It will positively impact her family’s income and they will be able to purchase new items for the household, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Simon Kaila

texts.en:
Simon Kaila O. N. is 34 years old. He is married to Mary N. and they have two children. His monthly income is 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. Farming is doing well is his area due to favorable conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through advertisement done by KADET. He has been a good client who repays his loans well. He has applied for his third loan of KES.80,000 from KADET LTD with which he plans to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution). He is an honest man who will achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessica, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre, se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana y fue su madre quien le enseño a prepararlas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos: plátanos, azúcar, leche y aceite, con la obtención de estos productos mejorara su producción, podrá seguir en el negocio y generar ingresos para el hogar.
Sueña con algún día independizarse y formar su propio hogar, así también crecer con su producción teniendo mejores herramientas.
texts.en:
Yessica is 21 years old, single, and lives with her mother.  Her business is making empanadas and she has been in the business for seven years.  She works every day of the week and it was her mother who taught her how to make them.

Yessica is requesting a loan to buy supplies: plantains, sugar, milk and oil.  The purchase of these products will improve her production.  She will be able to continue in her business and make income for her household.

Yessica dreams of some day becoming independent and forming her own household.  She also dreams of increasing her production and having better tools.

loans.use: to buy supplies: plantains, sugar, milk and oil

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 50 years old and married, with five children aged between 3 and 7 years old. She has three years experience in her business selling Irish potatoes. Her business is well-organized.

Marthe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell. Marthe will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in her business and save for her five children.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ajuntha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 novembre 2009. Le groupe est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère sans enfants. Mais elle à la charge de trois enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de Fruits. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement des enfants qui lui sont confiés) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was set up on 19th November 2009 and is made up of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale trading.

Mariama, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 53 years old, married and is a mother, though she has no children of her own. She has three other children entrusted to her by her relatives.

She sells fruit and is very experienced in this field as she has been carrying it out for several years. This loan will enable her to strengthen her capital and build up her business. The profit she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
Natural  de Maputo, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos  quais não lembra as respectivas idades. Fez a 9ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras,e agora retomou os estudos. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e comerciante a mais de 19 anos e tem um rendimento de 3.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu terceiro emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produto para o seu negocio como:roupas usadas, os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt.
sonho e construir um estabelecimento comercial grande para ampliar o seu negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arminda is from the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is the single mother of 5 children, and she doesn't remember their respective ages.  She finished studying through the ninth grade and stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  Now she is starting her studies again.  She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She never left Maputo.  She has had her business for more than 19 years and makes 3,500 meticals a month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is her third loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products for her business like used clothing.  Her previous loans were for 5,000 and 10,000 meticals.

Her dream is to build a large commercial location to expand her business for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy products for her business like used clothing

loans.name: Bessik

texts.en:
Bessik lives in the village of Tskhratskaro in the Imereti region of Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and lives with his wife, Ekaterine, twelve-year-old son, ten-year-old daughter and his retired parents. His children go to school.

Bessik is a fireman. His job takes a lot of time and energy, but he still finds time for the family’s business. Bessik’s family has two cows, the milk from which they produce cheese and sell locally. They also have one hundred nut trees, the nuts from which they sell locally as well. The total average income of the family is 400 GEL a month.

As their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor, Bessik decided to work as a taxi driver using his own car when he has free time. With the requested loan Bessik plans to purchase a car. According to his estimations he will get approximately 150 GEL in additional income a month.

The increase in the family’s income will allow them to increase their spending and so improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy spare parts for bicycles: breaks, pedals, chains and seats.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, la cual pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

María desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas y patos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
María, 34, lives with her family in her own house which has no basic utilities.  It is located in the rural area of the Mórrope District which belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For many years María has been raising and selling small farm animals such as chickens and ducks.  She has a large pen in back of her house where she gives the animals balanced feed and natural grains so they can reach full development.  The different markets in the area are where she sells the animals to obtain a good income to cover household expenses.

She has requested a loan for 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and feed.  With the income she gets she plans to pay for the loan and improve her lifestyle.  María is very hard working and responsible, with a lot of amibition for getting ahead and improving her economic status.

loans.use: To buy more animals and feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 65-year-old single mother of one son aged thirty-one. She runs a restaurant in Kilifi and her business has been in operation for one and a half years. 

This is her fourth loan to finance her business. She has been loaned 55,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing more seats and tables for her restaurant and iron sheets and a small tent in her restaurant to increase the seating capacity. 

The anticipated profits from her business will be used to repay the loan and to start building rental houses. 

Her dream is to become a successful businesslady and to start an outside catering business.

loans.use: to purchase seats, tables, iron sheets, and a small tent for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her  business premises.

loans.name: Rosmet

texts.es: Rosmet de 28 años de edad  tiene un negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos, negocio que inició hace 8 años, cuando procedente de Arenal en el departamento de Bolívar,  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, en busca de oportunidades para lograr un futuro mejor; fue así como adelantó estudios como técnico automotriz, se graduó  y realizó sus prácticas en una empresa alemana, donde se quedó trabajando , allí se caracterizó por sus habilidades, por ser  un buen empleado y finalmente se independizó,  aplicando a un negocio su liquidación producto de toda su vida. En la actualidad funciona en un parqueadero del barrio,  donde tiene muchos clientes fijos,  entre empresas y particulares, a los cuales les presta el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación automotriz. Sus metas de horro, lo motivan permanentemente a trabajar, para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el comprará repuestos y materiales, para la reparación técnica de vehículos. Mientras Rosmet trabaja para alcanzar sus sueños, maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar  de 15 días, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 26,8% y un margen de contribución del 33,33%, desde el cual proyectamos su crecimiento y auguramos una inversión exitosa de su credikiva
texts.en:
Rosmet is 28 years old. He has a vehicle repair and maintenance business. He started 8 years ago when he came from Arenal, in the department of Bolivar, to the city of Barranquilla in search of opportunities for a better future. He took automotive technician classes, graduated, and then did his apprenticeship in a German business, where he wound up working. While there he was known for his abilities and for being a good employee. Finally, he opened his own business, using all of the money he had saved. He is now working at a parking lot in his neighborhood. He has many permanent customers, both businesses and individuals, that he provides automotive repair and maintenance services. 

His savings goals constantly motivate him to work to achieve his greatest dream, which is to have his own house. He is now applying for his first Kiva-affiliated loan. With it he will buy replacement parts and materials for repairing vehicles. As Rosmet works to achieve his dreams, he manages an accounts payable period of 15 days, a profit margin of 26.8%, and a contribution margin of 33.33%. Based on this, we predict growth of his business and the successful investment of his loan.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and materials for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio desde sus 14 años aprendió el oficio de la panadería, y adquirió mucha expereincia trabajando para muchos negocios de su barrio y posteriormente emprendió el suyo propio con el que ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos que ya trabajan en diferentes empresas. Con sus ahorros de varios años y pequeños prestamos, logró poco a poco comprar toda la infraestructura que se requería para iniciar y crecer. En su barrio lo conocen por los deliciosos panes que ofrece a su clientela, entre los cuales estan, el pan piñita, pan dulce, pan de queso, pan de sal, pan francés, los cuales distribuye entre tiendas de su barrio principalmente y a muchas familias que le compran directamente. Antonio ensena a jóvenes el oficio para que se entusiasmen y en el futuro emprendan  su propio negocio y ganen dinero. Aunque en su area de acción existen varias panaderias, piensa que no le afectan porque el barrio es muy grande y alcanza para todos la demanda. Su creikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará insumos en mayor volumen como harina de trigo, azucar, lacteos, frutas cristalizadas etc. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio para lograr un mejor desempeño en el mercado y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonio learned the bakery trade when he was 14 years old.  He acquired his expertise working for many businesses in his neighborhood and later started his own business which has supported his family, comprised of his wife and two children who work in separate companies.  With his savings of several years and small loans he has been able to buy the infrastructure he needed to get started and grow.  He is known in the neighborhood for the delicious breads he offers customers, among which are "pan piñita", sweet bread, cheese bread, savory bread, and french bread which he distributes to the stores in the neighborhood.  Many families buy from him directly.  

Antonio teaches his trade to young people so they will take an interest in it and begin their own business to earn money.  Although there are several bakeries in the same area, he does not feel there is much competition because the neighborhood is large and there is enough demand for everyone.  The credikiva is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy bulk wheat flour, sugar, dairy products and dried fruits.  His goal is to continue expanding his business to gain a greater market share and increase income.

loans.use: To buy bulk wheat flour, sugar, dairy products and .

loans.name: Kang’Ombe

texts.en:
Kang’ombe is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. She sells firewood in Kilifi, a business that has been in operation for the last five years and it has been a success. 

Kang’ombe has been a KADET client and this marks her second time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to replenish her stock of firewood. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and into the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to be able to distribute firewood to the various schools in her locale.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of firewood.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush is engaged in agricultural business. Siranush would like to enlarge her business, for which she needs sufficient financial means. With the requested loan, Siranush plans to purchase livestock and forage. This will allow her to develop farming and get additional income, which will help her to renovate her house and  sustain improved living conditions for her family.  Siranush lives together with her husband, two children, her mother-in-law and her father-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinebayar is a 26-year-old, and is host of a Vietnam auto-repair service. She lives with her daughter in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When she was a student, she was introduced to, and became friends with, some Vietnam guys.  She started her business with the friends initially. Now there are 3 employees working in her auto-repair service. 

She has a plan to  increase the number of employees in order to expand the business scope.  She will hire 2 employees from Vietnam.  She needs money for expenses related to visa payments, travel to Mongolia, and their salaries.  The loan she is taking will be dedicated to hiring new employees from abroad for her auto-repair service.

loans.use: To hire new employees from abroad for her auto-repair service.

loans.name: Tereza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Tereza , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , juntos a sus dos hijas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar su condiciones de vida ,ella está muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos kiva  ya que con el primer crédito logro realizar un muro de la vivienda lo cual ahora goza de mas privacidad , ahora ella quiere que se le facilite un desembolso para la compra de cerámica y zinc para mejorar las condiciones de vivienda , ya que ella no cuenta con el salario suficiente para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez .
texts.en: Tereza lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with her two daughters.  The plan she has for her family is to improve their standard of living.  She is very happy for the support Afodenic has provided by means of the Kiva loans since, with her first loan, she managed to build a wall around her house that has afforded her more privacy.  Currently, she wants to access loan funds to buy ceramic and zinc to make further improvements to her house since she does not have the income necessary to buy construction materials all at once.

loans.use: buy ceramic and zinc.

loans.name: Sderng

texts.en:
Sderng, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sderng raises animals and her husband buys rice in bulk to resell. 

Sderng is requesting a loan of USD 750 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta diaria de productos nutricionales, la socia vende en forma independiente aún no a podido ampliar su negocio y en esta ocasión desea hacerlo, para ello la socia requiere de comprar productos para implementar su tienda y tambien compra exhibidores para la puesta de los productos.
texts.en: The member continues with her daily business of buying and selling nutritional products.  She sells on an independent basis and still has not been able to expand her business but would like to do so now.  She is requesting a loan to buy products and display cabinets for her store.

loans.use: To buy products and display cabinets for her store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married to a driver and has eight dependents. They live at Akotokyire. 

Vivian sells charcoal. She has been selling charcoal for four years. Vivian uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family.  

She needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 42 years old,  a widow and has two children, a sixteen and a twenty-one year old. She describes herself as an innovative, focused and respectful person. For the last twenty years, she has been involved in a butcher shop where she sells meat. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. She will be using the KES 50,000 loan to buy more meat for selling. In the next five years, Nancy hopes and dreams of running another butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with 5 children, 1 of whom attends school while the others are working. Her husband is employed and contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Riziki has operated a food stall for the past 12 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 22,500 she wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and rice for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and rice for her business.

loans.name: Keyling Fabiola

texts.es: La joven Keyling es Enfemera desde hace 1 año laborando como dependiente de farmacia privada, este credito lo va utilizar para el pago y tramite del diploma de Licenciatura en Enfermeria y agradeca CEPRODEL la oportunidad que le brindaron, primera vez que se le otorga un credito enesta institucion.

loans.use: Pago de tramite de titulo de universidad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants to buy more sacks of sugar, detergents, beverages and flour

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa K. owns a small bedding stand in the town of Devech’s Bazaar. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Latifa wants to be able to increase the diversity of her inventory so that she can attract more customers to her small stand.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory to attract more customers to her bedding stand

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has 7 years experience and knowledge in producing ceramic items such as: souvenirs for marriages, quinceaneras, baptisms, graduation and other events. She learned these skills from a friend. Cecilia considers herself to be an enterprising woman who sees a lucrative business behind this art and so decided to open a small shop. Cecilia placed a small workshop in her home and for 5 years, with her friend's help, has sold some models and with her savings she bought the necessary prime materials to begin her business. Cecilia is well known in her neighborhood and friends from within and outside her neighborhood ask for her to take a commission from them. Cecilia sees customers between 7am and 8pm.

Cecilia is asking for a loan in order to expand her business because her demand has increased and she would also like to remodel her store in order to give a better impression to customers.

Cecilia is a hard working person, she is 40 years old and has 2 children, sho says she needs this loan in order to strenghten her business since the lack of capital has held her back from completing certain commissions, where the investment in prime materials is great. Furthermore, she states that investing more would generate higher profits thus giving a better life to her family as well as food, education and safety.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Cecilia tiene 7 años de experiencia en conocer y producir productos de cerámica. Como: recuerdos de matrimonios, quinceañeras, bautizos, graduaciones y otros. Cecilia aprendió en taller de cerámica de amiga. Cecilia se considera una persona emprendedora por lo que vio en este arte una fuente de ingreso y decido ser una microempresaria. Cecilia puso en su domicilio su pequeño taller y desde hace 5 años con ayuda de su amiga que le vendió ciertos moldes y con ahorro de ella compro la materia prima necesaria para dar inicio a su negocio. Cecilia como era conocida en su sector sus amigos dentro y fuera del sector le hacen pedidos. Cecilia atiende a su clientela desde la 7 AM a 20PM

Cecilia solicita préstamo para incrementar su negocio debido a que su demanda ha crecido y también quiere readecuar su local para dar una mejor imagen a sus clientes

Cecilia es una persona trabajadora tiene 40 años y 2 hijos indica que necesita crédito para de esta manera seguir fortaleciendo su negocio ya que la falta de capital no le permite cumplir con ciertos pedidos donde la inversión en materia prima es mayor. Además ella indica que invirtiendo mas generaría mas ingresos adicionales y daría mejor bienestar a su familia tanto en alimentación, educación y seguridad a su hogar .

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en: Mrs. Nghem T. is 44 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by making wine, raising pigs and growing a variety of crops. With this business activity, the couple typically makes around $4/day in revenue. In order to maximize farm production, Nghem T. is currently requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a tractor in order to prepare her productive soil for the new seeds. In the future, this couple would like to add more pigs, so that they will make additional profits for the next few years.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Hanu

texts.fr:
At 43 years of age, Mrs. Hanu A. is the fourth wife of her husband. Seven children among the 21 her husband has in total are hers. Each wife takes care of the daily needs and education of her own children. The husband, feeling crushed by the burden of his huge family's needs, has been driven to escape his responsibilities for them.

Hanu's primary financial source of revenue is agriculture, more precisely growing sugar cane--a very difficult job because of the manual labor involved in its cultivation.

In view of the importance of this source of income for Hanu, she would like to enlarge her fields and increase her production. To that end, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 in order to hire some help and procure agricultural inputs (fertilizer, etc.) This will allow her to increase her revenue and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 43 ans, Madame A. Hanu est la 4ème femme de son mari. Elle a sept (7) enfants sur les 21 de son mari. Chaque femme s’occupe des besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et de leur éducation. L’homme écrasé par le poids des charges de sa famille est obligé de fuir ses responsabilités.

Madame A. Hanu a comme principale source de revenu l’agriculture et particulièrement la culture de la canne à sucre. Un travail très difficile à cause de son caractère manuel.

Vu l’importance du revenu que cette activité lui procure, elle désire agrandir le champ et améliorer son rendement. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin de s’attacher le service des métayers et des intrants agricoles. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue d’une bonne amélioration de conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: increasing production of sugar cane so as to improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia is 39 years old, she is the mother of 4 sons who are still at school and on seeing her household expenses were increasing, she decided to help her husband and ventured into business selling products through campaigns, that is to say the sale of seasonal merchandise according to the market demand that already exists.

Otilia travels to the city of Lima to buy her merchandise wholesale and then sells them on holidays in her town, Juliaca. Thanks to this business she obtains a favourable income that allows her to cover the basic necessities of her family. Her wish for the not too distant future is to hire a shop and to sell electrical goods wholesale. She is conscious that in order to turn her dream into reality she has to work harder and save enough to open the longed-for shop.

For the moment she is asking for a loan of 500 dollars, money which she will invest entirely in her current business “Gift Sales”, which in season responds to huge demand. As a result she has committed to repaying the loan in a period of six months. Otilia sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Otilia tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos aún en etapa escolar y al ver que los gastos económicos de su hogar se incrementaban, decidió apoyar a su esposo e incursionó en el negocio de venta de productos por campaña, es decir vende mercadería por temporadas de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado que exista.

Otilia viaja a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercadería al por mayor y los ofrece en los días de feria de su localidad, Juliaca, gracias a este negocio obtiene ingresos económicos favorables que le permiten cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia..El anhelo que tiene para un futuro no muy lejano es alquilar una tienda y vender artefactos eléctricos al por mayor, es consciente que para hacer realidad este sueño tiene que trabajar más y ahorrar lo suficiente para abrir su tan anhelado espacio de ventas.

Por el momento solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá totalmente en su negocio actual “venta de regalos” que en esta temporada tiene gran demanda y acogida. Así mismo se compromete a realizar la devolución del préstamo en un periodo de 6 meses. “Otilia apreciará sinceramente tu ayuda”

loans.use: Purchase of decorations

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is a young woman that it trying to give her two-year-old son the best possible life. She acts as both father and mother to him and this great responsibility drives her to work much harder now that her son is entering his school years. She works hard doing farm work because she has learned these skills at home since she was very little. She still lives at home with her parents and siblings and the only wish that she holds in her heart is to improve her financial situation in order to give her beloved son everything that he needs. She hopes to be successful in order to accomplish the goals she has set for herself and is asking for your noble help to purchase fodder and fertilizer for her livestock. Lidia needs your help and thanks you in advance for your contribution.
