Lidia, es una joven madre que busca darle lo mejor a su pequeño de dos años, ella es padre y madre para él y esta inmensa responsabilidad la lleva a esforzarse mucho más ahora que el pequeño inició su etapa escolar.Trabaja arduamente en las labores agrícolas debido a que aprendió las exigencias de esta labor en el seno de su hogar desde muy pequeña; aún vive en esta casa en compañía de sus padres y hermanos y el único deseo que atesora dentro de su corazón es el de mejorar su situación económica a fin de otorgarle todo lo necesario a su querido hijo.Anhela seguir adelante para alcanzar lo que se ha propuesto y solicita tu noble ayuda para adquirir abono y forraje para su ganado.Lidia necesita tu apoyo y agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder and fertilizer.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla Vanessa is a married woman, mother of two small children. Her children have given her strength to work hard and improve herself, because it has been them who have given her enthusiasm and the will to do better.

For three years now, Karla has worked selling meals and beverages. Her sales have increased through the years, and she has expanded her business and increased her capital, not to mention the quality of the dishes she offers.

Karla Vanessa has worked with CEPRODEL for eighteen months and feels satisfied with the loans she has gotten because they have come at a good time, helping her satisfy the needs of her business and her customers. She has a record of twelve loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Karla Vanessa es una mujer casada madre de dos hijos pequeños. Sus hijos le han dado fuerzas para luchar y desarrollarse ya que han sido ellos los que han logrado su entusiasmo y deseos de progresar.

Desde hace tres años Karla se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, sus ventas han incrementado al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su negocio e incrementando su capital. Sin descartar la calidad de platillos que ofrece.

Karla Vanessa trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dieciocho meses y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a sus clientes. Ella tiene un record de Doce créditos.

loans.use: Invest in her food preparation business (Inversión al negocio)

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba M. is 21 years old, has a high school degree, is not married and has no children. Matluba makes and sells pirozhki (meat, cabbage or mushroom stuffed hand pies) and other baked goods on the market of the city of Tursun-zoda. She has been running her business for the last one and half years. She is planning to use her loan to purchase a large batch of flour for her business. This loan will allow Matluba to increase the amount of baked goods she can sell, and the local merchants will be able to buy fresh pirozhki from her for their lunch. Matluba is planning to pay back her loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудова Матлюба, возраст – 21 год, образование – среднее, не замужем, детей не имеет. Матлюба занимается выпечкой пирожков и других мучных изделий на рынке в городе Турсунзаде.Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 1,5 лет. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести муку для производства своих изделий. Данный кредит даст возможность Матлюба увеличит количество своих продаж, а местные торговцы всегда смогут приобрести у нее свежие пирожки, для того чтобы пообедать. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of flour

loans.name: Comite Los Arrabales Group

texts.en:
This comité of women called “Barrio Los Arrabales” has arisen with the help of another committee of women entrepreneurs. Today this group has nineteen members and their businesses range from convenience stores to hair salons, clothing and food sales, and mending and making clothing.

These women do what they can to keep the money coming in. They all support each other by working in this committee and together they ask for loans and pay their loans back. This system works because they are all friends who are invested in each other’s businesses and who care about each other’s personal lives.

The women are asking for a loan today to keep their businesses running. The money will be divided amongst the women according to how much each needs and will be used to buy ingredients for preparing food, for clothing, and household goods.

loans.use: To buy flour, canned goods, milk, drinks, pieces of clothing, buttons, zippers, thread, fabric, shoes, hair products, baked goods, and baking ingredients.

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es:
Gilber is 30 years old and he is single. He is a young man with many objectives and to reach each of his objectives he works very hard. He is a driver of a motocycle that he uses to transport passengers. He wants to buy spare parts for his “Mototaxi” and then to have it repair with the intention to keep up his work load and be able to reach each of his goals. He hopes to have the disinterested help of your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilber, de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, es un joven con muchos objetivos y para conseguir cada uno de sus objetivos se esfuerza mucho. Él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (chofer). Quiere comprar repuestos para su mototaxi para luego mandarlo a reparar con el objetivo de seguir manteniendo su ritmo de trabajo y alcanzar cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto.Él espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for the motorcyle used to transport passangers.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a self-employed taxi driver. A former military man, he decided to start driving a taxi to earn extra income after he retired. Igor works in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He partners with a radio dispatching company which helps to ensure he has a good supply of customers needing transportation. Igor is married and has two teenage children, a son and a daughter.

Igor has requested a short term loan to have some repairs done to the gear shift on his taxi as well as some other minor repairs. This is Igor’s first loan from Nadiya Ukraine. He was recommended by a fellow taxi driver. We are happy to be able to help Igor maintain his vehicle so he can continue earning a good income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Victoria M., who is married and has one child, aged 13. In 2005, Victoria established her household goods business. Working 8 hours a day, 6 days a week, she earns about $70 every month from this business. Victoria now requires a loan in order to purchase additional charcoal, cooking pots, and other utensils. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal, cooking pots and other utensils.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. Moussa Koné, 28, is single and has no children. He lives with his uncle in the Hérémakono-North neighborhood of Bougouni. He stopped school at a very young age to learn photography with his cousin for 5 years.

With 7 years' experience, Mr. Moussa Koné is very knowledgeable in this business. Since he has a photography studio on the side of the international road between Mali and the Ivory Coast, his clientele is continually growing. Besides photography, there is also a lot of demand for Play Station. To acquire this equipment, Mr. Koné decided to look into additional financing through the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan of US$ 475, he intends to buy a professional camera and a television for pay-as-you-go Play Station.

His clientele is composed of city people and rural folks, in as far as photography is concerned. For Play Station, the clientele is school-age children.

He expects to make a monthly profit of US$ 180 with which he will make payments on the loan and contribute to family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Moussa Koné est un célibataire sans enfant de 28 ans qui vit chez son oncle dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. Il abandonna l’école dès son jeune âge au profit de la Photographie qu’il a appris avec son cousin et cela pendant 5 ans.

Avec une experience de 7 ans, Monsieur Moussa Koné maîtrise cette activité dans son détail et dans sa specificité. Disposant d’un studio photo au bord de la route internationale reliant le Mali à la république de Cote d’Ivoire, sa clientèle est en forte croissance. En plus de la photo, la demande de Jeux Play Station est forte. Pour acquérir ces équipements Monsieur Koné décida de rechercher des ressources financières additionnelles auprès de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce pret de 200.000 FCFA, Il compte achéter un appareil photo professionnel et un Téléviseur pour les Jeux play station payant.

Sa clientèle est constituée de citadains et de ruraux pour la photographie. Pour les jeux play station la clientèle est constituée de jeunes scolaires.

Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA avec lequel il payera les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses dela famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a professional camera and a television

Achat d’un Appareil Photo et un Téléviseur.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana is 38 years old, studied until sixth grade, is married and has five children (1 girl and 4 boys) who are all dependent on her.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Andres Santa Cruz de Chuachua, in the Central village of the same name, in the district of Zepita, provice of Chucuito - Juli and the region of Puno. With the first loan she received of S/.300.00 Peruvain Soles, she invested in the purchasing of merchandise for the store she has had for the past three years. The money was only enough to purchase 1 bag of sufar, 1 bag of rice and three boxes of soft drinks.

With the loan of S/.2,500.00 Peruvian Soles ($ 900), which she will repay in four months time, she would purchase three or four boxes of soft drinks, one bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar and two crates of cookies/biscuits, among other things. Half of the money would be used to purchase a cow to fatten. Her children already help her in the businesses that she takes on.

She is very happy because the businesses she has are going well. Previously she had to ask her husband for money, currently she always has money in order to settle the food expenses of her children. Additionally, she is increasing her initial capital.

Her dream is to have a well equipped store, to continue to increase the amount of money she makes and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria, es casada y madre de 5 hijos (01 mujer y cuatro varones), quienes aún depende de ella. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua, del Centro poblado del mismo nombre, del distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región de Puno. Con su préstamo inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en la compra de mercadería para la tienda que tiene hace tres años, el dinero solo alcanzó para 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz y 3 paquetes de gaseosas. Con el préstamo de S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 3 paquetes de gaseosas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de galletas, 4 paquetes de gaseosas, entres otros y con la mitad comprará una vaca para el engorde, ya que sus hijos le ayudan en los negocios que emprendió. Ella esta muy contenta porque en los negocios que tiene le va bien, antes ella miraba solo al esposo para que le diera el dinero, en la actualidad siempre tiene dinero para solventar sus gastos de alimentación de sus hijos. Además está incrementando su capital inicial. Su mayor sueño es tener una tienda grande bien equipada, continuar con el engorde de ganado vacuno y sean profesionales sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase diverse articles (groceries)

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en:
Nasimjon D. is 42 years old. He is married and the father of three wonderful children. In February of 1998, Nasimjon was unemployed. One of his friend invited him to start up a business repairing and making furniture. This was something new for him but he decided to try. Fortunately everything went well and the customers were convinced about the quality of the products he recommended to everybody. His portfolio of clients is increasing and he feels very proud of his achievements. 

Since Nasimjon has a lot of customers, the business is very successful and brings in stable and significant income allowing him to improve living conditions for his family. Today Nasimjon is requesting 600 US Dollars to purchase wood and other supplies for making furniture. He would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Nasimjon is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Nasimjon’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing wood and supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Flor Elicenda

texts.es:
La señora Flor Elicenda B. V. tiene treintainueve años, vive en la avenida Campo Bello sin número del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió la primaria completa y ya no pudo seguir estudiando porque en Mache no había como continuar porque no había secundaria.
Se casó muy joven con Hernando Mendocilla y con él tienen cinco hijos, él mayor trabaja independientemente y los otros cuatro todavía son estudiantes.
Flor, compra cerdos, los alimenta hasta lograr un buen peso y luego los vende en carne, así obtiene mayores ganancias.
Hace cuatro años Manuela Ramos le prestó 300 soles y con ello compró cinco cerdos los que engordo y vendió a muy buen precio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará cinco cerdos pequeños, los engordará y venderá en carne.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas y es una socia muy cumplida.
Flor sueña con ir de paseo a la Argentina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Elicenda B. V. is 39 years old and lives on Bella Campo street in Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed primary school, but was unable to continue her studies since there is no secondary school in Mache. She married Hernando Mendocilla when she was very young, and the couple has five children. Her oldest child works and is independent, while the others are still in school.

Flor buys pigs, feeds them until they reach a good weight, then sells their meat for a profit. Four years ago, Manuela Ramos lent her 300 soles (about US $100), which she used to buy five pigs, which she fattened up and sold for a very good price. With this loan of 800 soles (about US $275), she will buy five piglets, which she will fatten and sell for meat.

Flor belongs to the Progresista Communal Bank (a group loan), where she is a very reliable participant. She dreams of vacationing in Argentina someday.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive de forma independiente en un cuarto que alquilo. Se dedica a brindar servicio de Mototaxi por las principales calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, para poder mantenerse económicamente, ya que dado que vive solo, vela por sus gastos de alimentación y vivienda.  Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años, cuando pudo adquirir mediante mucho esfuerzo su motocarro, desde entonces le ha puesto muchas ganas para sacarle el máximo provecho, trabajando diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta llegada la noche.  Lo que le gusta a Julio es el dinamismo de su trabajo, tener que trasladar a las personas a diferentes lugares hace que su trabajo no sea rutinario.  Lo difícil es tener que lidiar con algunos caminos en mal estado, o los que son un poco peligrosos en horas de la noche. Viene esforzándose así, para labrarse un mejor porvenir. Con el dinero que Julio solicita arreglará su motocarro, para brindar un mejor servicio a la población. En el futuro, quiere tener una empresa de mototaxis, contratando a personal que así como él, quiera iniciarse en este oficio.
texts.en:
Julio is 28 years old, single, and lives on his own in a rented room. He makes a living by offering taxi services in the main streets of the city Juliaca in order to support himself economically. Because he lives alone, he is responsible for his living and food expenses. Julio started this occupation 6 years ago when he was able to purchase a taxi car. Since then, he has put much effort into maximizing the benefits, working daily from 8:00 in the morning until dusk. Julio likes the dynamics of his job, having a cross section of people from different places and not conforming to a set routine. The difficulty is fighting the streets in poor condition, or those that are very dangerous at night. He is trying now to build a better future for himself. With the money that Julio is requesting, he will fix his taxi so that he can offer a better service to the public. In the future, he would like to have his own business of taxis, hiring people that are like him, who would want to establish themselves in this occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his taxi, with which he provides transport to the public

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Pastaza ubicado con PSJ. Abraham Valdelomar Mz. C Lt. 8 AAHH. Octavio Monteverde, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de carros. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio. En las mañanas se va al mercado a comprar lo necesario para preparar sus deliciosos platos de comida.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 3 kilos de pescado, 2 kilos de carne, verduras y otros.  

Sara agradece al banco comunal porque su negocio ha mejorado. Gracias a sus ganancias tiene la oportunidad de darle a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sara belongs to the Pastaza Community Bank. She lives at PSJ. Abraham Valdelomar Mz. C Lt. 8 AAHH. Octavio Monteverde, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Ucayali. Sara is 43 years old and the mother of five. Three of her children are grown and two still depend on her. Sara is married and her husband works as a car mechanic. Sara used her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for two years. Sara still manages her food sales business. In the mornings she goes to the market to buy the ingredients for her delicious dishes. With this loan of 1,800 soles, Sara will buy five kilos of rice, three kilos of fish, two kilos of meat, vegetables, and other items. Sara thanks the community bank because her business has improved. Thanks to her earnings she has the opportunity to give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sara will buy five kilos of rice, three kilos of fish, two kilos of meat, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A., a 38-year-old mother, is selling cakes in Calumpang, General Santos City. She knows well that with her husband's income as a carpenter, they could hardly provide for their family's needs. Together, they began making cakes and selling them to the neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional kitchen utensils and stock for her cake business. She aspires to having her own stall to display her cakes to attract customers for volume orders.

“I love cakes, This is where I get money to spend for my family”, she said. “I really wanted to raise my son well and provide him a good future”, she added.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchen utensils and stock

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 32-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Simon has been working as a taxi driver for fifteen years. He requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his taxi cab. This is the first time that Simon has requested a loan.

Simon is speciA. in his work because his car is still in good condition and is clean. His clients are friends, family members, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, it was difficult for Simon to save money in order for him to purchase his own taxi cab. In the future, he plans to buy a new car.

loans.use: Simon will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his taxi cab.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu Y. is a 52-year-old mother of 5 children. Two have successfully completed their university education, and the rest are in senior and junior high. She lives and works in Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Alimatu lives with her husband, who is also a trader in the village. Alimatu is very hardworking and resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal and the sale of maize in her neighborhood market. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes.

Alimatu obtains her supply of charcoal and bags of maize from the surrounding villages of Abofour, where she lives and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal and bags of maize to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees.

Alimatu belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She hopes to receive GH450 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal and bags of maize

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana F., a resident of Garang, Tangub City, is married with 4 children. One of her sons is mentally incapacitated since birth. Her husband is a farmer by profession. She received a loan with Pagalum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the amount of Php 5,000 as additional capital for her vegetable vending. She is also a member of another financial institution, but she stopped her membership with said institution and focused on Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She hopes that her business will prosper in the future so that she can send her children to school, and moreover, to give her family a decent life.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for vending

loans.name: Mrs. Phen Yoeng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people living in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phen Y. is the 46-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land wheR. she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing moR. vegetables to R.-sell to earn moR. income to support her family. Mrs. Phen Y. is a widow with two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Purchasing more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 59 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y su hija. Hace 3 años decidió iniciar un negocio D. venta D. carne, atienD. todas las mañanas para abastecer a las amas D. casa D. este producto D. primera necesidad. Cirila ofrece carnes D. diversas variedades como res, pollo, pescado entre otros. Su puesto está ubicado en un mercadillo cercano a su casa, las ventas son muy buenas, por esa razón su esposo y su hija siempre la ayudan en la atención. Es la segunda vez que Cirila está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una D. las integrantes D. su banco comunal que promueve las buenas relaciones interpersonales en su grupo y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. La cantidad requerida será utilizada en la compra D. más mercadería, además D. mejorar la infraestructura D. su puesto D. ventas.
texts.en:
Cirila is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. Three years ago she decided to start her own business selling meat, working every morning to supply this important product to housewives. Cirila sells different types of meat including beef, chicken, and fish. Her stall is in the little market near her house. She has good sales, which is why her husband and her daughter always help her out.

This is the second time that Cirila is requesting a loan from MFP. In her communal bank, she is one of the membmers who promotes good intra-group relations. She promises to be punctual with her payments. The amount she requests will be used to buy more merchandise, in addition to improving the set-up of her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch K. is a forty one year old married man and a father of six children; three sons and three daughters. According to him, his youngest children have yet to start school. The older children are in the junior high and primary school. His wife trades in food stuffs. Enoch lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment, in a town called Achiase. Achiase is in a farming area and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Enoch runs a provision store which is located on the main street. He also sells food stuffs. He procures his goods from suppliers who deliver in vans and sometimes he must travel to nearby larger towns to buy supplies.

Enoch has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his inventory. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for his shop

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Назаров Абдусамад- мужчина 44 лет. Женат отец  2-х детей. Абдусамад занимается откормом скота. Также  Абдумачид имеет магазин хозяйственных товаров. Абдумачид на хочет купить овец  на полученный займ. Также у Абдумачида имеет 10 коз которые пасутся  в горах у чабанов. У Абдусамад друг мясник которому он сдает свой скот для убой. Абдусамад признателен нашей организации за полученный займ ему полностью нравятся все наши условия.
texts.en:
Abdusamad Hazarov is a 44 year old man. He is married and is the father of 2 children. Abdusamad fattens livestock. Also, Abdumasad has a store selling household products. Abdusamad would like to purchase sheep using his loan. He also has 10 goats that are out to pasture in the mountains with the shepherds. Abdumasad has a friend who is a butcher to whom he gives his livestock to butcher. Abdumasad is grateful to our organization for the loan that he received and he completely likes our terms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Maura Mercedes

texts.es: Maura Mercedes R. López tiene 47 años, es una mujer casada. Y que le gusta su trabajo. La actividad económica es la venta de medicina de manera ambulante. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Maura es una mujer muy luchadora y siempre le ha gustado trabajar, a pesar de su trabajo implica caminar muchas cuadras, además viaja en los diferentes buses para ofrecer sus productos y cada día que pasa incrementan sus clientes, y ella le brinda el mejor medicamento que ellos necesitan. Esto le ha permitido sobrevivir en la vida y poder mantener su negocio. El dinero lo solicita para ampliar su capital de trabajo. El mayor sueño es poseer un casa propia en la que pueda vivir feliz y cómodamente.
texts.en:
Maura Mercedes R. López is 47 years old. She is a married woman and she likes her work. Her job is selling medicine as a street vendor. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Maura has a lot of fight in her. She has always liked working even though her job means walking many blocks. She even travels on different busses to sell her products. Each day that goes by she increases her customers and she offers them the best medicine that they need. This has helped her survive and keep up her business. She is applying for money to increase her working capital. Her biggest dream is to own her own house where she can live happily and comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shamsa Kanwal Muhammad Latif Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji and Anwar rani baji each want a loan to buy biscuits (cookies) and chips for their canteen.

Khushboo baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shamsa kanwal baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past eighteen years. She operates a clothes-sewing business. In Pakistan most ladies prefer to do this business because their families don’t allow them to go outside for work.

Her husband’s name is M. L. and he runs a business making and selling plastic bags. He has been in this business for the past six years. She is applying for a loan to buy plastic beans for making her husband’s plastic bags.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for her husband's business making plastic bags

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza A., from the village of Zone 14, Kabacsanan, Iligan City, is a 41-year-old married mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Riza buys green bananas and sells them in the local community. Riza has been engaged in her business for over a year, earning approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In June 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to expand the business. This will be Riza's first loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Zone 14, Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru: Хаитгул Махмадиева проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 51 год. Замужем, имеет  2 детей. Муж работает "прорабом". Сама клиентка имеет маленькую торговую точку, где торгует разными мелочами. Например: жевательной резинкой, печеньями, конфетами и т.д. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Haitgul M. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 51 years, married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a foreman. The client has a small retail stand where she sells various items, such as chewing gum, cookies, candies, etc. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ada Luisa

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92666&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Ada es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Ada es viuda, tiene 69 años, 9 hijos, él última tiene 35 años, todos son mayores y están casados. 
Ada hace un año puso una  bodeguita en su casa, y ha puesto nuevamente un Internet en el segundo piso de su casa, su hija se encarga de atender.
Los prestamos han ayudado a que ella nuevamente pueda levantarse a pesar de los dificultades que ha tenido.  
Ada necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para su bodega  va comprar cerveza, gaseosa, azúcar, y  arroz.
El sueño de Ada es que su negocio crezca nuevamente y que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su negocio.
texts.en:
Previous Loan
Ada is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Community Bank.
Ada is a 69-year-old widow with nine grown and married children, the youngest of whom is 35 years old.
Ada opened a small store in her home a year ago. Her daughter attends to the re-installed Internet café on the second floor.
The loans have helped her raise herself up again despite all the difficulties that she has had.
Ada needs a 2800 PEN loan to purchase beer, soft drinks, sugar and rice for her store.
Ada dreams of growing her business again and of her children having their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks and sugar

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. lives in the village of Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and expand her business. She is applying for a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional income generated by this loan to continue to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en: M. Nasibakhon is 39 years old and is married with four children. Nasibakhon sells dried fruit in the central local market and has been in this business already for eleven years. In Tajikistan people are extremely hospitable. When there are visitors any hostess will serve the table with the national bread, “lepeshka”, tea, candies and dried fruit. Nasibakhon tries to have the wide range of goods and serves her clients with a smile. Her business is stable and generates a considerable income for the family. Today, Nasibakhon requests 5,000 Somoni to purchase dried fruit like raisins, apricots and almonds, as well as pistachios and peanuts to increase her range of goods. Having proved herself as a reliable client, Nasibakhon promises to also repay the current loan in a timely manner. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried fruit and nuts

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena L. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Azucena is single. To make a living, Azucena runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income from the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Azucena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (about $84 US) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Azucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Azucena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Azucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: uso personal

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро Шарипова проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в местной щколе. Сама Зухро имеет среднее образование. Она более 15 лет занимается животноводством, откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Zuhro S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works at a local school. Zuhro has secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. She raises and sells livestock. Zuhro is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Zenith

texts.es: La señora Zenith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Zenith, es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a la venta de combustible, hace tres años a tras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace. En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 50 cilindros de combustible cada quincena como; kerosene, gasolina y petróleo.Zenith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Zenith is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón San Roque”, which is located in the District of Sacanche, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 2 dependent children.

Zenith is a strong-willed woman who has been selling fuel for three years. She has not had any difficulty succeeding in her work and says that she is happy with what she has achieved. Her customers know her well and come by her vending post daily to buy her products. Zenith welcomes them personally with her charming personality.

With this loan of 3000 soles, Zenith will purchase 50 cylinders of fuel every two weeks. These products include kerosene, gasoline, and petroleum. She is a very accomplished woman today and is eager to continue forward as long as God provides her the strength. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barrels of fuel

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel V. Ramírez de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Reina posee una tienda y panadería en su casa, en la cual su esposo le ayuda, debido a que este es la única entrada económica con la que cuentan, ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos como refrescos y golosinas para la tienda y así mismo comprar materia prima para la panadería. Reina y su esposo cuentan con una familia muy extensa, la cual les impulsa a seguir adelante cada día y a esforzarse más por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel V. Ramírez, 33, lives in Arce city in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and their five minor children who attend school. Reina has a store and a bakery in her house. Her husband helps her because this is the only economic income they have. She is asking for a loan to buy products like soft drinks and sweets for her store. She will also buy raw materials for her bakery. Reina and her husband have a very extensive family. This drives them to get ahead everyday and to put forth more effort to give their children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make bread

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Mr. T. Geofrey owns a tailoring workshop in Ibanda town, Main Street. He has been in this business for over sixteen years. His experience has enabled him to produce quality work hence hoping to attract more customers.

Geofrey is forty-one years of age and is married with five children of whom four are in school.

Geofrey wants to use the loan to purchase more cloth for his shop for different designs.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for his shop for different designs

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda de 37 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.En una  gasolinera  se encuentra el puesto de golosinas de Hermelinda; todos los días aprovecha que los buses interprovinciales se detienen para cargar de combustibles, es entonces cuando ella ofrece sus productos a los pasajeros, quienes no pierden la oportunidad de comprarse algo para el largo camino.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo libre para dedicarse a las labores de su hogar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender rápido sus golosinas, ya que los buses no le dan mucho tiempo. Para el futuro tiene planeado seguir trabajando duro y así con mucho esfuerzo mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Es el primer préstamo de Hermelinda con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo además  esta dispuesta a ahorrar para cancelarlo ,es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por la demás socias.Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 37 years old and is a very hardworking and unassuming woman. She lives in a house with one of her relatives and her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. Herminda runs a sweets stand at a gas station. Every day she takes advantage of the interprovincial buses that stop there to refuel. This is when she offers her products to passengers who don't lose the opportunity to buy something for the long journey. What she likes most about her job is that it gives her time to dedicate herself to household tasks. She has worked at this job for 10 years, and thinks that the most difficult part is to have to sell her sweets quickly, as the buses don't give her much time. She plans to keep working hard in the future; with hard work she will be able to increase her income. This is Hermelinda's first loan with MFP and she knows she will have to pay it back on time. Furthermore, she is prepared to save money in order to pay it back. She is a very happy member of her communal bank and is loved by the other members. With the 700 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more sweets to better stock her stand and gain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to stock her business

loans.name: Fernanda Estefania

texts.es:
El banco comunal Totoracocha, esta formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad que enamora por su Centro Histórico, su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, se encuentra bañada por cuatro ríos y es una ciudad sin igual, nuestras socias mujeres luchadoras que  siempre buscan la manera de brindar a su familia un mejor futuro.

Fernanda T.  es una de las socias mas jóvenes, con apenas 19 años  se encuentra en su tercer ciclo con el banco comunal, los préstamos recibidos de la Fundación le  han beneficiado para comprar la  mercadería para su negocio ya que  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo  de ropa en el mercado 10 de Agosto en su  puesto de venta, lleva cinco años  en esta actividad  y nos comenta que las ventas han bajado un poco pero espera que pronto todo vuelva a la normalidad, labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. 

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar blusas, casacas, pantalones, ropa interior, calentadores y más para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su meta es tener un local más grande  con un stock surtido de ropa y superarse cada día más.
texts.en:
The Totoracocha communal bank is in Cuenca, a city that you fall in love with because of its historic city center, its culture, traditions and gastronomy. It is bathed by four rivers and is a city unlike any other. The members are hard-working women who are always seeking ways to improve their family's life for a better future. Fernanda T. is on the the youngest members; she's only 19. This is her third loan cycle with the bank. Previous loans have been used to buy merchandise for her clothing stall in the 19 de Agosto market. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and she tells us that sales have fallen a bit but she hopes they will return to normal soon. She works from 8 until 6. The funding will be used to buy blouses, jackets, pants, underwear and leg warmers and more for women, men and children. Her goal is to have a larger, better-stocked stall so that she can improve more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, jackets, pants, underwear, leg warmers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 37 years old, married to Margaret Muthoni, and has three school-aged children. He has been offering motorbike transport for the last five months. A friend introduced Paul to Kiva partner, KADET, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a helmet for his passenger and also purchase a PSV (Public Service Vehicle) license for his motorbike with this loan.
In the future, Paul hopes to buy a car for a taxi business – this will increase his net income and help him take good care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a new helmet and a PSV license

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal es casado con la Sra. Celia hace varios años tienen 4 hijos mayores todos ya están casado e independientes de ellos.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando han  educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El Sr. Anibal además de la despensa trabaja como Guardia de seguridad.
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Anibal has ben married to Celia for several years; they have 4 adult children who are married and independent of their parents. Together, they set up a grocery store in their home, which is located in a densely populated neighborhood of the area; they started out with a small amount of capital that they earned from prior salaried jobs. Thanks to the work they have done they managed to educate their children and have bought all that they have needed for their home. Anibal, besides working the store, is employed as a security guard. He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person with respect to the commitments he takes on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise: sugar, rice, pasta, soaps. etc.

loans.name: Mr. Sam Uon Pum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Prasat village, Kandal province have formed a village bank to request a loan, which they will all use for different purposes. Mr. Sam U. P. has been chosen by the other members to act as the village bank president. He is a construction worker; his wife, Mrs. Sokey Phei, is an employee at a garment factory. He is the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled at the local public school, while the other is too young to attend school or go to work. 

Their family has problems with their crops being damaged by animals near their house.  Mr. Sam U. P. is seeking a loan to construct an enclosure around his house to protect their crops.

loans.use: To construct an enclosure to protect crops

loans.name: Marlin Jony

texts.es: El cliente es de oficio comerciante, trabaja en coordinación con su esposo, en el negocio de compra y destace de cerdo. Vende en su casa la carne y los derivados del cedo como: chicharrón, frito, rebano, nacatamales y otros. El cliente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 11 y 7 años, de las utilidades del negocio mantienen la educación de ellos, y para los gastos de la casa. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos para mejorar sus ingresos o utilidades, ya que con el dinero en la mano pueden negociar mejor precio del cerdo.
texts.en:
The client works in sales with her husband, in a business selling and butchering pork. She sells the meat and products like: pork rinds, nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and other products at her house. The client has two school-aged children, ages 11 and 7. The profits from the business support the children’s education and the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy pigs to improve their profits, with the money, they can negotiate a better price for the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cerdos para destace to buy pigs to cut up/butcher

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a single mother of two children. Her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Regina takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and feeding the family. Regina owns a stall selling all types fruits and vegetables like passion fruit, watermelon and pineapple and sells to all categories of people at retail only. She works seven days a week. Regina receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for 10 years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 18th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more pineapples, sacks of passion fruit and watermelons. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and go directly to farmers. Her business challenges include transporting the watermelons and seasonality premises. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit, pineapples and watermelons

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr:
Riziki C. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Neema, elle lève sa main sur la photo, avec sourire éclatante,  cliente au 10e cycle, âgée de 35 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants parmi lesquels 4 étudient ,1  reste au village , 2 autres enfants n’étudient pas car ils n’ont pas encore l’âge scolaire . Son mari est chauffeur de taxi bus( transville).
Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Son capital initial était de 50$ .Son business est de vendre les poissons (fumés, salés ou à l’état frais) dans le petit marché du quartier TMK . Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des poissons.
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Riziki C. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  2 paniers des poissons fumés appelés « Moshi » 6 tas de poissons salés appelés « Makayabo », et 30 poissons frais appelés  «  Mbichi mbichi ».
Riziki C. fait également des petits métiers de guérisseur traditionnel (administrer des soins en base des plantes médicinales), tresser les cheveux  pour accroitre son revenu.
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer  l’activité et faire le commerce général de savon en poudre Omo, Huiles végétales, farine, sucrés, etc. 
Riziki C. préférait changer son activité de vente des poissons étant donné qu'elle connait parfois des pertes liées à la pourriture de poissons par manque de chambre froide pour une meilleure conservation de ses produits et  parfois par manque de l’électricité pour le frigo. Elle reste très optimiste en soulignant que pour changer cette activité, il lui faut un capital de 2000, qu’elle ambitionne dans le jour futur.  
 Riziki C. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
Ce groupe Neema est  composé de 7 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Riziki C. is the president of the loan group Neema.  (In the photos, she is the one with her hand raised and a bright smile.)  She is a 10th cycle client who is 35 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Of these seven children, four are studying, one remains in the village, and two other children are not studying, since they are not yet of school age.  Her husband is a bus driver (intercity).  Riziki started her small business with her own funds received from her husband.  Her initial capital amounted to $50.  Her business involves selling fish (smoked, salted, or fresh) in the small market in the TMK district.  She has been in this business of selling fish for ten years.  With the loan from the micro-finance institution Hekima, she wishes to increase her sales by buying two baskets of smoked fish called "moshi", six loads of salted fish called "makayabo", and thirty fresh fish called "mbichi mbichi".  She also has a small practice as a traditional healer (who administers care based on medicinal plants), and she braids hair to increase her income.  In the future, Riziki would prefer to switch from selling fish, since she has sometimes experienced losses from rotten fish due to the lack of cold storage for keeping her goods and sometimes due to the lack electricity for the refrigerator.  She remains optimistic by emphasizing that, to switch businesses, she needs 2,000 in capital, which she plans on having one day.  Riziki expresses her thanks to the MFI Hekima for the loans she receives with no need for any collateral at all because, thanks to these loans, she is managing to provide for her children. This group, Neema, is composed of seven members, most of whom are women. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two baskets of smoked fish, six loads of salted fish, and thirty fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma vive en casa alquilada, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, Sulma se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en la comunidad de Sachabamba a donde viaja dos horas y media semanalmente, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados y también de casa en casa, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito. Además vende ropa que le hacen pedidos sus clientes, y también son al crédito. Sulma pertenece al Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles con lo que comprara quesos y ropa que comprara de la ciudad de Lima.
Sulma sueña con tener una casa propia y educar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sulma lives in a rented home. She lives with her live-in partner and has one son. Sulma sells cheeses which she buys in the town of Sachabamba. She travels two and a half hours every week to Sachabamba. She makes her sales at the markets and also sells door-to-door. Most of her sales are on credit. She also sells clothing which her clients order. These sales are also on credit. Sulma belongs to the community bank Llapanchik which means "all of us" in Quechua. Sulma needs a loan in the amount of 2000 PEN. She will use this loan to buys cheeses as well as the clothing she buys in Lima. Sulma dreams of having her own home and providing an education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheeses and clothing to re-sell.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
La señora María Elisa tiene 31 años vive con su conviviente y tienen un hijo de 10 años, está en la escuela, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que no cuentan con una casa propia, viven en la casa de sus padres que en el futuro les heredara. La señora María Elisa vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Chinchilla, a media hora de la ciudad.

La principal actividad del cliente es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la producción de productos lácteos, actualmente tiene 5 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, así como también el esposo trabaja de chofer para una persona que se dedica a la venta de agregados.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara su producción y de esa manera mejorara sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es aumentar la producción de la leche, tener una pequeña granja de por lo menos 20 cabezas de ganado lechero y el esposo desea tener su vehículo propio y dedicarse a la misma actividad que realiza su patrón, su meta principal  es realizar una construcción nueva y más amplia en la casita vieja que le heredo sus padres.
texts.en:
María Elisa is 31 years old, she lives with her partner and has a 10 year-old son who goes to school. The economic resources of this family are not many: in fact, as they don’t have a place of their own, they have to live at her parents’ house, that they will inherit in the future. María Elisa lives in the town of Cochabamba, in the Chinchilla community, half-an-hour away from the city. Her main activity is the production of raw milk, that she then brings to a dairy products factory. She now owns 5 heads of cattle, all in the production phase. Her husband works as a driver for a person who sells aggregates. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy one head of cattle in order to increase her production and consequently improve her income. One of her dreams and aims is to increase the milk production and to own a small farm of at least 20 heads of cattle; her husband wishes to own a vehicle of his own and to work independently in the same business of his current employer. They main goal is to build a new and wider room in the old house her parents will leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one head of cattle.

loans.name: Liza Magamay Group

texts.en:
Liza M., from the village of Upper Puntod, is the 35-year-old group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While both members receive an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if delinquency or default occurs.

Liza, who is married and has eight school-aged children, owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Liza's fifth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 42 years old and lives in Arosho, a town in Migori, with his wife Rose Kwamboka and their two children — Joshua 14, and Stephen 12. 

Charles sells tomatoes and is applying for a loan of Kshs 20,000. This is the second loan he will be taking from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first loan. He wants to buy more tomatoes to add to his business since this is the peak season and harvest time and this will give a boost to his profits.

He hopes to buy a grinding machine as a secondary business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to add to his stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and a farming business. She lives in Sitio Balisong, Brgy Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, Maria is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000.

Maria is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can  increase her working capital.  This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  'Dungganon' way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan nació en la provincia de Paruro del departamento del Cusco y tiene 40 años. Actualmente,  Juan vive junto con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en la asociación Puerto Rico del distrito de Poroy de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Juan se dedica  a la compra palos de arboles de eucalipto y los convierte en leña, ella compra arboles de las comunidad de  de Anta, Paruro Ccatca y otros lugares. Ya son varios que trabaja en el negocio y  le va muy bien. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Juan que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear para comprar madera de la montaña. 

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Juan pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and was born in Paruro Province in the Department of Cusco. He currently lives with his wife and four children in the Puerto Rico Association of the Poroy District in the city of Cusco.

Juan buys eucalyptus tree trunks and turns them into firewood. He buys the trees in the communities of Anta, Paruro Ccatca, and other places. Juan has worked in this business for several years and has done very well. With this next loan, Juan will receive 1500 PEN which he will use to buy wood from the mountains.

The Communal Bank “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” has been in existence for 2½ years. Juan has been a member for two years and has performed very well. The name of the Communal Bank is derived from Quechua (an indigenous language) and means “Beautiful Princess of Chinchero”.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood from the mountains

loans.name: Alcibiades

texts.es: El Señor Alcibiades  nacido el 30 de Junio en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Con 5 hijos vive con doña Jesusa nacida en Montero.   Hoy viven en una comunidad distante a 30 km de Limoncito llamado Paso el Chivo en el cual tiene su parcela por dotación del sindicato agrario Paso el Chivo, el vive y trabaja en esa comunidad, siembra maíz, yuca, poroto. El hace 4 años viene trabajando con Emprender, el dinero del crédito será utilizado para la contratación de mano de obra para la preparacion de la tierra y siembra de Maiz.
texts.en:
Señor Alcibiades was born on the 30th of June in the city of Cochabamba. He lives with his 5 children and Jesusa, who was born in Montero. Today they live in a distant community 30 kilometers from Limoncito called Paso el Chivo, where he was allocated a parcel of land from the agricultural union Paso el Chivo. He lives and works in this community, cultivating corn, cassava and beans. He has been working with Emprender for 4 years, and he will use this loan to hire workers to prepare his land and plant corn.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to hire workers to prepare the land and plant corn

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose Y. is from the village of San Isidro. He is 49 years old. Jose is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jose plants and harvest rice for sale. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2010, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Faakhra's Group

texts.en:
Faakhra is the resident of a small housing colony named 77-15L, located in the mid-sized city, Vehari, famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. 
She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and manage the household chores and to take care of her family. 
Her husband operates a small medicine shop in the community. As his community is not based on well-educated families, thats why they had to face problems when they become ill due to the lack of medical clinics in the nearby areas. 
But the problem became solved when M. A. opened a medical shop five years ago and people started getting good advantage by buying medicines from him to timely cure the pains and bad health conditions. Now they have become his regular customers and give him good profit on sales. 
 
Faakhra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s medical shop. With the loan amount, her husband will buy the medicines in bulk quantity to help him to serve his customers by providing them with more medicines.  
Faakhra is very hopeful that this investment will bring positive change to her husband’s business and the household income will grow. 
Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Faakhra”.

loans.use: To buy medicines in bulk quantity for medicine selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fabric for skirts and ingredients

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba C. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Melba is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Melba owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and instant noodles in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melba joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Melba is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Melba from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and working capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco Pérez M. es un joven casado y muy trabajador que tiene una niña pequeña a la que desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. El techo de su vivienda es de madera y necesita colocarse la teja arriba pues para que no se deteriore con las épocas de lluvia y en tiempo de frio no traspase lo helado y se conserve a buena temperatura. Para esto el necesita de su apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Francisco Pérez M. is a young, hard-working, married man.  He has a small daughter for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.  The roof of his house is made from wood and he needs to install tiles on top so that his roof doesn't deteriorate when the weather is rainy and so that when it is cold the frozen air doesn't pass through.  He would like his house to maintain a comfortable temperature.  He needs your help to carry out his project.

loans.use: To fix his roof

loans.name: Martha Angelina

texts.es:
HISTORIA KIVA

L a señora Martha Angelina S.  García tiene 24 años de edad tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, desde pequeña, nos cuenta que su negocio de helados  los inicio hace 6 años.
El propósito de doña Martha S. es poder comprar más mercadería de comestibles para elavorar elados  porque doña Martha  hace sus propios helados.
La señora espera poder seguir adelante con su crédito ya que es lo único medio de ingresos de la señora Martha S.  para poder sostener a su familia ya que los ingresos de su esposo no le alcanzan , agradece el apoyo de Fape y Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Angelina S. García is 24 years old and has three young children. She says that she started an ice cream business six years ago.

Doña Martha plans to buy more ingredients for making her own ice cream since she produces what she sells. She hopes to move forward with this loan since this business is her only source of income. Martha is able to support her family since her husband’s income is not enough. She is grateful for the support from FAPE and Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in making ice cream

loans.name: Nathem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and a married man.

In 2007, Nathem decided to open his own mini-market. Although his shop is small, he is well-known in his local community and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install a canopy outside his shop and buy a refrigerator to allow him to sell frozen meat. He is aiming to extend his store and grow his business.

loans.use: Install a canopy outside his shop and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Kahangi Women In Development Group

texts.en: Evelyne is 40 years of age and a single mother of five children all below 18 years living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda .The responsibility to provide for the family is vested in her and her family dream is to educate her children. She has a retail shop and has been in business for eight years. This has enabled her to work towards her goal of educating the children. She is a member of Kahangi Women in Development, where each member guarantees the other. Evelyn needs to use the loan to buy alcohol to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy alcohol to sell

loans.name: Akbermet's Group

texts.en:
Akbermet A. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 24 and married to a private entrepreneur. Together they are bringing up two daughters who are preschool age (under seven). A year ago with the initial investment of 50,000 soms Akbermet started the wholesale trade of men’s and women’s clothing. She earns 8,000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase festival clothes to sell. In the future Akbermet wants to increase the turnover of her business and build her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: Purchase festival clothes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's children).    

Victoria has a retail shop. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Victoria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. 

She also generates additional income through selling second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Victoria include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own house.   

Victoria lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil and bags of sugar

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her mother. Sauda has a business of selling charcoal and snacks.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products at the market. 

Sauda has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal to resell. The main business challenge for Sauda is seasonality. 

Her goals are to lift herself and her family out of poverty and also to start going to the village of Luwero for charcoal. Sauda lives in a home that she owns. She does not have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., 36, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband transports water to sell, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 60 on other necessary expenses.
